After [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier had danced twice with [[her]52-mrs. pontellier husband]186-her husband , once with [Robert]53-robert , and once with [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle , who was thin and tall and swayed like a reed in the wind when [he]83-monsieur ratignolle danced , [she]52-mrs. pontellier went out on [the gallery]148-the gallery and seated [herself]52-mrs. pontellier on the low window - sill , where [she]52-mrs. pontellier commanded a view of all that went on in [the hall]536-the hall and could look out toward [the Gulf]15-the gulf . There was a soft effulgence in the east . The moon was coming up , and its mystic shimmer was casting a million lights across the distant , restless water .

" Would [you]52-mrs. pontellier like to hear [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz play ? "[53-robert] asked [Robert]53-robert , coming out on [the porch]182-the porch where [she]52-mrs. pontellier was . Of course [Edna]115-edna would like to hear [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz play ; but [she]115-edna feared it would be useless to entreat [her]115-edna .

" [I]53-robert 'll ask [her]84-mademoiselle reisz , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said . " [I]53-robert 'll tell [her]84-mademoiselle reisz that [you]52-mrs. pontellier want to hear [her]84-mademoiselle reisz . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz likes [you]52-mrs. pontellier . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz will come . "[53-robert] [He]53-robert turned and hurried away to one of [the far cottages]589-the far cottages , where [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz was shuffling away . [She]52-mrs. pontellier was dragging a chair in and out of [[her]52-mrs. pontellier room]224-her room , and at intervals objecting to the crying of [a baby]305-a baby , which [a nurse in [the adjoining cottage]593-the adjoining cottage]592-a nurse in the adjoining cottage was endeavoring to put to sleep . [She]52-mrs. pontellier was [a disagreeable little woman , no longer young , who had quarreled with almost every one]594-a disagreeable little woman , no longer young , who had quarreled with almost every one , owing to a temper which was self - assertive and a disposition to trample upon the rights of [others]459-others . [Robert]53-robert prevailed upon [her]52-mrs. pontellier without any too great difficulty .

[She]52-mrs. pontellier entered [the hall]536-the hall with [him]53-robert during a lull in the dance . [She]52-mrs. pontellier made an awkward , imperious little bow as [she]52-mrs. pontellier went in . [She]52-mrs. pontellier was [a homely woman , with a small weazened face and body and eyes that glowed]597-a homely woman , with a small weazened face and body and eyes that glowed . [She]52-mrs. pontellier had absolutely no taste in dress , and wore a batch of rusty black lace with a bunch of artificial violets pinned to the side of [her]52-mrs. pontellier hair .

" Ask [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier what [she]52-mrs. pontellier would like to hear [me]52-mrs. pontellier play , "[52-mrs. pontellier] [she]52-mrs. pontellier requested of [Robert]53-robert . [She]52-mrs. pontellier sat perfectly still before the piano , not touching the keys , while [Robert]53-robert carried [her]52-mrs. pontellier message to [Edna]115-edna at the window . A general air of surprise and genuine satisfaction fell upon [every one]374-every one as [they]599-they saw [the pianist]600-the pianist enter . There was a settling down , and a prevailing air of expectancy everywhere . [Edna]115-edna was a trifle embarrassed at being thus signaled out for [the imperious little woman]601-the imperious little woman 's favor . [She]115-edna would not dare to choose , and begged that [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz would please [herself]84-mademoiselle reisz in [her]84-mademoiselle reisz selections .

[Edna]115-edna was what [she]115-edna [herself]115-edna called very fond of music . Musical strains , well rendered , had a way of evoking pictures in [her]115-edna mind . [She]115-edna sometimes liked to sit in [the room of mornings]602-the room of mornings when [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle played or practiced . One piece which [that lady]309-that lady played [Edna]115-edna had entitled " Solitude . "[115-edna] It was a short , plaintive , minor strain . The name of the piece was something else , but [she]115-edna called it " Solitude . "[115-edna] When [she]115-edna heard it there came before [her]115-edna imagination the figure of [a man]521-a man standing beside [a desolate rock on [the seashore]606-the seashore]605-a desolate rock on the seashore . [He]521-a man was naked . [His]521-a man attitude was one of hopeless resignation as [he]521-a man looked toward a distant bird winging its flight away from [him]521-a man .

Another piece called to [her]115-edna mind [a dainty young woman clad in an Empire gown , taking mincing dancing steps as [she]115-edna came down [a long avenue between tall hedges]608-a long avenue between tall hedges]607-a dainty young woman clad in an empire gown , taking mincing dancing steps as she came down a long avenue between tall hedges . Again , another reminded [her]115-edna of [children]242-children at play , and still another of nothing on [earth]610-earth but [a demure lady stroking a cat]611-a demure lady stroking a cat .

The very first chords which [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz struck upon the piano sent a keen tremor down [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier 's spinal column . It was not the first time [she]115-edna had heard [an artist at the piano]612-an artist at the piano . Perhaps it was the first time [she]115-edna was ready , perhaps the first time [her]115-edna being was tempered to take an impress of the abiding truth .

[She]115-edna waited for the material pictures which [she]115-edna thought would gather and blaze before [her]115-edna imagination . [She]115-edna waited in vain . [She]115-edna saw no pictures of solitude , of hope , of longing , or of despair . But the very passions themselves were aroused within [her]115-edna soul , swaying it , lashing it , as the waves daily beat upon [her]115-edna splendid body . [She]115-edna trembled , [she]115-edna was choking , and the tears blinded [her]115-edna .

[Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz had finished . [She]115-edna arose , and bowing [her]115-edna stiff , lofty bow , [she]115-edna went away , stopping for neither thanks nor applause . As [she]115-edna passed along [the gallery]148-the gallery [she]115-edna patted [Edna]115-edna upon the shoulder .

" Well , how did [you]115-edna like [my]115-edna music ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked . [The young woman]614-the young woman was unable to answer ; [she]614-the young woman pressed the hand of [the pianist]600-the pianist convulsively . [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz perceived [her]614-the young woman agitation and even [her]614-the young woman tears . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz patted [her]115-edna again upon the shoulder as [she]84-mademoiselle reisz said :

" [You]115-edna are the only one worth playing for . Those others ? Bah ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz] and [she]84-mademoiselle reisz went shuffling and sidling on down [the gallery]148-the gallery toward [[her]84-mademoiselle reisz room]224-her room .

But [she]84-mademoiselle reisz was mistaken about " those others . "[84-mademoiselle reisz] [Her]84-mademoiselle reisz playing had aroused a fever of enthusiasm . " What passion ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz] " What [an artist]1765-an artist ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz] " [I]84-mademoiselle reisz have always said [no one]312-no one could play [Chopin]85-chopin like [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz] " That last prelude ! [Bon Dieu]86-bon dieu ! It shakes [a man]521-a man ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

It was growing late , and there was a general disposition to disband . But [some one]538-some one , perhaps it was [Robert]53-robert , thought of a bath at that mystic hour and under that mystic moon .

[X]87-x

At all events [Robert]53-robert proposed it , and there was not a dissenting voice . There was not one but was ready to follow when [he]53-robert led the way . [He]53-robert did not lead the way , however , [he]53-robert directed the way ; and [he]53-robert [himself]53-robert loitered behind with [the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger]619-the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger and hold [themselves]619-the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger apart . [He]53-robert walked between [them]619-the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger , whether with malicious or mischievous intent was not wholly clear , even to [himself]53-robert .

[The Pontelliers]75-the pontelliers and [Ratignolles]100-the ratignolles walked ahead ; [the women]386-the women leaning upon the arms of [[their]386-the women husbands]295-their husbands . [Edna]115-edna could hear [Robert]53-robert 's voice behind [them]619-the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger , and could sometimes hear what [he]53-robert said . [She]115-edna wondered why [he]53-robert did not join [them]619-the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger . It was unlike [him]53-robert not to . Of late [he]53-robert had sometimes held away from [her]115-edna for an entire day , redoubling [his]53-robert devotion upon the next and the next , as though to make up for hours that had been lost . [She]115-edna missed [him]53-robert the days when some pretext served to take [him]53-robert away from [her]115-edna , just as [one]303-one misses the sun on a cloudy day without having thought much about the sun when it was shining .

[The people]623-the people walked in little groups toward [the beach]175-the beach . [They]623-the people talked and laughed ; some of [them]623-the people sang . There was [a band playing down at [[Klein]54-klein 's hotel]190-klein 's hotel]625-a band playing down at klein 's hotel , and the strains reached [them]619-the lovers , who had betrayed a disposition to linger faintly , tempered by the distance . There were strange , rare odors abroad a tangle of the sea smell and of weeds and damp , new - plowed earth , mingled with the heavy perfume of a field of white blossoms somewhere near . But the night sat lightly upon [the sea]253-the sea and [the land]628-the land . There was no weight of darkness ; there were no shadows . The white light of the moon had fallen upon [the world]281-the world like the mystery and the softness of sleep .

[Most of [them]623-the people]630-most of them walked into [the water]188-the water as though into a native element . [The sea]253-the sea was quiet now , and swelled lazily in broad billows that melted into one another and did not break except upon [the beach]175-the beach in little foamy crests that coiled back like slow , white serpents .

[Edna]115-edna had attempted all summer to learn to swim . [She]115-edna had received instructions from both [the men]634-the men and [women]635-women ; in some instances from [the children]239-the children . [Robert]53-robert had pursued a system of lessons almost daily ; and [he]53-robert was nearly at the point of discouragement in realizing the futility of [his]53-robert efforts . A certain ungovernable dread hung about [her]115-edna when in the water , unless there was a hand near by that might reach out and reassure [her]115-edna .

But that night [she]115-edna was like [the little tottering , stumbling , clutching child , who of a sudden realizes its powers , and walks for the first time alone , boldly and with over - confidence]637-the little tottering , stumbling , clutching child , who of a sudden realizes its powers , and walks for the first time alone , boldly and with over - confidence . [She]115-edna could have shouted for joy . [She]115-edna did shout for joy , as with a sweeping stroke or two [she]115-edna lifted [her]115-edna body to the surface of [the water]188-the water .

A feeling of exultation overtook [her]115-edna , as if some power of significant import had been given [her]115-edna to control the working of [her]115-edna body and [her]115-edna soul . [She]115-edna grew daring and reckless , overestimating [her]115-edna strength . [She]115-edna wanted to swim far out , where [no woman]639-no woman had swum before .

[Her]115-edna unlooked - for achievement was the subject of wonder , applause , and admiration . [Each one]640-each one congratulated [himself]640-each one that [his]640-each one special teachings had accomplished this desired end .

" How easy it is ! "[115-edna] [she]115-edna thought . " It is nothing , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said aloud ; " why did [I]115-edna not discover before that it was nothing . Think of the time [I]115-edna have lost splashing about like [a baby]305-a baby ! "[115-edna] [She]115-edna would not join [the groups]641-the groups in [their]641-the groups sports and bouts , but intoxicated with [her]115-edna newly conquered power , [she]115-edna swam out alone .

[She]115-edna turned [her]115-edna face seaward to gather in an impression of space and solitude , which [the vast expanse of water]642-the vast expanse of water , meeting and melting with the moonlit sky , conveyed to [her]115-edna excited fancy . As [she]115-edna swam [she]115-edna seemed to be reaching out for the unlimited in which to lose [herself]115-edna .

Once [she]115-edna turned and looked toward [the shore]643-the shore , toward [the people [she]115-edna had left there]644-the people she had left there . [She]115-edna had not gone any great distance that is , what would have been a great distance for [an experienced swimmer]645-an experienced swimmer . But to [her]115-edna unaccustomed vision the stretch of water behind [her]115-edna assumed the aspect of a barrier which [her]115-edna unaided strength would never be able to overcome .

A quick vision of death smote [her]115-edna soul , and for a second of time appalled and enfeebled [her]115-edna senses . But by an effort [she]115-edna rallied [her]115-edna staggering faculties and managed to regain [the land]628-the land .

[She]115-edna made no mention of [her]115-edna encounter with death and [her]115-edna flash of terror , except to say to [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , " [I]115-edna thought [I]115-edna should have perished out there alone . "[115-edna]

" [You]115-edna were not so very far , [[my]186-her husband dear]1730-my dear ; [I]186-her husband was watching [you]115-edna , "[186-her husband] [he]186-her husband told [her]115-edna .

[Edna]115-edna went at once to [the bath - house]486-the bath - house , and [she]115-edna had put on [her]115-edna dry clothes and was ready to return [home]245-home before [the others]324-the others had left [the water]188-the water . [She]115-edna started to walk away alone . [They]324-the others all called to [her]115-edna and shouted to [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna waved a dissenting hand , and went on , paying no further heed to [their]324-the others renewed cries which sought to detain [her]115-edna .

" Sometimes [I]50-madame lebrun am tempted to think that [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier is capricious , "[50-madame lebrun] said [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun , who was amusing [herself]50-madame lebrun immensely and feared that [Edna]115-edna 's abrupt departure might put an end to the pleasure .

" [I]49-mr. pontellier know [she]52-mrs. pontellier is , "[49-mr. pontellier] assented [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier ; " sometimes , not often . "[49-mr. pontellier]

[Edna]115-edna had not traversed a quarter of the distance on [her]115-edna way [home]245-home before [she]115-edna was overtaken by [Robert]53-robert .

" Did [you]53-robert think [I]115-edna was afraid ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked [him]53-robert , without a shade of annoyance .

" No ; [I]49-mr. pontellier knew [you]53-robert were n't afraid . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Then why did [you]53-robert come ? Why did n't [you]53-robert stay out there with [the others]324-the others ? "[49-mr. pontellier]

" [I]49-mr. pontellier never thought of it . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Thought of what ? "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Of anything . What difference does it make ? "[49-mr. pontellier]

" [I]115-edna 'm very tired , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna uttered , complainingly .

" [I]49-mr. pontellier know [you]53-robert are . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" [You]53-robert do n't know anything about it . Why should [you]53-robert know ? [I]49-mr. pontellier never was so exhausted in [my]49-mr. pontellier life . But it is n't unpleasant . A thousand emotions have swept through [me]49-mr. pontellier to - night . [I]49-mr. pontellier do n't comprehend half of them . Do n't mind what [I]49-mr. pontellier 'm saying ; [I]49-mr. pontellier am just thinking aloud . [I]49-mr. pontellier wonder if [I]49-mr. pontellier shall ever be stirred again as [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's playing moved [me]49-mr. pontellier to - night . [I]49-mr. pontellier wonder if any night on [earth]610-earth will ever again be like this one . It is like a night in a dream . [The people about [me]49-mr. pontellier]1772-the people about me are like [some uncanny , half - human beings]1773-some uncanny , half - human beings . There must be [spirits]1774-spirits abroad to - night . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" There are , "[53-robert] whispered [Robert]53-robert , " Did n't [you]53-robert know this was [the twenty - eighth of August]1775-the twenty - eighth of august ? "[53-robert]

" The twenty - eighth of [August]88-august ? "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Yes . On the twenty - eighth of August , at the hour of midnight , and if the moon is shining the moon must be shining a spirit that has haunted [these shores]1776-these shores for ages rises up from [the Gulf]15-the gulf . With its own penetrating vision the spirit seeks [some one mortal]1777-some one mortal worthy to hold [him]1777-some one mortal company , worthy of being exalted for a few hours into [realms of the semi - celestials]1778-realms of the semi - celestials . [His]53-robert search has always hitherto been fruitless , and [he]53-robert has sunk back , disheartened , into [the sea]253-the sea . But to - night [he]53-robert found [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier . Perhaps [he]53-robert will never wholly release [her]52-mrs. pontellier from the spell . Perhaps [she]52-mrs. pontellier will never again suffer [a poor , unworthy earthling to walk in the shadow of [her]52-mrs. pontellier divine presence]1780-a poor , unworthy earthling to walk in the shadow of her divine presence . "[53-robert]

" Do n't banter [me]653-she , "[653-she] [she]653-she said , wounded at what appeared to be [his]654-he flippancy . [He]654-he did not mind the entreaty , but the tone with its delicate note of pathos was like a reproach . [He]654-he could not explain ; [he]654-he could not tell [her]653-she that [he]654-he had penetrated [her]653-she mood and understood . [He]654-he said nothing except to offer [her]653-she [his]654-he arm , for , by [her]653-she own admission , [she]653-she was exhausted . [She]653-she had been walking alone with [her]653-she arms hanging limp , letting [her]653-she white skirts trail along [the dewy path]655-the dewy path . [She]653-she took [his]654-he arm , but [she]653-she did not lean upon it . [She]653-she let [her]653-she hand lie listlessly , as though [her]653-she thoughts were elsewhere somewhere in advance of [her]653-she body , and [she]653-she was striving to overtake [them]656-them .

[Robert]53-robert assisted [her]653-she into the hammock which swung from the post before [her]653-she door out to the trunk of a tree .

" Will [you]653-she stay out here and wait for [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert asked .

" [I]656-them 'll stay out here . Good - night . "[656-them]

" Shall [I]653-she get [you]653-she a pillow ? "[653-she]

" There 's one here , "[653-she] [she]653-she said , feeling about , for [they]657-they were in the shadow .

" It must be soiled ; [the children]239-the children have been tumbling it about . "[653-she]

" No matter . "[658-an over - dainty woman] And having discovered the pillow , [she]653-she adjusted it beneath [her]653-she head . [She]653-she extended [herself]653-she in the hammock with a deep breath of relief . [She]653-she was not a supercilious or [an over - dainty woman]658-an over - dainty woman . [She]653-she was not much given to reclining in the hammock , and when [she]653-she did so it was with no cat - like suggestion of voluptuous ease , but with a beneficent repose which seemed to invade [her]653-she whole body .

" Shall [I]53-robert stay with [you]653-she till [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier comes ? "[53-robert] asked [Robert]53-robert , seating [himself]53-robert on the outer edge of one of the steps and taking hold of the hammock rope which was fastened to the post .

" If [you]653-she wish . Do n't swing the hammock . Will [you]653-she get [my]53-robert white shawl which [I]53-robert left on the window - sill over at [the house]157-the house ? "[53-robert]

" Are [you]53-robert chilly ? "[653-she]

" No ; but [I]53-robert shall be presently . "[53-robert]

" Presently ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert laughed . " Do [you]653-she know what time it is ? How long are [you]653-she going to stay out here ? "[53-robert]

" [I]53-robert do n't know . Will [you]53-robert get the shawl ? "[53-robert]

" Of course [I]53-robert will , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said , rising . [He]53-robert went over to [the house]157-the house , walking along the grass . [She]660-she watched [his]53-robert figure pass in and out of the strips of moonlight . It was past midnight . It was very quiet .

When [he]53-robert returned with the shawl [she]660-she took it and kept it in [her]660-she hand . [She]660-she did not put it around [her]660-she .

" Did [you]53-robert say [I]660-she should stay till [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier came back ? "[660-she]

" [I]660-she said [you]660-she might if [you]660-she wished to . "[660-she]

[He]53-robert seated [himself]53-robert again and rolled a cigarette , which [he]53-robert smoked in silence . Neither did [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier speak . No multitude of words could have been more significant than those moments of silence , or more pregnant with the first - felt throbbings of desire .

When the voices of [the bathers]661-the bathers were heard approaching , [Robert]53-robert said good - night . [She]660-she did not answer [him]53-robert . [He]53-robert thought [she]660-she was asleep . Again [she]660-she watched [his]53-robert figure pass in and out of the strips of moonlight as [he]53-robert walked away .

XI

" What are [you]660-she doing out here , [Edna]115-edna ? [I]186-her husband thought [I]186-her husband should find [you]660-she in bed , "[186-her husband] said [[her]660-she husband]186-her husband , when [he]53-robert discovered [her]660-she lying there . [He]53-robert had walked up with [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun and left [her]660-she at [the house]157-the house . [[His]53-robert wife]179-his wife did not reply .

" Are [you]660-she asleep ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert asked , bending down close to look at [her]660-she .

" No . "[660-she] [Her]660-she eyes gleamed bright and intense , with no sleepy shadows , as they looked into [his]53-robert .

" Do [you]660-she know it is past one o'clock ? Come on , "[53-robert] and [he]53-robert mounted the steps and went into [[their]665-their room]666-their room .

" [Edna]115-edna ! "[49-mr. pontellier] called [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier from within , after a few moments had gone by .

" Do n't wait for [me]660-she , "[660-she] [she]660-she answered . [He]53-robert thrust [his]53-robert head through the door .

" [You]660-she will take cold out there , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said , irritably . " What folly is this ? Why do n't [you]660-she come in ? "[53-robert]

" It is n't cold ; [I]660-she have [my]660-she shawl . "[660-she]

" The mosquitoes will devour [you]660-she . "[53-robert]

" There are no mosquitoes . "[660-she]

[She]660-she heard [him]53-robert moving about [the room]522-the room ; every sound indicating impatience and irritation . Another time [she]660-she would have gone in at [his]53-robert request . [She]660-she would , through habit , have yielded to [his]53-robert desire ; not with any sense of submission or obedience to [his]53-robert compelling wishes , but unthinkingly , as [we]668-we walk , move , sit , stand , go through the daily treadmill of the life which has been portioned out to [us]668-we .

" [Edna]1783-edna , [dear]1784-dear , are [you]1783-edna not coming in soon ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert asked again , this time fondly , with a note of entreaty .

" No ; [I]53-robert am going to stay out here . "[53-robert]

" This is more than folly , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert blurted out . " [I]53-robert ca n't permit [you]1783-edna to stay out [there]204-there all night . [You]1783-edna must come in [the house]157-the house instantly . "[53-robert]

With a writhing motion [she]660-she settled [herself]660-she more securely in the hammock . [She]660-she perceived that [her]660-she will had blazed up , stubborn and resistant . [She]660-she could not at that moment have done other than denied and resisted . [She]660-she wondered if [[her]660-she husband]186-her husband had ever spoken to [her]660-she like that before , and if [she]660-she had submitted to [his]53-robert command . Of course [she]660-she had ; [she]660-she remembered that [she]660-she had . But [she]660-she could not realize why or how [she]660-she should have yielded , feeling as [she]660-she then did .

" L once , go to bed , "[660-she] [she]660-she said , " [I]660-she mean to stay out here . [I]660-she do n't wish to go in , and [I]660-she do n't intend to . Do n't speak to [me]660-she like that again ; [I]660-she shall not answer [you]49-mr. pontellier . "[660-she]

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had prepared for bed , but [he]49-mr. pontellier slipped on an extra garment . [He]49-mr. pontellier opened a bottle of wine , of which [he]49-mr. pontellier kept a small and select supply in a buffet of [his]49-mr. pontellier own . [He]49-mr. pontellier drank a glass of the wine and went out on [the gallery]148-the gallery and offered a glass to [[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife . [She]179-his wife did not wish any . [He]49-mr. pontellier drew up the rocker , hoisted [his]49-mr. pontellier slippered feet on the rail , and proceeded to smoke a cigar . [He]49-mr. pontellier smoked two cigars ; then [he]49-mr. pontellier went inside and drank another glass of wine . [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier again declined to accept a glass when it was offered to [her]179-his wife . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier once more seated [himself]49-mr. pontellier with elevated feet , and after a reasonable interval of time smoked some more cigars .

[Edna]115-edna began to feel like [one who awakens gradually out of a dream , a delicious , grotesque , impossible dream]672-one who awakens gradually out of a dream , a delicious , grotesque , impossible dream , to feel again the realities pressing into [her]115-edna soul . The physical need for sleep began to overtake [her]115-edna ; the exuberance which had sustained and exalted [her]115-edna spirit left [her]115-edna helpless and yielding to the conditions which crowded [her]115-edna in .

The stillest hour of the night had come , the hour before dawn , when [the world]281-the world seems to hold its breath . The moon hung low , and had turned from silver to copper in the sleeping sky . The old owl no longer hooted , and the water - oaks had ceased to moan as [they]674-they bent [their]674-they heads .

[Edna]115-edna arose , cramped from lying so long and still in the hammock . [She]115-edna tottered up the steps , clutching feebly at the post before passing into [the house]157-the house .

" Are [you]186-her husband coming in , [L]57-l once ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked , turning [her]115-edna face toward [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband .

" Yes , [dear]1784-dear , "[186-her husband] [he]186-her husband answered , with a glance following a misty puff of smoke . " Just as soon as [I]186-her husband have finished [my]186-her husband cigar . "[186-her husband]

[XII]89-xii

[She]115-edna slept but a few hours . [They]677-they were troubled and feverish hours , disturbed with dreams that were intangible , that eluded [her]115-edna , leaving only an impression upon [her]115-edna half - awakened senses of something unattainable . [She]115-edna was up and dressed in the cool of the early morning . The air was invigorating and steadied somewhat [her]115-edna faculties . However , [she]115-edna was not seeking refreshment or help from any source , either external or from within . [She]115-edna was blindly following whatever impulse moved [her]115-edna , as if [she]115-edna had placed [herself]115-edna in alien hands for direction , and freed [her]115-edna soul of responsibility .

Most of [the people at that early hour]678-the people at that early hour were still in bed and asleep . [A few , who intended to go over to [the _ Ch ni re _]680-the _ ch ni re _ for mass]679-a few , who intended to go over to the _ ch ni re _ for mass , were moving about . [The lovers]489-the lovers , who had laid [their]489-the lovers plans the night before , were already strolling toward [the wharf]260-the wharf . [The lady in black]417-the lady in black , with [her]417-the lady in black Sunday prayer - book , velvet and gold - clasped , and [her]417-the lady in black Sunday silver beads , was following [them]489-the lovers at no great distance . [Old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival was up , and was more than half inclined to do anything that suggested itself . [He]64-old monsieur farival put on [his]64-old monsieur farival big straw hat , and taking [his]64-old monsieur farival umbrella from the stand in [the hall]536-the hall , followed [the lady in black]417-the lady in black , never overtaking [her]417-the lady in black .

[The little negro girl who worked [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun 's sewing - machine]686-the little negro girl who worked madame lebrun 's sewing - machine was sweeping [the galleries]687-the galleries with long , absent - minded strokes of the broom . [Edna]115-edna sent [her]686-the little negro girl who worked madame lebrun 's sewing - machine up into [the house]157-the house to awaken [Robert]53-robert .

" Tell [him]53-robert [I]115-edna am going to [the _ Ch ni re _]680-the _ ch ni re _ . [The boat]1789-the boat is ready ; tell [him]53-robert to hurry . "[115-edna]

[He]53-robert had soon joined [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna had never sent for [him]53-robert before . [She]115-edna had never asked for [him]53-robert . [She]115-edna had never seemed to want [him]53-robert before . [She]115-edna did not appear conscious that [she]115-edna had done anything unusual in commanding [his]53-robert presence . [He]53-robert was apparently equally unconscious of anything extraordinary in the situation . But [his]53-robert face was suffused with a quiet glow when [he]53-robert met [her]115-edna .

[They]689-they went together back to [the kitchen]504-the kitchen to drink coffee . There was no time to wait for any nicety of service . [They]689-they stood outside the window and [the cook]691-the cook passed [them]689-they [their]689-they coffee and a roll , which [they]689-they drank and ate from the window - sill . [Edna]115-edna said it tasted good .

[She]115-edna had not thought of coffee nor of anything . [He]53-robert told [her]115-edna [he]53-robert had often noticed that [she]115-edna lacked forethought .

" Was n't it enough to think of going to [the _ Ch ni re _]680-the _ ch ni re _ and waking [you]53-robert up ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna laughed . " Do [I]115-edna have to think of everything ? as [L]57-l once says when [he]53-robert 's in a bad humor . [I]115-edna do n't blame [him]53-robert ; [he]53-robert 'd never be in a bad humor if it were n't for [me]115-edna . "[115-edna]

[They]689-they took a short cut across [the sands]692-the sands . At a distance [they]689-they could see [the curious procession]693-the curious procession moving toward [the wharf]260-the wharf [the lovers]489-the lovers , shoulder to shoulder , creeping ; [the lady in black]417-the lady in black , gaining steadily upon [them]489-the lovers ; [old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival , losing ground inch by inch , and [a young barefooted Spanish girl]697-a young barefooted spanish girl , with a red kerchief on [her]697-a young barefooted spanish girl head and a basket on [her]697-a young barefooted spanish girl arm , bringing up the rear .

[Robert]53-robert knew [the girl]698-the girl , and [he]53-robert talked to [her]698-the girl a little in [the boat]1789-the boat . [No one present]700-no one present understood what [they]689-they said . [Her]698-the girl name was [Mariequita]90-mariequita . [She]698-the girl had a round , sly , piquant face and pretty black eyes . [Her]698-the girl hands were small , and [she]698-the girl kept them folded over the handle of [her]698-the girl basket . [Her]698-the girl feet were broad and coarse . [She]698-the girl did not strive to hide them . [Edna]115-edna looked at [her]698-the girl feet , and noticed the sand and slime between [her]698-the girl brown toes .

[Beaudelet]51-beaudelet grumbled because [Mariequita]90-mariequita was there , taking up so much room . In reality [he]51-beaudelet was annoyed at having [old Monsieur Farival , who considered [himself]701-old monsieur farival , who considered himself the better sailor of the two [the better sailor of [the two]181-the two]702-the better sailor of the two]701-old monsieur farival , who considered himself the better sailor of the two . But [he]51-beaudelet would not quarrel with [so old a man]704-so old a man as [Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival , so [he]51-beaudelet quarreled with [Mariequita]90-mariequita . [The girl]698-the girl was deprecatory at one moment , appealing to [Robert]53-robert . [She]698-the girl was saucy the next , moving [her]698-the girl head up and down , making " eyes "[698-the girl] at [Robert]53-robert and making " mouths "[698-the girl] at [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet .

[The lovers]489-the lovers were all alone . [They]489-the lovers saw nothing , [they]489-the lovers heard nothing . [The lady in black]417-the lady in black was counting [her]417-the lady in black beads for the third time . [Old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival talked incessantly of what [he]64-old monsieur farival knew about handling [a boat]708-a boat , and of what [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet did not know on the same subject .

[Edna]115-edna liked it all . [She]115-edna looked [Mariequita]90-mariequita up and down , from [her]90-mariequita ugly brown toes to [her]90-mariequita pretty black eyes , and back again .

" Why does [she]417-the lady in black look at [me]709-the girl of robert like that ? "[709-the girl of robert] inquired [the girl of [Robert]53-robert]709-the girl of robert .

" Maybe [she]417-the lady in black thinks [you]53-robert are pretty . Shall [I]709-the girl of robert ask [her]417-the lady in black ? "[709-the girl of robert]

" No . Is [she]417-the lady in black [[your]53-robert sweetheart]1791-your sweetheart ? "[709-the girl of robert]

" [She]417-the lady in black 's [a married lady]1792-a married lady , and has [two children]1793-two children . "[709-the girl of robert]

" Oh ! well ! [Francisco]91-francisco ran away with [[Sylvano]92-sylvano 's wife]1794-sylvano 's wife , who had [four children]1795-four children . [They]1796-they took all [his]91-francisco money and one of [the children]239-the children and stole [[his]91-francisco boat]1798-his boat . "[709-the girl of robert]

" Shut up ! "[709-the girl of robert]

" Does [she]417-the lady in black understand ? "[709-the girl of robert]

" Oh , hush ! "[709-the girl of robert]

" Are [those two married]1799-those two married over there leaning on [each other]183-each other ? "[709-the girl of robert]

" Of course not , "[53-robert] laughed [Robert]53-robert .

" Of course not , "[90-mariequita] echoed [Mariequita]90-mariequita , with a serious , confirmatory bob of the head .

The sun was high up and beginning to bite . The swift breeze seemed to [Edna]115-edna to bury the sting of it into the pores of [her]115-edna face and hands . [Robert]53-robert held [his]53-robert umbrella over [her]115-edna . As [they]710-they went cutting sidewise through the water , the sails bellied taut , with the wind filling and overflowing them . [Old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival laughed sardonically at something as [he]64-old monsieur farival looked at the sails , and [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet swore at [the old man]711-the old man under [his]51-beaudelet breath .

Sailing across [the bay]712-the bay to [the _ Ch ni re Caminada _]713-the _ ch ni re caminada _ , [Edna]115-edna felt as if [she]115-edna were being borne away from some anchorage which had held [her]115-edna fast , whose chains had been loosening had snapped the night before when the mystic spirit was abroad , leaving [her]115-edna free to drift whithersoever [she]115-edna chose to set [her]115-edna sails . [Robert]53-robert spoke to [her]115-edna incessantly ; [he]53-robert no longer noticed [Mariequita]90-mariequita . [The girl]698-the girl had shrimps in [her]698-the girl bamboo basket . They were covered with Spanish moss . [She]115-edna beat the moss down impatiently , and muttered to [herself]115-edna sullenly .

" Let [us]1801-we go to [Grande Terre]17-grande terre to - morrow ? "[53-robert] said [Robert]53-robert in a low voice .

" What shall [we]1801-we do there ? "[115-edna]

" Climb up [the hill]1802-the hill to [the old fort]1803-the old fort and look at the little wriggling gold snakes , and watch the lizards sun [themselves]1804-themselves . "[115-edna]

[She]115-edna gazed away toward [Grande Terre]17-grande terre and thought [she]115-edna would like to be alone there with [Robert]53-robert , in the sun , listening to [the ocean]1735-the ocean 's roar and watching the slimy lizards writhe in and out among [the ruins of [the old fort]1803-the old fort]716-the ruins of the old fort .

" And the next day or the next [we]1801-we can sail to [the Bayou Brulow]18-the bayou brulow , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert went on .

" What shall [we]1801-we do there ? "[115-edna]

" Anything cast bait for fish . "[115-edna]

" No ; [we]1801-we 'll go back to [Grande Terre]17-grande terre . Let the fish alone . "[115-edna]

" [We]1801-we 'll go wherever [you]115-edna like , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said . " [I]53-robert 'll have [Tonie]93-tonie come over and help [me]53-robert patch and trim [[my]53-robert boat]1805-my boat . [We]1801-we shall not need [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet nor [any one]1731-any one . Are [you]115-edna afraid of [the pirogue]1807-the pirogue ? "[53-robert]

" Oh , no . "[115-edna]

" Then [I]53-robert 'll take [you]115-edna some night in [the pirogue]1807-the pirogue when the moon shines . Maybe [your]115-edna Gulf spirit will whisper to [you]115-edna in [which of [these islands]1810-these islands]1809-which of these islands the treasures are hidden direct [you]115-edna to [the very spot]1811-the very spot , perhaps . "[53-robert]

" And in a day [we]1801-we should be rich ! "[718-i] [she]718-i laughed . " [I]718-i 'd give it all to [you]115-edna , the pirate gold and every bit of treasure [we]1801-we could dig up . [I]718-i think [you]115-edna would know how to spend it . Pirate gold is n't a thing to be hoarded or utilized . It is something to squander and throw to the four winds , for the fun of seeing the golden specks fly . "[718-i]

" [We]1801-we 'd share it , and scatter it together , "[719-he] [he]719-he said . [His]719-he face flushed .

[They]720-they all went together up to [the quaint little Gothic church of [Our Lady of [Lourdes]20-lourdes]19-our lady of lourdes]721-the quaint little gothic church of our lady of lourdes [, gleaming all brown and yellow with paint in the sun 's glare]722-, gleaming all brown and yellow with paint in the sun 's glare .

[Only Beaudelet]51-beaudelet remained behind , tinkering at [[his]51-beaudelet boat]1798-his boat , and [Mariequita]90-mariequita walked away with [her]90-mariequita basket of shrimps , casting a look of childish ill humor and reproach at [Robert]53-robert from the corner of [her]90-mariequita eye .

[XIII]94-xiii

A feeling of oppression and drowsiness overcame [Edna]115-edna during the service . [Her]115-edna head began to ache , and the lights on the altar swayed before [her]115-edna eyes . Another time [she]115-edna might have made an effort to regain [her]115-edna composure ; but [her]115-edna one thought was to quit the stifling atmosphere of [the church]724-the church and reach the open air . [She]115-edna arose , climbing over [Robert]53-robert 's feet with a muttered apology . [Old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival , flurried , curious , stood up , but upon seeing that [Robert]53-robert had followed [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier , [he]53-robert sank back into [his]53-robert seat . [He]53-robert whispered an anxious inquiry of [the lady in black]417-the lady in black , who did not notice [him]53-robert or reply , but kept [her]417-the lady in black eyes fastened upon the pages of [her]417-the lady in black velvet prayer - book .

" [I]115-edna felt giddy and almost overcome , "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna said , lifting [her]115-edna hands instinctively to [her]115-edna head and pushing [her]115-edna straw hat up from [her]115-edna forehead . " [I]726-they could n't have stayed through the service . "[726-they] [They]726-they were outside in the shadow of [the church]724-the church . [Robert]53-robert was full of solicitude .

" It was folly to have thought of going in the first place , let alone staying . Come over to [[Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine 's]1812-madame antoine 's ; [you]115-edna can rest there . "[53-robert] [He]53-robert took [her]115-edna arm and led [her]115-edna away , looking anxiously and continuously down into [her]115-edna face .

How still it was , with only the voice of [the sea]253-the sea whispering through the reeds that grew in [the salt - water pools]729-the salt - water pools ! [The long line of little gray , weather - beaten [houses nestled peacefully among the orange trees]731-houses nestled peacefully among the orange trees]730-the long line of little gray , weather - beaten houses nestled peacefully among the orange trees . It must always have been [God]96-god 's day on [that low , drowsy island]732-that low , drowsy island , [Edna]115-edna thought . [They]726-they stopped , leaning over a jagged fence made of [sea - drift]733-sea - drift , to ask for water . [A youth]734-a youth , [a mild - faced Acadian]735-a mild - faced acadian , was drawing water from the cistern , which was nothing more than a rusty buoy , with an opening on one side , sunk in the ground . The water which [the youth]736-the youth handed to [them]726-they in a tin pail was not cold to taste , but it was cool to [her]115-edna heated face , and it greatly revived and refreshed [her]115-edna .

[[Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine 's cot]737-madame antoine 's cot was at [the far end of [the village]739-the village]738-the far end of the village . [She]115-edna welcomed [them]726-they with all the native hospitality , as [she]115-edna would have opened [her]115-edna door to let the sunlight in . [She]115-edna was fat , and walked heavily and clumsily across the floor . [She]115-edna could speak no English , but when [Robert]53-robert made [her]115-edna understand that [the lady who accompanied [him]53-robert]740-the lady who accompanied him was ill and desired to rest , [she]115-edna was all eagerness to make [Edna]115-edna feel at [home]245-home and to dispose of [her]115-edna comfortably .

[The whole place]742-the whole place was immaculately clean , and the big , four - posted bed , snow - white , invited [one]303-one to repose . It stood in [a small side room which looked out across [a narrow grass plot]745-a narrow grass plot toward [the shed]746-the shed]744-a small side room which looked out across a narrow grass plot toward the shed , where there was [a disabled boat lying keel upward]747-a disabled boat lying keel upward .

[Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine had not gone to mass . [[Her]95-madame antoine son]748-her son [Tonie]93-tonie had , but [she]95-madame antoine supposed [he]93-tonie would soon be back , and [she]95-madame antoine invited [Robert]53-robert to be seated and wait for [him]53-robert . But [he]53-robert went and sat outside the door and smoked . [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine busied [herself]95-madame antoine in [the large front room]749-the large front room preparing dinner . [She]95-madame antoine was boiling mullets over a few red coals in the huge fireplace .

[Edna]115-edna , left alone in [the little side room]750-the little side room , loosened [her]115-edna clothes , removing the greater part of them . [She]115-edna bathed [her]115-edna face , [her]115-edna neck and arms in the basin that stood between the windows . [She]115-edna took off [her]115-edna shoes and stockings and stretched [herself]115-edna in the very center of the high , white bed . How luxurious it felt to rest thus in a strange , quaint bed , with [its]751-its sweet country odor of laurel lingering about the sheets and mattress ! [She]115-edna stretched [her]115-edna strong limbs that ached a little . [She]115-edna ran [her]115-edna fingers through [her]115-edna loosened hair for a while . [She]115-edna looked at [her]115-edna round arms as [she]115-edna held them straight up and rubbed them one after the other , observing closely , as if it were something [she]115-edna saw for the first time , the fine , firm quality and texture of [her]115-edna flesh . [She]115-edna clasped [her]115-edna hands easily above [her]115-edna head , and it was thus [she]115-edna fell asleep .

[She]115-edna slept lightly at first , half awake and drowsily attentive to the things about [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna could hear [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine 's heavy , scraping tread as [she]115-edna walked back and forth on the sanded floor . Some chickens were clucking outside the windows , scratching for bits of gravel in the grass . Later [she]115-edna half heard the voices of [Robert]53-robert and [Tonie]93-tonie talking under [the shed]746-the shed . [She]115-edna did not stir . Even [her]115-edna eyelids rested numb and heavily over [her]115-edna sleepy eyes . The voices went on [Tonie]93-tonie 's slow , Acadian drawl , [Robert]53-robert 's quick , soft , smooth French . [She]115-edna understood French imperfectly unless directly addressed , and the voices were only part of the other drowsy , muffled sounds lulling [her]115-edna senses .

When [Edna]115-edna awoke it was with the conviction that [she]115-edna had slept long and soundly . The voices were hushed under [the shed]746-the shed . [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine 's step was no longer to be heard in [the adjoining room]232-the adjoining room . Even the chickens had gone elsewhere to scratch and cluck . The mosquito bar was drawn over [her]115-edna ; [the old woman]755-the old woman had come in while [she]115-edna slept and let down the bar . [Edna]115-edna arose quietly from the bed , and looking between the curtains of the window , [she]115-edna saw by the slanting rays of the sun that the afternoon was far advanced . [Robert]53-robert was out there under [the shed]746-the shed , reclining in the shade against the sloping keel of [the overturned boat]757-the overturned boat . [He]53-robert was reading from a book . [Tonie]93-tonie was no longer with [him]53-robert . [She]115-edna wondered what had become of [the rest of the party]758-the rest of the party . [She]115-edna peeped out at [him]53-robert two or three times as [she]115-edna stood washing [herself]115-edna in the little basin between the windows .

[Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine had laid some coarse , clean towels upon a chair , and had placed a box of _ poudre de riz _ within easy reach . [Edna]115-edna dabbed the powder upon [her]115-edna nose and cheeks as [she]115-edna looked at [herself]115-edna closely in the little distorted mirror which hung on the wall above the basin . [Her]115-edna eyes were bright and wide awake and [her]115-edna face glowed .

When [she]115-edna had completed [her]115-edna toilet [she]115-edna walked into [the adjoining room]232-the adjoining room . [She]115-edna was very hungry . [No one]312-no one was [there]204-there . But there was a cloth spread upon the table that stood against the wall , and a cover was laid for one , with a crusty brown loaf and a bottle of wine beside the plate . [Edna]115-edna bit a piece from the brown loaf , tearing it with [her]115-edna strong , white teeth . [She]115-edna poured some of the wine into the glass and drank it down . Then [she]115-edna went softly out of doors , and plucking an orange from the low - hanging bough of a tree , threw it at [Robert]53-robert , who did not know [she]115-edna was awake and up .

An illumination broke over [his]53-robert whole face when [he]53-robert saw [her]115-edna and joined [her]115-edna under the orange tree .

" How many years have [I]115-edna slept ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna inquired . " [The whole island]1813-the whole island seems changed . [A new race of beings]1814-a new race of beings must have sprung up , leaving only [you]115-edna and [me]115-edna as [past relics]1815-past relics . How many ages ago did [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine and [Tonie]93-tonie die ? and when did [[our]1816-our people from [Grand Isle]1-grand isle]1817-our people from grand isle disappear from [the earth]1818-the earth ? "[115-edna]

[He]53-robert familiarly adjusted a ruffle upon [her]115-edna shoulder .

" [You]115-edna have slept precisely one hundred years . [I]115-edna was left [here]1819-here to guard [your]115-edna slumbers ; and for one hundred years [I]115-edna have been out under [the shed]746-the shed reading a book . The only evil [I]115-edna could n't prevent was to keep a broiled fowl from drying up . "[115-edna]

" If it has turned to stone , still will [I]115-edna eat it , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , moving with [him]53-robert into [the house]157-the house . " But really , what has become of [Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival and [the others]324-the others ? "[115-edna]

" Gone hours ago . When [they]1822-they found that [you]115-edna were sleeping [they]1822-they thought it best not to awake [you]115-edna . Any way , [I]115-edna would n't have let [them]1822-they . What was [I]115-edna [here]1819-here for ? "[115-edna]

" [I]115-edna wonder if [L]57-l once will be uneasy ! "[115-edna] [she]115-edna speculated , as [she]115-edna seated [herself]115-edna at table .

" Of course not ; [he]53-robert knows [you]115-edna are with [me]53-robert , "[53-robert] [Robert]53-robert replied , as [he]53-robert busied [himself]53-robert among sundry pans and covered dishes which had been left standing on the hearth .

" Where are [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine and [[her]95-madame antoine son]748-her son ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna .

" Gone to [Vespers]22-vespers , and to visit [some friends]1825-some friends , [I]53-robert believe . [I]53-robert am to take [you]115-edna back in [[Tonie]93-tonie 's boat]1826-tonie 's boat whenever [you]115-edna are ready to go . "[53-robert]

[He]53-robert stirred the smoldering ashes till the broiled fowl began to sizzle afresh . [He]53-robert served [her]115-edna with no mean repast , dripping the coffee anew and sharing it with [her]115-edna . [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine had cooked little else than the mullets , but while [Edna]115-edna slept [Robert]53-robert had foraged [the island]263-the island . [He]53-robert was childishly gratified to discover [her]115-edna appetite , and to see the relish with which [she]115-edna ate the food which [he]53-robert had procured for [her]115-edna .

" Shall [we]764-we go right away ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked , after draining [her]115-edna glass and brushing together the crumbs of the crusty loaf .

" The sun is n't as low as it will be in two hours , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert answered .

" The sun will be gone in two hours . "[115-edna]

" Well , let it go ; who cares ! "[363-any woman]

[They]764-we waited a good while under the orange trees , till [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine came back , panting , waddling , with a thousand apologies to explain [her]95-madame antoine absence . [Tonie]93-tonie did not dare to return . [He]93-tonie was shy , and would not willingly face [any woman]363-any woman except [[his]93-tonie mother]208-his mother .

It was very pleasant to stay there under the orange trees , while the sun dipped lower and lower , turning the western sky to flaming copper and gold . The shadows lengthened and crept out like stealthy , grotesque monsters across the grass .

[Edna]115-edna and [Robert]53-robert both sat upon the ground that is , [he]93-tonie lay upon the ground beside [her]115-edna , occasionally picking at the hem of [her]115-edna muslin gown .

[Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine seated [her]95-madame antoine fat body , broad and squat , upon a bench beside the door . [She]95-madame antoine had been talking all the afternoon , and had wound [herself]95-madame antoine up to the storytelling pitch .

And what stories [she]95-madame antoine told [them]764-we ! But twice in [her]95-madame antoine life [she]95-madame antoine had left [the _ Ch ni re Caminada _]713-the _ ch ni re caminada _ , and then for the briefest span . All [her]95-madame antoine years [she]95-madame antoine had squatted and waddled there upon [the island]263-the island , gathering legends of [the Baratarians]97-the baratarians and [the sea]253-the sea . The night came on , with the moon to lighten it . [Edna]115-edna could hear the whispering voices of [dead men]770-dead men and the click of muffled gold .

When [she]115-edna and [Robert]53-robert stepped into [[Tonie]93-tonie 's boat]1826-tonie 's boat , with [the red lateen sail]772-the red lateen sail , misty spirit forms were prowling in the shadows and among the reeds , and upon the water were [phantom ships]773-phantom ships , speeding to cover .

[XIV]98-xiv

[The youngest boy]774-the youngest boy , [Etienne]99-etienne , had been very naughty , [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle said , as [she]62-madame ratignolle delivered [him]774-the youngest boy into the hands of [[his]774-the youngest boy mother]208-his mother . [He]774-the youngest boy had been unwilling to go to bed and had made a scene ; whereupon [she]62-madame ratignolle had taken charge of [him]774-the youngest boy and pacified [him]774-the youngest boy as well as [she]62-madame ratignolle could . [Raoul]58-raoul had been in bed and asleep for two hours .

[The youngster]776-the youngster was in [his]776-the youngster long white nightgown , that kept tripping [him]776-the youngster up as [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle led [him]776-the youngster along by the hand . With the other chubby fist [he]776-the youngster rubbed [his]776-the youngster eyes , which were heavy with sleep and ill humor . [Edna]115-edna took [him]776-the youngster in [her]115-edna arms , and seating [herself]115-edna in the rocker , began to coddle and caress [him]776-the youngster , calling [him]776-the youngster all manner of tender names , soothing [him]776-the youngster to sleep .

It was not more than nine o'clock . [No one]312-no one had yet gone to bed but [the children]239-the children .

[L]57-l once had been very uneasy at first , [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle said , and had wanted to start at once for the _ Ch ni re _ . But [Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival had assured [him]776-the youngster that [[his]776-the youngster wife]179-his wife was only overcome with sleep and fatigue , that [Tonie]93-tonie would bring [her]179-his wife safely back later in the day ; and [he]776-the youngster had thus been dissuaded from crossing [the bay]712-the bay . [He]776-the youngster had gone over to [[Klein]54-klein 's]781-klein 's , looking up [some cotton broker whom [he]776-the youngster wished to see in regard to securities , exchanges , stocks , bonds , or something of the sort]782-some cotton broker whom he wished to see in regard to securities , exchanges , stocks , bonds , or something of the sort , [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle did not remember what . [He]776-the youngster said [he]776-the youngster would not remain away late . [She]62-madame ratignolle [herself]62-madame ratignolle was suffering from heat and oppression , [she]62-madame ratignolle said . [She]62-madame ratignolle carried a bottle of salts and a large fan . [She]62-madame ratignolle would not consent to remain with [Edna]115-edna , for [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle was alone , and [he]83-monsieur ratignolle detested above all things to be left alone .

When [Etienne]99-etienne had fallen asleep [Edna]115-edna bore [him]99-etienne into [the back room]783-the back room , and [Robert]53-robert went and lifted the mosquito bar that [she]115-edna might lay [the child]236-the child comfortably in [his]99-etienne bed . The quadroon had vanished . When [they]785-they emerged from [the cottage]180-the cottage [Robert]53-robert bade [Edna]115-edna good - night .

" Do [you]53-robert know [we]785-they have been together the whole livelong day , [Robert]53-robert since early this morning ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said at parting .

" All but the hundred years when [you]53-robert were sleeping . Good - night . "[115-edna]

[He]53-robert pressed [her]115-edna hand and went away in the direction of [the beach]175-the beach . [He]53-robert did not join [any of [the others]324-the others]788-any of the others , but walked alone toward [the Gulf]177-the gulf .

[Edna]115-edna stayed outside , awaiting [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband 's return . [She]115-edna had no desire to sleep or to retire ; nor did [she]115-edna feel like going over to sit with [the Ratignolles]100-the ratignolles , or to join [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun and [a group whose animated voices reached [her]115-edna as [they]792-a group whose animated voices reached her as they sat in conversation before the house sat in conversation before [the house]157-the house]792-a group whose animated voices reached her as they sat in conversation before the house . [She]115-edna let [her]115-edna mind wander back over [her]115-edna stay at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle ; and [she]115-edna tried to discover wherein this summer had been different from any and every other summer of [her]115-edna life . [She]115-edna could only realize that [she]115-edna [herself]115-edna [her]115-edna present self was in some way different from [the other self]794-the other self . That [she]115-edna was seeing with different eyes and making the acquaintance of new conditions in [herself]115-edna that colored and changed [her]115-edna environment , [she]115-edna did not yet suspect .

[She]115-edna wondered why [Robert]53-robert had gone away and left [her]115-edna . It did not occur to [her]115-edna to think [he]53-robert might have grown tired of being with [her]115-edna the livelong day . [She]115-edna was not tired , and [she]115-edna felt that [he]53-robert was not . [She]115-edna regretted that [he]53-robert had gone . It was so much more natural to have [him]53-robert stay when [he]53-robert was not absolutely required to leave [her]115-edna .

As [Edna]115-edna waited for [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband [she]115-edna sang low a little song that [Robert]53-robert had sung as [they]796-they crossed [the bay]712-the bay . It began with " Ah ! _ si tu savais _ , "[115-edna] and every verse ended with " _ si tu savais _ . "[115-edna]

[Robert]53-robert 's voice was not pretentious . It was musical and true . The voice , the notes , the whole refrain haunted [her]115-edna memory .

XV

When [Edna]115-edna entered [the dining - room]278-the dining - room one evening a little late , as was [her]115-edna habit , an unusually animated conversation seemed to be going on . [Several persons]799-several persons were talking at once , and [Victor]78-victor 's voice was predominating , even over that of [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother . [Edna]115-edna had returned late from [her]115-edna bath , had dressed in some haste , and [her]115-edna face was flushed . [Her]115-edna head , set off by [her]115-edna dainty white gown , suggested a rich , rare blossom . [She]115-edna took [her]115-edna seat at table between [old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival and [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle .

As [she]115-edna seated [herself]115-edna and was about to begin to eat [her]115-edna soup , which had been served when [she]115-edna entered [the room]522-the room , [several persons]799-several persons informed [her]115-edna simultaneously that [Robert]53-robert was going to [Mexico]4-mexico . [She]115-edna laid [her]115-edna spoon down and looked about [her]115-edna bewildered . [He]53-robert had been with [her]115-edna , reading to [her]115-edna all the morning , and had never even mentioned such a place as [Mexico]4-mexico . [She]115-edna had not seen [him]53-robert during the afternoon ; [she]115-edna had heard [some one]538-some one say [he]53-robert was at [the house]157-the house , [upstairs]805-upstairs with [[his]53-robert mother]208-his mother . This [she]115-edna had thought nothing of , though [she]115-edna was surprised when [he]53-robert did not join [her]115-edna later in the afternoon , when [she]115-edna went down to [the beach]175-the beach .

[She]115-edna looked across at [him]53-robert , where [he]53-robert sat beside [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun , who presided . [Edna]115-edna 's face was a blank picture of bewilderment , which [she]115-edna never thought of disguising . [He]53-robert lifted [his]53-robert eyebrows with the pretext of a smile as [he]53-robert returned [her]115-edna glance . [He]53-robert looked embarrassed and uneasy . " When is [he]53-robert going ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked of [everybody in general]808-everybody in general , as if [Robert]53-robert were not there to answer for [himself]53-robert .

" To - night ! "[115-edna] " This very evening ! "[115-edna] " Did [you]115-edna ever ! "[115-edna] " What possesses [him]53-robert ! "[115-edna] were some of the replies [she]115-edna gathered , uttered simultaneously in French and English .

" Impossible ! "[115-edna] [she]115-edna exclaimed . " How can [a person]1827-a person start off from [Grand Isle]1-grand isle to [Mexico]4-mexico at a moment 's notice , as if [he]1827-a person were going over to [Klein 's]54-klein or to [the wharf]260-the wharf or down to [the beach]175-the beach ? "[115-edna]

" [I]53-robert said all along [I]53-robert was going to [Mexico]4-mexico ; [I]53-robert 've been saying so for years ! "[53-robert] cried [Robert]53-robert , in an excited and irritable tone , with the air of [a man]521-a man defending [himself]521-a man against a swarm of stinging insects .

[Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun knocked on the table with [her]50-madame lebrun knife handle .

" Please let [Robert]53-robert explain why [he]53-robert is going , and why [he]53-robert is going to - night , "[50-madame lebrun] [she]50-madame lebrun called out . " Really , this table is getting to be more and more like Bedlam every day , with [everybody]351-everybody talking at once . Sometimes [I]50-madame lebrun hope [God]96-god will forgive [me]50-madame lebrun but positively , sometimes [I]50-madame lebrun wish [Victor]78-victor would lose the power of speech . "[50-madame lebrun]

[Victor]78-victor laughed sardonically as [he]78-victor thanked [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother for [her]208-his mother holy wish , of which [he]78-victor failed to see the benefit to [anybody]811-anybody , except that it might afford [her]208-his mother a more ample opportunity and license to talk [herself]208-his mother .

[Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival thought that [Victor]78-victor should have been taken out in mid - ocean in [his]78-victor earliest youth and drowned . [Victor]78-victor thought there would be more logic in thus disposing of [old people]812-old people with an established claim for making [themselves]812-old people universally obnoxious . [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun grew a trifle hysterical ; [Robert]53-robert called [[his]53-robert brother]813-his brother some sharp , hard names .

" There 's nothing much to explain , [mother]1761-mother , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said ; though [he]53-robert explained , nevertheless looking chiefly at [Edna]115-edna that [he]53-robert could only meet [the gentleman whom [he]53-robert intended to join at [Vera Cruz]23-vera cruz]814-the gentleman whom he intended to join at vera cruz by taking [such and such a steamer]815-such and such a steamer , which left [New Orleans]2-new orleans on such a day ; that [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet was going out with [his]51-beaudelet lugger - load of vegetables that night , which gave [him]51-beaudelet an opportunity of reaching [the city]261-the city and making [his]51-beaudelet vessel in time .

" But when did [you]64-old monsieur farival make up [your]64-old monsieur farival mind to all this ? "[64-old monsieur farival] demanded [Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival .

" This afternoon , "[53-robert] returned [Robert]53-robert , with a shade of annoyance .

" At what time this afternoon ? "[817-the old gentleman] persisted [the old gentleman]817-the old gentleman , with nagging determination , as if [he]817-the old gentleman were cross - questioning [a criminal in a court of justice]818-a criminal in a court of justice .

" At four o'clock this afternoon , [Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival , "[53-robert] [Robert]53-robert replied , in a high voice and with a lofty air , which reminded [Edna]115-edna of [some gentleman on the stage]819-some gentleman on the stage .

[She]115-edna had forced [herself]115-edna to eat most of [her]115-edna soup , and now [she]115-edna was picking the flaky bits of a _ court bouillon _ with [her]115-edna fork .

[The lovers]489-the lovers were profiting by the general conversation on [Mexico]4-mexico to speak in whispers of matters which [they]489-the lovers rightly considered were interesting to [no one]312-no one but [themselves]489-the lovers . [The lady in black]417-the lady in black had once received a pair of prayer - beads of curious workmanship from [Mexico]4-mexico , with very special indulgence attached to them , but [she]417-the lady in black had never been able to ascertain whether the indulgence extended outside [the Mexican border]823-the mexican border . [Father Fochel of [the Cathedral]825-the cathedral]824-father fochel of the cathedral had attempted to explain it ; but [he]824-father fochel of the cathedral had not done so to [her]417-the lady in black satisfaction . And [she]417-the lady in black begged that [Robert]53-robert would interest [himself]53-robert , and discover , if possible , whether [she]417-the lady in black was entitled to the indulgence accompanying the remarkably curious Mexican prayer - beads .

[Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle hoped that [Robert]53-robert would exercise extreme caution in dealing with the Mexicans , who , [she]62-madame ratignolle considered , were [a treacherous people]826-a treacherous people , unscrupulous and revengeful . [She]62-madame ratignolle trusted [she]62-madame ratignolle did [them]826-a treacherous people no injustice in thus condemning [them]826-a treacherous people as a race . [She]62-madame ratignolle had known personally but [one Mexican]827-one mexican , who made and sold excellent tamales , and whom [she]62-madame ratignolle would have trusted implicitly , so soft - spoken was [he]827-one mexican . One day [he]827-one mexican was arrested for stabbing [[his]827-one mexican wife]179-his wife . [She]62-madame ratignolle never knew whether [he]827-one mexican had been hanged or not .

[Victor]78-victor had grown hilarious , and was attempting to tell an anecdote about [a Mexican girl who served chocolate one winter in [a restaurant in [Dauphine Street]24-dauphine street]830-a restaurant in dauphine street]829-a mexican girl who served chocolate one winter in a restaurant in dauphine street . [No one]312-no one would listen to [him]78-victor but [old Monsieur Farival]64-old monsieur farival , who went into convulsions over the droll story .

[Edna]115-edna wondered if [they]832-they had all gone mad , to be talking and clamoring at that rate . [She]62-madame ratignolle [herself]62-madame ratignolle could think of nothing to say about [Mexico]4-mexico or [the Mexicans]101-the mexicans .

" At what time do [you]53-robert leave ? "[62-madame ratignolle] [she]62-madame ratignolle asked [Robert]53-robert .

" At ten , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert told [her]62-madame ratignolle . " [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet wants to wait for the moon . "[53-robert]

" Are [you]832-they all ready to go ? "[62-madame ratignolle]

" Quite ready . [I]53-robert shall only take a hand - bag , and shall pack [my]53-robert trunk in [the city]261-the city . "[53-robert]

[He]53-robert turned to answer some question put to [him]53-robert by [[his]53-robert mother]208-his mother , and [Edna]115-edna , having finished [her]115-edna black coffee , left the table .

[She]115-edna went directly to [[her]115-edna room]224-her room . [The little cottage]835-the little cottage was close and stuffy after leaving the outer air . But [she]115-edna did not mind ; there appeared to be a hundred different things demanding [her]115-edna attention indoors . [She]115-edna began to set the toilet - stand to rights , grumbling at the negligence of the quadroon , who was in [the adjoining room]232-the adjoining room putting [the children]239-the children to bed . [She]115-edna gathered together stray garments that were hanging on the backs of chairs , and put each where it belonged in [closet]838-closet or bureau drawer . [She]115-edna changed [her]115-edna gown for a more comfortable and commodious wrapper . [She]115-edna rearranged [her]115-edna hair , combing and brushing it with unusual energy . Then [she]115-edna went in and assisted [the quadroon]839-the quadroon in getting [the boys]231-the boys to bed .

[They]231-the boys were very playful and inclined to talk to do anything but lie quiet and go to sleep . [Edna]115-edna sent [the quadroon]839-the quadroon away to [her]115-edna supper and told [her]115-edna [she]115-edna need not return . Then [she]115-edna sat and told [the children]239-the children a story . Instead of soothing it excited [them]239-the children , and added to [their]239-the children wakefulness . [She]115-edna left [them]239-the children in heated argument , speculating about the conclusion of the tale which [[their]239-the children mother]436-their mother promised to finish the following night .

[The little black girl]844-the little black girl came in to say that [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun would like to have [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier go and sit with [them]239-the children over at [the house]157-the house till [Mr. Robert]53-robert went away . [Edna]115-edna returned answer that [she]115-edna had already undressed , that [she]115-edna did not feel quite well , but perhaps [she]115-edna would go over to [the house]157-the house later . [She]115-edna started to dress again , and got as far advanced as to remove [her]115-edna _ peignoir _ . But changing [her]115-edna mind once more [she]115-edna resumed the _ peignoir _ , and went outside and sat down before [her]115-edna door . [She]115-edna was overheated and irritable , and fanned [herself]115-edna energetically for a while . [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle came down to discover what was the matter .

" All that noise and confusion at the table must have upset [me]115-edna , "[115-edna] replied [Edna]115-edna , " and moreover , [I]115-edna hate shocks and surprises . The idea of [Robert]53-robert starting off in such a ridiculously sudden and dramatic way ! As if it were a matter of life and death ! Never saying a word about it all morning when [he]53-robert was with [me]115-edna . "[115-edna]

" Yes , "[62-madame ratignolle] agreed [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle . " [I]62-madame ratignolle think it was showing [us]1833-us all [you]115-edna especially very little consideration . It would n't have surprised [me]62-madame ratignolle in any of the others ; [those Lebruns]1834-those lebruns are all given to heroics . But [I]62-madame ratignolle must say [I]62-madame ratignolle should never have expected such a thing from [Robert]53-robert . Are [you]115-edna not coming down ? Come on , [dear]1784-dear ; it does n't look friendly . "[62-madame ratignolle]

" No , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , a little sullenly . " [I]115-edna ca n't go to the trouble of dressing again ; [I]115-edna do n't feel like it . "[115-edna]

" [You]115-edna need n't dress ; [you]115-edna look all right ; fasten a belt around [your]115-edna waist . Just look at [me]62-madame ratignolle ! "[62-madame ratignolle]

" No , "[115-edna] persisted [Edna]115-edna ; " but [you]115-edna go on . [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun might be offended if [we]1836-we both stayed away . "[115-edna]

[Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle kissed [Edna]115-edna good - night , and went away , being in truth rather desirous of joining in the general and animated conversation which was still in progress concerning [Mexico]4-mexico and [the Mexicans]101-the mexicans .

Somewhat later [Robert]53-robert came up , carrying [his]53-robert hand - bag .

" Are n't [you]115-edna feeling well ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert asked .

" Oh , well enough . Are [you]115-edna going right away ? "[101-the mexicans]

[He]53-robert lit a match and looked at [his]53-robert watch . " In twenty minutes , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said . The sudden and brief flare of the match emphasized the darkness for a while . [He]53-robert sat down upon a stool which [the children]239-the children had left out on [the porch]182-the porch .

" Get a chair , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna .

" This will do , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert replied . [He]53-robert put on [his]53-robert soft hat and nervously took it off again , and wiping [his]53-robert face with [his]53-robert handkerchief , complained of the heat .

" Take the fan , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , offering it to [him]53-robert .

" Oh , no ! Thank [you]53-robert . It does no good ; [you]53-robert have to stop fanning some time , and feel all the more uncomfortable afterward . "[115-edna]

" That 's one of the ridiculous things which [men]269-men always say . [I]115-edna have never known [one to speak otherwise of fanning]1838-one to speak otherwise of fanning . How long will [you]53-robert be gone ? "[115-edna]

" Forever , perhaps . [I]115-edna do n't know . It depends upon a good many things . "[115-edna]

" Well , in case it should n't be forever , how long will it be ? "[115-edna]

" [I]115-edna do n't know . "[115-edna]

" This seems to [me]53-robert perfectly preposterous and uncalled for . [I]53-robert do n't like it . [I]53-robert do n't understand [your]53-robert motive for silence and mystery , never saying a word to [me]53-robert about it this morning . "[53-robert] [He]53-robert remained silent , not offering to defend [himself]53-robert . [He]53-robert only said , after a moment :

" Do n't part from [me]53-robert in any ill humor . [I]53-robert never knew [you]849-i to be out of patience with [me]53-robert before . "[53-robert]

" [I]849-i do n't want to part in any ill humor , "[849-i] [she]849-i said . " But ca n't [you]53-robert understand ? [I]849-i 've grown used to seeing [you]53-robert , to having [you]53-robert with [me]849-i all the time , and [your]53-robert action seems unfriendly , even unkind . [You]53-robert do n't even offer an excuse for it . Why , [I]849-i was planning to be together , thinking of how pleasant it would be to see [you]53-robert in [the city]261-the city next winter . "[849-i]

" So was [I]53-robert , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert blurted . " Perhaps that 's the "[53-robert] [He]53-robert stood up suddenly and held out [his]53-robert hand . " Good - by , [[my]850-she dear]1730-my dear [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier ; good - by . [You]53-robert wo n't [I]850-she hope [you]53-robert wo n't completely forget [me]850-she . "[850-she] [She]850-she clung to [his]53-robert hand , striving to detain [him]53-robert .

" Write to [me]850-she when [you]53-robert get [there]204-there , wo n't [you]53-robert , [Robert]53-robert ? "[850-she] [she]850-she entreated .

" [I]623-the people will , thank [you]53-robert . Good - by . "[623-the people]

How unlike [Robert]53-robert ! [The merest acquaintance]851-the merest acquaintance would have said something more emphatic than " [I]623-the people will , thank [you]53-robert ; good - by , "[623-the people] to such a request .

[He]53-robert had evidently already taken leave of [[the people]623-the people over at [the house]157-the house]853-the people over at the house , for [he]53-robert descended the steps and went to join [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet , who was out there with an oar across [his]51-beaudelet shoulder waiting for [Robert]53-robert . [They]855-they walked away in the darkness . [She]850-she could only hear [Beaudelet]51-beaudelet 's voice ; [Robert]53-robert had apparently not even spoken a word of greeting to [[his]53-robert companion]195-his companion .

[Edna]115-edna bit [her]115-edna handkerchief convulsively , striving to hold back and to hide , even from [herself]115-edna as [she]115-edna would have hidden from another , the emotion which was troubling tearing [her]115-edna . [Her]115-edna eyes were brimming with tears .

For the first time [she]115-edna recognized the symptoms of infatuation which [she]115-edna had felt incipiently as [a child]370-a child , as [a girl in [her]115-edna earliest teens]858-a girl in her earliest teens , and later as [a young woman]859-a young woman . The recognition did not lessen the reality , the poignancy of the revelation by any suggestion or promise of instability . The past was nothing to [her]115-edna ; offered no lesson which [she]115-edna was willing to heed . The future was a mystery which [she]115-edna never attempted to penetrate . The present alone was significant ; was [hers]860-hers , to torture [her]115-edna as it was doing then with the biting conviction that [she]115-edna had lost that which [she]115-edna had held , that [she]115-edna had been denied that which [her]115-edna impassioned , newly awakened being demanded .

XVI

" Do [you]115-edna miss [[your]115-edna friend]1842-your friend greatly ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz] asked [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz one morning as [she]84-mademoiselle reisz came creeping up behind [Edna]115-edna , who had just left [[her]115-edna cottage]503-her cottage on [her]115-edna way to [the beach]175-the beach . [She]115-edna spent much of [her]115-edna time in [the water]188-the water since [she]115-edna had acquired finally the art of swimming .
