As [their]864-their stay at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle drew near [its]865-its close , [she]115-edna felt that [she]115-edna could not give too much time to a diversion which afforded [her]115-edna the only real pleasurable moments that [she]115-edna knew . When [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz came and touched [her]115-edna upon the shoulder and spoke to [her]115-edna , [the woman]373-the woman seemed to echo the thought which was ever in [Edna]115-edna 's mind ; or , better , the feeling which constantly possessed [her]115-edna .

[Robert]53-robert 's going had some way taken the brightness , the color , the meaning out of everything . The conditions of [her]115-edna life were in no way changed , but [her]115-edna whole existence was dulled , like a faded garment which seems to be no longer worth wearing . [She]115-edna sought [him]53-robert everywhere in others whom [she]115-edna induced to talk about [him]53-robert . [She]115-edna went up in the mornings to [[Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun 's room]867-madame lebrun 's room , braving the clatter of the old sewing - machine . [She]115-edna sat there and chatted at intervals as [Robert]53-robert had done . [She]115-edna gazed around [the room]522-the room at the pictures and photographs hanging upon the wall , and discovered in some corner an old family album , which [she]115-edna examined with the keenest interest , appealing to [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun for enlightenment concerning the many figures and faces which [she]115-edna discovered between its pages .

There was a picture of [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun with [Robert]53-robert as [a baby]305-a baby , seated in [her]50-madame lebrun lap , [a round - faced infant]870-a round - faced infant with a fist in [his]53-robert mouth . The eyes alone in [the baby]1732-the baby suggested [the man]872-the man . And that was [he]872-the man also in kilts , at the age of five , wearing long curls and holding a whip in [his]872-the man hand . It made [Edna]115-edna laugh , and [she]115-edna laughed , too , at the portrait in [his]872-the man first long trousers ; while another interested [her]115-edna , taken when [he]872-the man left for college , looking thin , long - faced , with eyes full of fire , ambition and great intentions . But there was no recent picture , none which suggested [the Robert who had gone away five days ago , leaving a void and wilderness behind [him]872-the man]873-the robert who had gone away five days ago , leaving a void and wilderness behind him .

" Oh , [Robert]53-robert stopped having [his]53-robert pictures taken when [he]53-robert had to pay for them [himself]53-robert ! [He]53-robert found wiser use for [his]53-robert money , [he]53-robert says , "[50-madame lebrun] explained [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun . [She]50-madame lebrun had a letter from [him]872-the man , written before [he]872-the man left [New Orleans]2-new orleans . [Edna]115-edna wished to see the letter , and [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun told [her]115-edna to look for it either on the table or the dresser , or perhaps it was on the mantelpiece .

The letter was on the bookshelf . It possessed the greatest interest and attraction for [Edna]115-edna ; the envelope , its size and shape , the post - mark , the handwriting . [She]115-edna examined every detail of the outside before opening it . There were only a few lines , setting forth that [he]872-the man would leave [the city]261-the city that afternoon , that [he]872-the man had packed [his]872-the man trunk in good shape , that [he]872-the man was well , and sent [her]50-madame lebrun [his]872-the man love and begged to be affectionately remembered to [all]875-all . There was no special message to [Edna]115-edna except a postscript saying that if [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier desired to finish the book which [he]872-the man had been reading to [her]50-madame lebrun , [[his]872-the man mother]208-his mother would find it in [[his]872-the man room]877-his room , among other books there on the table . [Edna]115-edna experienced a pang of jealousy because [he]872-the man had written to [[his]872-the man mother]208-his mother rather than to [her]208-his mother .

[Every one]374-every one seemed to take for granted that [she]115-edna missed [him]872-the man . Even [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , when [he]186-her husband came down the Saturday following [Robert]53-robert 's departure , expressed regret that [he]186-her husband had gone .

" How do [you]115-edna get on without [him]53-robert , [Edna]115-edna ? "[186-her husband] [he]186-her husband asked .

" It 's very dull without [him]53-robert , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna admitted . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had seen [Robert]53-robert in [the city]261-the city , and [Edna]115-edna asked [him]49-mr. pontellier a dozen questions or more . Where had [they]882-they met ? On [Carondelet Street]5-carondelet street , in the morning . [They]882-they had gone " in "[53-robert] and had a drink and a cigar together . What had [they]882-they talked about ? Chiefly about [his]53-robert prospects in [Mexico]4-mexico , which [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier thought were promising . How did [he]53-robert look ? How did [he]53-robert seem grave , or gay , or how ? Quite cheerful , and wholly taken up with the idea of [his]53-robert trip , which [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier found altogether natural in [a young fellow]883-a young fellow about to seek fortune and adventure in [a strange , queer country]884-a strange , queer country .

[Edna]115-edna tapped [her]115-edna foot impatiently , and wondered why [the children]239-the children persisted in playing in the sun when [they]239-the children might be under the trees . [She]115-edna went down and led [them]239-the children out of the sun , scolding [the quadroon]839-the quadroon for not being more attentive .

It did not strike [her]115-edna as in the least grotesque that [she]115-edna should be making of [Robert]53-robert the object of conversation and leading [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband to speak of [him]53-robert . The sentiment which [she]115-edna entertained for [Robert]53-robert in no way resembled that which [she]115-edna felt for [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , or had ever felt , or ever expected to feel . [She]115-edna had all [her]115-edna life long been accustomed to harbor thoughts and emotions which never voiced [themselves]889-they . [They]889-they had never taken the form of struggles . They belonged to [her]115-edna and were [her]115-edna own , and [she]115-edna entertained the conviction that [she]115-edna had a right to [them]889-they and that [they]889-they concerned [no one]312-no one but [herself]115-edna . [Edna]115-edna had once told [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle that [she]115-edna would never sacrifice [herself]115-edna for [[her]115-edna children]306-her children , or for [any one]1731-any one . Then had followed a rather heated argument ; [the two women]377-the two women did not appear to understand [each other]183-each other or to be talking the same language . [Edna]115-edna tried to appease [[her]115-edna friend]346-her friend , to explain .

" [I]183-each other would give up the unessential ; [I]183-each other would give [my]183-each other money , [I]183-each other would give [my]183-each other life for [[my]183-each other children]1843-my children ; but [I]183-each other would n't give [myself]183-each other . [I]183-each other ca n't make it more clear ; it 's only something which [I]183-each other am beginning to comprehend , which is revealing itself to [me]183-each other . "[183-each other]

" [I]62-madame ratignolle do n't know what [you]115-edna would call the essential , or what [you]115-edna mean by the unessential , "[62-madame ratignolle] said [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle , cheerfully ; " but [a woman who would give [her]1844-a woman who would give her life for her children life for [[her]1844-a woman who would give her life for her children children]306-her children]1844-a woman who would give her life for her children could do no more than that [your]115-edna Bible tells [you]115-edna so . [I]62-madame ratignolle 'm sure [I]62-madame ratignolle could n't do more than that . "[62-madame ratignolle]

" Oh , yes [you]84-mademoiselle reisz could ! "[115-edna] laughed [Edna]115-edna .

[She]115-edna was not surprised at [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's question the morning that lady , following [her]115-edna to [the beach]175-the beach , tapped [her]115-edna on the shoulder and asked if [she]115-edna did not greatly miss [[her]115-edna young friend]897-her young friend .

" Oh , good morning , [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz ; is it [you]115-edna ? Why , of course [I]115-edna miss [Robert]53-robert . Are [you]115-edna going down to bathe ? "[115-edna]

" Why should [I]373-the woman go down to bathe at the very end of the season when [I]373-the woman have n't been in [the surf]1846-the surf all summer , "[373-the woman] replied [the woman]373-the woman , disagreeably .

" [I]115-edna beg [your]373-the woman pardon , "[115-edna] offered [Edna]115-edna , in some embarrassment , for [she]115-edna should have remembered that [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's avoidance of the water had furnished a theme for much pleasantry . [Some among [them]899-some among them]899-some among them thought it was on account of [her]84-mademoiselle reisz false hair , or the dread of getting the violets wet , while [others]459-others attributed it to the natural aversion for water sometimes believed to accompany the artistic temperament . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz offered [Edna]115-edna some chocolates in a paper bag , which [she]115-edna took from [her]115-edna pocket , by way of showing that [she]115-edna bore no ill feeling . [She]115-edna habitually ate chocolates for their sustaining quality ; they contained much nutriment in small compass , [she]115-edna said . [They]901-they saved [her]115-edna from starvation , as [[Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun 's table]902-madame lebrun 's table was utterly impossible ; and [no one save so impertinent a woman as [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun could think of offering such food to [people]904-people and requiring [them]904-people to pay for it .

" [She]50-madame lebrun must feel very lonely without [[her]50-madame lebrun son]748-her son , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , desiring to change the subject . " [[Her]50-madame lebrun favorite son]1848-her favorite son , too . It must have been quite hard to let [him]748-her son go . "[115-edna]

[Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz laughed maliciously .

" [[Her]50-madame lebrun favorite son]1848-her favorite son ! Oh , [dear]1784-dear ! Who could have been imposing such a tale upon [you]1784-dear ? [Aline Lebrun]103-aline lebrun lives for [Victor]78-victor , and for [Victor]78-victor alone . [She]103-aline lebrun has spoiled [him]748-her son into the worthless creature [he]748-her son is . [She]103-aline lebrun worships [him]748-her son and the ground [he]748-her son walks on . [Robert]53-robert is very well in a way , to give up all the money [he]53-robert can earn to [the family]1851-the family , and keep the barest pittance for [himself]53-robert . [Favorite son]1852-favorite son , indeed ! [I]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun miss [the poor fellow]1853-the poor fellow [myself]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun , [[my]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun dear]1730-my dear . [I]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun liked to see [him]1853-the poor fellow and to hear [him]1853-the poor fellow about the place [the only Lebrun who is worth a pinch of salt]1855-the only lebrun who is worth a pinch of salt . [He]1853-the poor fellow comes to see [me]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun often in [the city]261-the city . [I]903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun like to play to [him]1853-the poor fellow . That [Victor]78-victor ! hanging would be too good for [him]1853-the poor fellow . It 's a wonder [Robert]53-robert has n't beaten [him]1853-the poor fellow to death long ago . "[903-no one save so impertinent a woman as madame lebrun]

" [I]115-edna thought [he]1853-the poor fellow had great patience with [[his]1853-the poor fellow brother]813-his brother , "[115-edna] offered [Edna]115-edna , glad to be talking about [Robert]53-robert , no matter what was said .

" Oh ! [he]1853-the poor fellow thrashed [him]1853-the poor fellow well enough a year or two ago , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] said [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz . " It was about [a Spanish girl]1858-a spanish girl , whom [Victor]78-victor considered that [he]78-victor had some sort of claim upon . [He]1853-the poor fellow met [Robert]53-robert one day talking to [the girl]698-the girl , or walking with [her]698-the girl , or bathing with [her]698-the girl , or carrying [her]698-the girl basket [I]84-mademoiselle reisz do n't remember what ; and [he]1853-the poor fellow became so insulting and abusive that [Robert]53-robert gave [him]1853-the poor fellow a thrashing on the spot that has kept [him]1853-the poor fellow comparatively in order for a good while . It 's about time [he]1853-the poor fellow was getting another . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Was [her]698-the girl name [Mariequita]90-mariequita ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna .

" [Mariequita]1860-mariequita yes , that was it ; [Mariequita]90-mariequita . [I]84-mademoiselle reisz had forgotten . Oh , [she]698-the girl 's [a sly one]1861-a sly one , and [a bad one]1862-a bad one , [that Mariequita]1863-that mariequita ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

[Edna]115-edna looked down at [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz and wondered how [she]115-edna could have listened to [her]115-edna venom so long . For some reason [she]115-edna felt depressed , almost unhappy . [She]115-edna had not intended to go into [the water]188-the water ; but [she]115-edna donned [her]115-edna bathing suit , and left [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz alone , seated under the shade of [[the children]239-the children 's tent]422-the children 's tent . The water was growing cooler as the season advanced . [Edna]115-edna plunged and swam about with an abandon that thrilled and invigorated [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna remained a long time in [the water]188-the water , half hoping that [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz would not wait for [her]115-edna .

But [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz waited . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz was very amiable during the walk back , and raved much over [Edna]115-edna 's appearance in [her]84-mademoiselle reisz bathing suit . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz talked about music . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz hoped that [Edna]115-edna would go to see [her]84-mademoiselle reisz in [the city]261-the city , and wrote [her]84-mademoiselle reisz address with the stub of a pencil on a piece of card which [she]84-mademoiselle reisz found in [her]84-mademoiselle reisz pocket .

" When do [you]115-edna leave ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna .

" Next Monday ; and [you]115-edna ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" The following week , "[115-edna] answered [Edna]115-edna , adding , " It has been a pleasant summer , has n't it , [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz ? "[115-edna]

" Well , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] agreed [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz , with a shrug , " rather pleasant , if it had n't been for the mosquitoes and [the Farival twins]161-the farival twins . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

XVII

[The Pontelliers]75-the pontelliers possessed [a very charming home on [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street in [New Orleans]2-new orleans]910-a very charming home on esplanade street in new orleans . [It]910-a very charming home on esplanade street in new orleans was [a large , double cottage]911-a large , double cottage , with a broad front veranda , whose round , fluted columns supported the sloping roof . [The house]157-the house was painted a dazzling white ; the outside shutters , or jalousies , were green . In [the yard]913-the yard , which was kept scrupulously neat , were flowers and plants of every description which flourishes in [South Louisiana]26-south louisiana . Within doors the appointments were perfect after the conventional type . The softest carpets and rugs covered the floors ; rich and tasteful draperies hung at doors and windows . There were paintings , selected with judgment and discrimination , upon the walls . The cut glass , the silver , the heavy damask which daily appeared upon the table were the envy of [many women whose husbands were less generous than [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier]914-many women whose husbands were less generous than mr. pontellier .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier was very fond of walking about [[his]49-mr. pontellier house]915-his house examining [its]915-his house various appointments and details , to see that nothing was amiss . [He]49-mr. pontellier greatly valued [his]49-mr. pontellier possessions , chiefly because they were [his]49-mr. pontellier , and derived genuine pleasure from contemplating a painting , a statuette , a rare lace curtain no matter what after [he]49-mr. pontellier had bought it and placed it among [[his]49-mr. pontellier household gods]916-his household gods .

On Tuesday afternoons Tuesday being [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier 's reception day there was a constant stream of [callers women who came in [carriages]918-carriages or in [the street cars]919-the street cars]917-callers women who came in carriages or in the street cars , or walked when the air was soft and distance permitted . [A light - colored mulatto boy , in dress coat and bearing a diminutive silver tray for the reception of cards]920-a light - colored mulatto boy , in dress coat and bearing a diminutive silver tray for the reception of cards , admitted [them]917-callers women who came in carriages or in the street cars . [A maid]921-a maid , in white fluted cap , offered [the callers]922-the callers liqueur , coffee , or chocolate , as [they]922-the callers might desire . [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier , attired in a handsome reception gown , remained in [the drawing - room]923-the drawing - room the entire afternoon receiving [[her]52-mrs. pontellier visitors]924-her visitors . [Men]269-men sometimes called in the evening with [[their]269-men wives]926-their wives .

This had been the programme which [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier had religiously followed since [her]52-mrs. pontellier marriage , six years before . Certain evenings during the week [she]52-mrs. pontellier and [[her]52-mrs. pontellier husband]186-her husband attended the opera or sometimes the play .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier left [[his]49-mr. pontellier [home]245-home]928-his home in the mornings between nine and ten o'clock , and rarely returned before half - past six or seven in the evening dinner being served at half - past seven .

[He]49-mr. pontellier and [[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife seated [themselves]931-themselves at table one Tuesday evening , a few weeks after [their]931-themselves return from [Grand Isle]1-grand isle . [They]931-themselves were alone together . [The boys]231-the boys were being put to bed ; the patter of [their]231-the boys bare , escaping feet could be heard occasionally , as well as the pursuing voice of the quadroon , lifted in mild protest and entreaty . [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier did not wear [her]52-mrs. pontellier usual Tuesday reception gown ; [she]52-mrs. pontellier was in ordinary house dress . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , who was observant about such things , noticed it , as [he]49-mr. pontellier served the soup and handed it to [the boy in waiting]933-the boy in waiting .

" Tired out , [Edna]115-edna ? Whom did [you]115-edna have ? [Many callers]1865-many callers ? "[49-mr. pontellier] [he]49-mr. pontellier asked . [He]49-mr. pontellier tasted [his]49-mr. pontellier soup and began to season it with pepper , salt , vinegar , mustard everything within reach .

" There were a good many , "[115-edna] replied [Edna]115-edna , who was eating [her]115-edna soup with evident satisfaction . " [I]115-edna found [their]1865-many callers cards when [I]115-edna got [home]245-home ; [I]115-edna was out . "[115-edna]

" Out ! "[186-her husband] exclaimed [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , with something like genuine consternation in [his]186-her husband voice as [he]186-her husband laid down the vinegar cruet and looked at [her]115-edna through [his]186-her husband glasses . " Why , what could have taken [you]115-edna out on Tuesday ? What did [you]115-edna have to do ? "[186-her husband]

" Nothing . [I]186-her husband simply felt like going out , and [I]186-her husband went out . "[186-her husband]

" Well , [I]186-her husband hope [you]115-edna left some suitable excuse , "[186-her husband] said [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , somewhat appeased , as [he]186-her husband added a dash of cayenne pepper to the soup .

" No , [I]186-her husband left no excuse . [I]186-her husband told [Joe]104-joe to say [I]186-her husband was out , that was all . "[186-her husband]

" Why , [[my]186-her husband dear]1730-my dear , [I]186-her husband should think [you]115-edna 'd understand by this time that [people]904-people do n't do such things ; [we]1869-we 've got to observe _ les convenances _ if [we]1869-we ever expect to get on and keep up with the procession . If [you]115-edna felt that [you]115-edna had to leave [home]245-home this afternoon , [you]115-edna should have left some suitable explanation for [your]115-edna absence . "[186-her husband]

" This soup is really impossible ; it 's strange that [woman]1871-woman has n't learned yet to make a decent soup . [Any free - lunch stand in [town]1873-town]1872-any free - lunch stand in town serves a better one . Was [Mrs. Belthrop]105-mrs. belthrop [here]1819-here ? "[186-her husband]

" Bring the tray with the cards , [Joe]104-joe . [I]186-her husband do n't remember who was [here]1819-here . "[186-her husband]

[The boy]936-the boy retired and returned after a moment , bringing the tiny silver tray , which was covered with [ladies]268-ladies ' visiting cards . [He]936-the boy handed it to [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier .

" Give it to [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , "[52-mrs. pontellier] [she]52-mrs. pontellier said .

[Joe]104-joe offered the tray to [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , and removed the soup .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier scanned the names of [[[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife 's callers]939-his wife 's callers , reading some of [them]939-his wife 's callers aloud , with comments as [he]49-mr. pontellier read .

" [The Misses Delasidas]106-the misses delasidas . ' [I]940-i worked a big deal in futures for [[their]106-the misses delasidas father]194-their father this morning ; [nice girls]1877-nice girls ; it 's time [they]106-the misses delasidas were getting married . [Mrs. Belthrop]105-mrs. belthrop . ' [I]940-i tell [you]52-mrs. pontellier what it is , [Edna]115-edna ; [you]52-mrs. pontellier ca n't afford to snub [Mrs. Belthrop]105-mrs. belthrop . Why , [Belthrop]105-mrs. belthrop could buy and sell [us]1878-us ten times over . [His]194-their father business is worth a good , round sum to [me]940-i . [You]52-mrs. pontellier 'd better write [her]105-mrs. belthrop a note . [Mrs. James Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp . ' [Hugh]108-hugh ! the less [you]108-hugh have to do with [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp , the better . [Madame Laforc]109-madame laforc . ' Came all the way from [Carrolton]27-carrolton , too , [poor old soul]1879-poor old soul . [Miss Wiggs]110-miss wiggs , ' [Mrs. Eleanor Boltons]111-mrs. eleanor boltons . ' "[940-i] [He]940-i pushed the cards aside .

" [Mercy]112-mercy ! "[115-edna] exclaimed [Edna]115-edna , who had been fuming . " Why are [you]49-mr. pontellier taking the thing so seriously and making such a fuss over it ? "[115-edna]

" [I]940-i 'm not making any fuss over it . But it 's just such seeming trifles that [we]1880-we 've got to take seriously ; such things count . "[940-i]

The fish was scorched . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier would not touch it . [Edna]115-edna said [she]115-edna did not mind a little scorched taste . The roast was in some way not to [his]49-mr. pontellier fancy , and [he]49-mr. pontellier did not like the manner in which the vegetables were served .

" It seems to [me]49-mr. pontellier , "[49-mr. pontellier] [he]49-mr. pontellier said , " [we]1880-we spend money enough in [this house]1881-this house to procure at least one meal a day which [a man]521-a man could eat and retain [his]521-a man self - respect . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" [You]49-mr. pontellier used to think [the cook]691-the cook was a treasure , "[115-edna] returned [Edna]115-edna , indifferently .

" Perhaps [she]691-the cook was when [she]691-the cook first came ; but [cooks]1884-cooks are only human . [They]1884-cooks need looking after , like [any other class of persons that [you]49-mr. pontellier employ]1885-any other class of persons that you employ . Suppose [I]49-mr. pontellier did n't look after [the clerks in [[my]49-mr. pontellier office]1887-my office]1886-the clerks in my office , just let [them]1886-the clerks in my office run things [their]1886-the clerks in my office own way ; [they]1886-the clerks in my office 'd soon make a nice mess of [me]49-mr. pontellier and [my]49-mr. pontellier business . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Where are [you]186-her husband going ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna , seeing that [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband arose from table without having eaten a morsel except a taste of the highly - seasoned soup .

" [I]186-her husband 'm going to get [my]186-her husband dinner at [the club]1888-the club . Good night . "[186-her husband] [He]186-her husband went into [the hall]536-the hall , took [his]186-her husband hat and stick from the stand , and left [the house]157-the house .

[She]115-edna was somewhat familiar with such scenes . They had often made [her]115-edna very unhappy . On a few previous occasions [she]115-edna had been completely deprived of any desire to finish [her]115-edna dinner . Sometimes [she]115-edna had gone into [the kitchen]504-the kitchen to administer a tardy rebuke to [the cook]691-the cook . Once [she]115-edna went to [[her]115-edna room]224-her room and studied the cookbook during an entire evening , finally writing out a menu for the week , which left [her]115-edna harassed with a feeling that , after all , [she]115-edna had accomplished no good that was worth the name .

But that evening [Edna]115-edna finished [her]115-edna dinner alone , with forced deliberation . [Her]115-edna face was flushed and [her]115-edna eyes flamed with some inward fire that lighted them . After finishing [her]115-edna dinner [she]115-edna went to [[her]115-edna room]224-her room , having instructed [the boy]936-the boy to tell [any other callers]949-any other callers that [she]115-edna was indisposed .

It was [a large , beautiful room]950-a large , beautiful room , rich and picturesque in the soft , dim light which [the maid]951-the maid had turned low . [She]115-edna went and stood at an open window and looked out upon the deep tangle of [the garden below]952-the garden below . All the mystery and witchery of the night seemed to have gathered there amid the perfumes and the dusky and tortuous outlines of flowers and foliage . [She]115-edna was seeking [herself]115-edna and finding [herself]115-edna in just such sweet , half - darkness which met [her]115-edna moods . But the voices were not soothing that came to [her]115-edna from the darkness and the sky above and the stars . They jeered and sounded mournful notes without promise , devoid even of hope . [She]115-edna turned back into [the room]522-the room and began to walk to and fro down [its]522-the room whole length without stopping , without resting . [She]115-edna carried in [her]115-edna hands a thin handkerchief , which [she]115-edna tore into ribbons , rolled into a ball , and flung from [her]115-edna . Once [she]115-edna stopped , and taking off [her]115-edna wedding ring , flung it upon the carpet . When [she]115-edna saw it lying there , [she]115-edna stamped [her]115-edna heel upon it , striving to crush it . But [her]115-edna small boot heel did not make an indenture , not a mark upon the little glittering circlet .

In a sweeping passion [she]115-edna seized a glass vase from the table and flung it upon the tiles of the hearth . [She]115-edna wanted to destroy something . The crash and clatter were what [she]115-edna wanted to hear .

[A maid]921-a maid , alarmed at the din of breaking glass , entered [the room]522-the room to discover what was the matter .

" A vase fell upon the hearth , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna . " Never mind ; leave it till morning . "[115-edna]

" Oh ! [you]115-edna might get some of the glass in [your]115-edna feet , [ma'am]1889-ma'am , "[614-the young woman] insisted [the young woman]614-the young woman , picking up bits of the broken vase that were scattered upon the carpet . " And here 's [your]115-edna ring , [ma'am]1889-ma'am , under the chair . "[115-edna]

[Edna]115-edna held out [her]115-edna hand , and taking the ring , slipped it upon [her]115-edna finger .

XVIII

The following morning [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , upon leaving for [[his]49-mr. pontellier office]957-his office , asked [Edna]115-edna if [she]115-edna would not meet [him]49-mr. pontellier in [town]1873-town in order to look at some new fixtures for [the library]959-the library .

" [I]49-mr. pontellier hardly think [we]1891-we need new fixtures , [L]57-l once . Do n't let [us]1891-we get anything new ; [you]115-edna are too extravagant . [I]49-mr. pontellier do n't believe [you]115-edna ever think of saving or putting by . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" The way to become rich is to make money , [[my]49-mr. pontellier dear]1730-my dear [Edna]115-edna , not to save it , "[49-mr. pontellier] [he]49-mr. pontellier said . [He]49-mr. pontellier regretted that [she]115-edna did not feel inclined to go with [him]49-mr. pontellier and select new fixtures . [He]49-mr. pontellier kissed [her]115-edna good - by , and told [her]115-edna [she]115-edna was not looking well and must take care of [herself]115-edna . [She]115-edna was unusually pale and very quiet .

[She]115-edna stood on [the front veranda]960-the front veranda as [he]49-mr. pontellier quitted [the house]157-the house , and absently picked a few sprays of jessamine that grew upon a trellis near by . [She]115-edna inhaled the odor of the blossoms and thrust them into the bosom of [her]115-edna white morning gown . [The boys]231-the boys were dragging along the banquette a small " [express wagon]1893-express wagon , "[231-the boys] which [they]231-the boys had filled with blocks and sticks . [The quadroon]839-the quadroon was following [them]231-the boys with little quick steps , having assumed a fictitious animation and alacrity for the occasion . [A fruit vender]964-a fruit vender was crying [his]964-a fruit vender wares in [the street]244-the street .

[Edna]115-edna looked straight before [her]115-edna with a self - absorbed expression upon [her]115-edna face . [She]115-edna felt no interest in anything about [her]115-edna . [The street]244-the street , [the children]239-the children , the fruit vender , the flowers growing there under [her]115-edna eyes , were all part and parcel of an alien world which had suddenly become antagonistic .

[She]115-edna went back into [the house]157-the house . [She]115-edna had thought of speaking to [the cook]691-the cook concerning [her]115-edna blunders of the previous night ; but [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had saved [her]115-edna that disagreeable mission , for which [she]115-edna was so poorly fitted . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's arguments were usually convincing with [those whom [he]49-mr. pontellier employed]970-those whom he employed . [He]49-mr. pontellier left [home]245-home feeling quite sure that [he]49-mr. pontellier and [Edna]115-edna would sit down that evening , and possibly a few subsequent evenings , to a dinner deserving of the name .

[Edna]115-edna spent an hour or two in looking over some of [her]115-edna old sketches . [She]115-edna could see [their]972-their shortcomings and defects , which were glaring in [her]115-edna eyes . [She]115-edna tried to work a little , but found [she]115-edna was not in the humor . Finally [she]115-edna gathered together a few of the sketches those which [she]115-edna considered the least discreditable ; and [she]115-edna carried them with [her]115-edna when , a little later , [she]115-edna dressed and left [the house]157-the house . [She]115-edna looked handsome and distinguished in [her]115-edna street gown . The tan of [the seashore]606-the seashore had left [her]115-edna face , and [her]115-edna forehead was smooth , white , and polished beneath [her]115-edna heavy , yellow - brown hair . There were a few freckles on [her]115-edna face , and a small , dark mole near the under lip and one on the temple , half - hidden in [her]115-edna hair .

As [Edna]115-edna walked along [the street]244-the street [she]115-edna was thinking of [Robert]53-robert . [She]115-edna was still under the spell of [her]115-edna infatuation . [She]115-edna had tried to forget [him]53-robert , realizing the inutility of remembering . But the thought of [him]53-robert was like an obsession , ever pressing itself upon [her]115-edna . It was not that [she]115-edna dwelt upon details of [their]976-their acquaintance , or recalled in any special or peculiar way [his]53-robert personality ; it was [his]53-robert being , [his]53-robert existence , which dominated [her]115-edna thought , fading sometimes as if it would melt into the mist of the forgotten , reviving again with an intensity which filled [her]115-edna with an incomprehensible longing .

[Edna]115-edna was on [her]115-edna way to [[Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle 's]977-madame ratignolle 's . [Their]976-their intimacy , begun at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle , had not declined , and [they]976-their had seen [each other]183-each other with some frequency since [their]976-their return to [the city]261-the city . [The Ratignolles]100-the ratignolles lived at no great distance from [[Edna]115-edna 's home]980-edna 's home , on [the corner of [a side street]982-a side street]981-the corner of a side street , where [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle owned and conducted [a drug store which enjoyed a steady and prosperous trade]983-a drug store which enjoyed a steady and prosperous trade . [[His]53-robert father]984-his father had been in the business before [him]83-monsieur ratignolle , and [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle stood well in [the community]985-the community and bore an enviable reputation for integrity and clearheadedness . [[His]83-monsieur ratignolle family]243-his family lived in [commodious apartments]987-commodious apartments over [the store]988-the store , having an entrance on the side within [the _ porte coch re _]989-the _ porte coch re _ . There was something which [Edna]115-edna thought very French , very foreign , about [their]100-the ratignolles whole manner of living . In [the large and pleasant salon which extended across the width of [the house]157-the house]990-the large and pleasant salon which extended across the width of the house , [the Ratignolles]100-the ratignolles entertained [[their]100-the ratignolles friends]992-their friends once a fortnight with a _ soir e musicale _ , sometimes diversified by card - playing . There was [a friend who played upon the cello]993-a friend who played upon the cello . [One]994-one brought [his]994-one flute and another [his]994-one violin , while there were [some who sang and a number who performed upon the piano with various degrees of taste and agility]995-some who sang and a number who performed upon the piano with various degrees of taste and agility . [The Ratignolles]100-the ratignolles ' _ soir es musicales _ were widely known , and it was considered a privilege to be invited to [them]100-the ratignolles .

[Edna]115-edna found [[her]115-edna friend]346-her friend engaged in assorting the clothes which had returned that morning from [the laundry]997-the laundry . [She]115-edna at once abandoned [her]115-edna occupation upon seeing [Edna]115-edna , who had been ushered without ceremony into [her]115-edna presence .

" ' Cit can do it as well as [I]115-edna ; it is really [her]115-edna business , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna explained to [Edna]115-edna , who apologized for interrupting [her]115-edna . And [she]115-edna summoned [a young black woman , whom [she]115-edna instructed , in French]998-a young black woman , whom she instructed , in french , to be very careful in checking off the list which [she]115-edna handed [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna told [her]115-edna to notice particularly if a fine linen handkerchief of [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle 's , which was missing last week , had been returned ; and to be sure to set to one side such pieces as required mending and darning .

Then placing an arm around [Edna]115-edna 's waist , [she]115-edna led [her]115-edna to the front of [the house]157-the house , to [the salon]1000-the salon , where it was cool and sweet with the odor of great roses that stood upon the hearth in jars .

[Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle looked more beautiful than ever there at [home]245-home , in a neglig which left [her]62-madame ratignolle arms almost wholly bare and exposed the rich , melting curves of [her]62-madame ratignolle white throat .

" Perhaps [I]115-edna shall be able to paint [your]62-madame ratignolle picture some day , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna with a smile when [they]1002-they were seated . [She]115-edna produced the roll of sketches and started to unfold them . " [I]115-edna believe [I]115-edna ought to work again . [I]115-edna feel as if [I]115-edna wanted to be doing something . What do [you]62-madame ratignolle think of [them]1894-them ? Do [you]62-madame ratignolle think it worth while to take it up again and study some more ? [I]115-edna might study for a while with [Laidpore]113-laidpore . "[115-edna]

[She]115-edna knew that [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle 's opinion in such a matter would be next to valueless , that [she]115-edna [herself]115-edna had not alone decided , but determined ; but [she]115-edna sought the words of praise and encouragement that would help [her]115-edna to put heart into [her]115-edna venture .

" [Your]115-edna talent is immense , [dear]1784-dear ! "[115-edna]

" Nonsense ! "[115-edna] protested [Edna]115-edna , well pleased .

" Immense , [I]62-madame ratignolle tell [you]115-edna , "[62-madame ratignolle] persisted [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle , surveying the sketches one by one , at close range , then holding them at arm 's length , narrowing [her]115-edna eyes , and dropping [her]115-edna head on one side . " Surely , [this Bavarian peasant]1896-this bavarian peasant is worthy of framing ; and this basket of apples ! never have [I]115-edna seen anything more lifelike . [One]303-one might almost be tempted to reach out a hand and take one . "[115-edna]

[Edna]115-edna could not control a feeling which bordered upon complacency at [[her]115-edna friend]346-her friend 's praise , even realizing , as [she]115-edna did , its true worth . [She]115-edna retained a few of the sketches , and gave all the rest to [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle , who appreciated the gift far beyond its value and proudly exhibited the pictures to [[her]62-madame ratignolle husband]186-her husband when [he]186-her husband came up from [the store]988-the store a little later for [his]186-her husband midday dinner .

[Mr. Ratignolle]114-mr. ratignolle was [one of [those men who are called the salt of [the earth]1818-the earth]1007-those men who are called the salt of the earth]1006-one of those men who are called the salt of the earth . [His]114-mr. ratignolle cheerfulness was unbounded , and it was matched by [his]114-mr. ratignolle goodness of heart , [his]114-mr. ratignolle broad charity , and common sense . [He]114-mr. ratignolle and [[his]114-mr. ratignolle wife]179-his wife spoke English with an accent which was only discernible through its un - English emphasis and a certain carefulness and deliberation . [[Edna]115-edna 's husband]1010-edna 's husband spoke English with no accent whatever . [The Ratignolles]100-the ratignolles understood [each other]183-each other perfectly . If ever the fusion of [two human beings]1012-two human beings into one has been accomplished on this sphere it was surely in [their]100-the ratignolles union .

As [Edna]115-edna seated [herself]115-edna at table with [them]100-the ratignolles [she]115-edna thought , " Better a dinner of herbs , "[115-edna] though it did not take [her]115-edna long to discover that it was no dinner of herbs , but a delicious repast , simple , choice , and in every way satisfying .

[Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle was delighted to see [her]115-edna , though [he]83-monsieur ratignolle found [her]115-edna looking not so well as at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle , and [he]83-monsieur ratignolle advised a tonic . [He]83-monsieur ratignolle talked a good deal on various topics , a little politics , some city news and neighborhood gossip . [He]83-monsieur ratignolle spoke with an animation and earnestness that gave an exaggerated importance to every syllable [he]83-monsieur ratignolle uttered . [[His]83-monsieur ratignolle wife]179-his wife was keenly interested in everything [he]83-monsieur ratignolle said , laying down [her]179-his wife fork the better to listen , chiming in , taking the words out of [his]83-monsieur ratignolle mouth .

[Edna]115-edna felt depressed rather than soothed after leaving [them]100-the ratignolles . The little glimpse of domestic harmony which had been offered [her]115-edna , gave [her]115-edna no regret , no longing . It was not a condition of life which fitted [her]115-edna , and [she]115-edna could see in it but an appalling and hopeless ennui . [She]115-edna was moved by a kind of commiseration for [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle , a pity for that colorless existence which never uplifted its possessor beyond the region of blind contentment , in which no moment of anguish ever visited [her]115-edna soul , in which [she]115-edna would never have the taste of life 's delirium . [Edna]115-edna vaguely wondered what [she]115-edna meant by " life 's delirium . "[115-edna] It had crossed [her]115-edna thought like some unsought , extraneous impression .

[XIX

Edna]115-edna could not help but think that it was very foolish , very childish , to have stamped upon [her]115-edna wedding ring and smashed the crystal vase upon the tiles . [She]115-edna was visited by no more outbursts , moving [her]115-edna to such futile expedients . [She]115-edna began to do as [she]115-edna liked and to feel as [she]115-edna liked . [She]115-edna completely abandoned [her]115-edna Tuesdays at [home]245-home , and did not return the visits of [those who had called upon [her]115-edna]1015-those who had called upon her . [She]115-edna made no ineffectual efforts to conduct [[her]115-edna household]1016-her household _ en bonne m nag re _ , going and coming as it suited [her]115-edna fancy , and , so far as [she]115-edna was able , lending [herself]115-edna to any passing caprice .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had been [a rather courteous husband]1017-a rather courteous husband so long as [he]49-mr. pontellier met a certain tacit submissiveness in [[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife . But [her]115-edna new and unexpected line of conduct completely bewildered [him]49-mr. pontellier . It shocked [him]49-mr. pontellier . Then [her]115-edna absolute disregard for [her]115-edna duties as [a wife]1019-a wife angered [him]49-mr. pontellier . When [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier became rude , [Edna]115-edna grew insolent . [She]115-edna had resolved never to take another step backward .

" It seems to [me]115-edna the utmost folly for [a woman at the head of a household]1898-a woman at the head of a household , and [the mother of]1899-the mother of [children]242-children , to spend in an atelier days which would be better employed contriving for the comfort of [[her]115-edna family]1901-her family . "[115-edna]

" [I]115-edna feel like painting , "[115-edna] answered [Edna]115-edna . " Perhaps [I]115-edna sha n't always feel like it . "[115-edna]

" Then in [God]96-god 's name paint ! but do n't let [the family]1851-the family go to the devil . There 's [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle ; because [she]62-madame ratignolle keeps up [her]62-madame ratignolle music , [she]62-madame ratignolle does n't let everything else go to chaos . And [she]62-madame ratignolle 's more of [a musician]1903-a musician than [you]49-mr. pontellier are [a painter]1904-a painter . "[115-edna]

" [She]62-madame ratignolle is n't [a musician]1903-a musician , and [I]115-edna 'm not [a painter]1904-a painter . It is n't on account of painting that [I]115-edna let things go . "[115-edna]

" On account of what , then ? "[115-edna]

" Oh ! [I]115-edna do n't know . Let [me]115-edna alone ; [you]49-mr. pontellier bother [me]115-edna . "[115-edna]

It sometimes entered [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's mind to wonder if [[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife were not growing a little unbalanced mentally . [He]49-mr. pontellier could see plainly that [she]179-his wife was not [herself]179-his wife . That is , [he]49-mr. pontellier could not see that [she]179-his wife was becoming [herself]179-his wife and daily casting aside that fictitious self which [we]1021-we assume like a garment with which to appear before [the world]281-the world .

[[Her]179-his wife husband]186-her husband let [her]179-his wife alone as [she]179-his wife requested , and went away to [[his]49-mr. pontellier office]957-his office . [Edna]115-edna went up to [[her]115-edna atelier]1025-her atelier [a bright room in the top of [the house]157-the house]1026-a bright room in the top of the house . [She]115-edna was working with great energy and interest , without accomplishing anything , however , which satisfied [her]115-edna even in the smallest degree . For a time [she]115-edna had [the whole household]1028-the whole household enrolled in the service of art . [The boys]231-the boys posed for [her]115-edna . [They]231-the boys thought it amusing at first , but the occupation soon lost its attractiveness when [they]231-the boys discovered that it was not a game arranged especially for [their]231-the boys entertainment . [The quadroon]839-the quadroon sat for hours before [Edna]115-edna 's palette , patient as [a savage]1031-a savage , while [the house - maid]1032-the house - maid took charge of [the children]239-the children , and [the drawing - room]923-the drawing - room went undusted . But [the house - maid]1032-the house - maid , too , served [her]1032-the house - maid term as [model]1036-model when [Edna]115-edna perceived that [the young woman]614-the young woman 's back and shoulders were molded on classic lines , and that [her]115-edna hair , loosened from its confining cap , became an inspiration . While [Edna]115-edna worked [she]115-edna sometimes sang low the little air , " _ Ah ! si tu savais ! _ "[115-edna]

It moved [her]115-edna with recollections . [She]115-edna could hear again the ripple of the water , the flapping sail . [She]115-edna could see the glint of the moon upon [the bay]712-the bay , and could feel the soft , gusty beating of the hot south wind . A subtle current of desire passed through [her]115-edna body , weakening [her]115-edna hold upon the brushes and making [her]115-edna eyes burn .

There were days when [she]115-edna was very happy without knowing why . [She]115-edna was happy to be alive and breathing , when [her]115-edna whole being seemed to be one with the sunlight , the color , the odors , the luxuriant warmth of some perfect Southern day . [She]115-edna liked then to wander alone into [strange and unfamiliar places]1039-strange and unfamiliar places . [She]115-edna discovered many [a sunny , sleepy corner]1040-a sunny , sleepy corner , fashioned to dream in . And [she]115-edna found it good to dream and to be alone and unmolested .

There were days when [she]115-edna was unhappy , [she]115-edna did not know why , when it did not seem worth while to be glad or sorry , to be alive or dead ; when life appeared to [her]115-edna like a grotesque pandemonium and humanity like worms struggling blindly toward inevitable annihilation . [She]115-edna could not work on such a day , nor weave fancies to stir [her]115-edna pulses and warm [her]115-edna blood .

[XX]116-xx

It was during such a mood that [Edna]115-edna hunted up [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz . [She]115-edna had not forgotten the rather disagreeable impression left upon [her]115-edna by [their]1041-their last interview ; but [she]115-edna nevertheless felt a desire to see [her]84-mademoiselle reisz above all , to listen while [she]115-edna played upon the piano . Quite early in the afternoon [she]115-edna started upon [her]115-edna quest for [the pianist]600-the pianist . Unfortunately [she]115-edna had mislaid or lost [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's card , and looking up [her]115-edna address in the city directory , [she]115-edna found that [the woman]373-the woman lived on [Bienville Street]28-bienville street , some distance away . The directory which fell into [her]115-edna hands was a year or more old , however , and upon reaching the number indicated , [Edna]115-edna discovered that [the house]157-the house was occupied by [a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let]1045-a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let . [They]1045-a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let had been living [there]204-there for six months , and knew absolutely nothing of [a Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz . In fact , [they]1045-a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let knew nothing of [any of [[their]1045-a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let neighbors]1048-their neighbors]1047-any of their neighbors ; [[their]1045-a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let lodgers]1049-their lodgers were [all people of the highest distinction]1050-all people of the highest distinction , [they]1045-a respectable family of mulattoes who had _ chambres garnies _ to let assured [Edna]115-edna . [She]115-edna did not linger to discuss class distinctions with [Madame Pouponne]117-madame pouponne , but hastened to [a neighboring grocery store]1051-a neighboring grocery store , feeling sure that [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz would have left [her]84-mademoiselle reisz address with [the proprietor]1052-the proprietor .

[He]1052-the proprietor knew [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz a good deal better than [he]1052-the proprietor wanted to know [her]84-mademoiselle reisz , [he]1052-the proprietor informed [[his]1052-the proprietor questioner]1053-his questioner . In truth , [he]1052-the proprietor did not want to know [her]84-mademoiselle reisz at all , or anything concerning [her]84-mademoiselle reisz [the most disagreeable and unpopular woman who ever lived in [Bienville Street]28-bienville street]1054-the most disagreeable and unpopular woman who ever lived in bienville street . [He]1052-the proprietor thanked heaven [she]84-mademoiselle reisz had left [the neighborhood]1055-the neighborhood , and was equally thankful that [he]1052-the proprietor did not know where [she]84-mademoiselle reisz had gone .

[Edna]115-edna 's desire to see [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz had increased tenfold since these unlooked - for obstacles had arisen to thwart it . [She]115-edna was wondering who could give [her]115-edna the information [she]115-edna sought , when it suddenly occurred to [her]115-edna that [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun would be the one most likely to do so . [She]115-edna knew it was useless to ask [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle , who was on the most distant terms with [the musician]1056-the musician , and preferred to know nothing concerning [her]50-madame lebrun . [She]115-edna had once been almost as emphatic in expressing [herself]115-edna upon the subject as [the corner grocer]1057-the corner grocer .

[Edna]115-edna knew that [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun had returned to [the city]261-the city , for it was the middle of [November]29-november . And [she]115-edna also knew where [the Lebruns]56-the lebruns lived , on [Chartres Street]30-chartres street .

[[Their]56-the lebruns home]1059-their home from the outside looked like [a prison]1060-a prison , with iron bars before the door and lower windows . The iron bars were a relic of the old _ r gime _ , and [no one]312-no one had ever thought of dislodging them . At the side was a high fence enclosing [the garden]1062-the garden . A gate or door opening upon [the street]244-the street was locked . [Edna]115-edna rang the bell at [this side garden]1064-this side garden gate , and stood upon [the banquette]1065-the banquette , waiting to be admitted .

It was [Victor]78-victor who opened the gate for [her]115-edna . [A black woman]1066-a black woman , wiping [her]1066-a black woman hands upon [her]1066-a black woman apron , was close at [his]78-victor heels . Before [she]115-edna saw [them]56-the lebruns [Edna]115-edna could hear [them]56-the lebruns in altercation , [the woman]373-the woman plainly an anomaly claiming the right to be allowed to perform [her]373-the woman duties , one of which was to answer the bell .

[Victor]78-victor was surprised and delighted to see [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier , and [he]78-victor made no attempt to conceal either [his]78-victor astonishment or [his]78-victor delight . [He]78-victor was [a dark - browed , good - looking youngster of nineteen]1068-a dark - browed , good - looking youngster of nineteen , greatly resembling [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother , but with ten times [her]1066-a black woman impetuosity . [He]78-victor instructed [the black woman]1070-the black woman to go at once and inform [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun that [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier desired to see [her]50-madame lebrun . [The woman]373-the woman grumbled a refusal to do part of [her]373-the woman duty when [she]373-the woman had not been permitted to do it all , and started back to [her]373-the woman interrupted task of weeding [the garden]1062-the garden . Whereupon [Victor]78-victor administered a rebuke in the form of a volley of abuse , which , owing to its rapidity and incoherence , was all but incomprehensible to [Edna]115-edna . Whatever it was , the rebuke was convincing , for [the woman]373-the woman dropped [her]373-the woman hoe and went mumbling into [the house]157-the house .

[Edna]115-edna did not wish to enter . It was very pleasant there on [the side porch]1075-the side porch , where there were chairs , a wicker lounge , and a small table . [She]115-edna seated [herself]115-edna , for [she]115-edna was tired from [her]115-edna long tramp ; and [she]115-edna began to rock gently and smooth out the folds of [her]115-edna silk parasol . [Victor]78-victor drew up [his]78-victor chair beside [her]115-edna . [He]78-victor at once explained that [the black woman]1070-the black woman 's offensive conduct was all due to imperfect training , as [he]78-victor was not there to take [her]1070-the black woman in hand . [He]78-victor had only come up from [the island]263-the island the morning before , and expected to return next day . [He]78-victor stayed all winter at [the island]263-the island ; [he]78-victor lived [there]204-there , and kept [the place]1080-the place in order and got things ready for [the summer visitors]1081-the summer visitors .

But [a man]521-a man needed occasional relaxation , [he]78-victor informed [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier , and every now and again [he]78-victor drummed up a pretext to bring [him]521-a man to [the city]261-the city . [My]0-the rockaway ! but [he]78-victor had had a time of it the evening before ! [He]78-victor would n't want [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother to know , and [he]78-victor began to talk in a whisper . [He]78-victor was scintillant with recollections . Of course , [he]78-victor could n't think of telling [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier all about it , [she]52-mrs. pontellier being [a woman]1753-a woman and not comprehending such things . But it all began with [a girl]1086-a girl peeping and smiling at [him]78-victor through the shutters as [he]78-victor passed by . Oh ! but [she]1086-a girl was [a beauty]1087-a beauty ! Certainly [he]78-victor smiled back , and went up and talked to [her]1086-a girl . [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier did not know [him]78-victor if [she]52-mrs. pontellier supposed [he]78-victor was one to let an opportunity like that escape [him]78-victor . Despite [herself]52-mrs. pontellier , [the youngster]776-the youngster amused [her]52-mrs. pontellier . [She]52-mrs. pontellier must have betrayed in [her]52-mrs. pontellier look some degree of interest or entertainment . [The boy]936-the boy grew more daring , and [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier might have found [herself]52-mrs. pontellier , in a little while , listening to a highly colored story but for the timely appearance of [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun .

[That lady]309-that lady was still clad in white , according to [her]309-that lady custom of the summer . [Her]309-that lady eyes beamed an effusive welcome . Would not [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier go inside ? Would [she]52-mrs. pontellier partake of some refreshment ? Why had [she]52-mrs. pontellier not been [there]204-there before ? How was [that dear Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier and how were [those sweet children]1092-those sweet children ? Had [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier ever known such a warm November ?

[Victor]78-victor went and reclined on the wicker lounge behind [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother 's chair , where [he]78-victor commanded a view of [Edna]115-edna 's face . [He]78-victor had taken [her]115-edna parasol from [her]115-edna hands while [he]78-victor spoke to [her]115-edna , and [he]78-victor now lifted it and twirled it above [him]78-victor as [he]78-victor lay on [his]78-victor back . When [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun complained that it was _ so _ dull coming back to [the city]261-the city ; that [she]50-madame lebrun saw [_ so _ few people]1095-_ so _ few people now ; that even [Victor]78-victor , when [he]78-victor came up from [the island]263-the island for a day or two , had _ so _ much to occupy [him]78-victor and engage [his]78-victor time ; then it was that [the youth]736-the youth went into contortions on [the lounge]1098-the lounge and winked mischievously at [Edna]115-edna . [She]115-edna somehow felt like [a confederate in crime]1099-a confederate in crime , and tried to look severe and disapproving .

There had been but two letters from [Robert]53-robert , with little in them , [they]1100-they told [her]115-edna . [Victor]78-victor said it was really not worth while to go inside for the letters , when [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother entreated [him]78-victor to go in search of them . [He]78-victor remembered the contents , which in truth [he]78-victor rattled off very glibly when put to the test .

One letter was written from [Vera Cruz]23-vera cruz and the other from [the City of [Mexico]4-mexico]1102-the city of mexico . [He]78-victor had met [Montel]81-montel , who was doing everything toward [his]78-victor advancement . So far , the financial situation was no improvement over the one [he]78-victor had left in [New Orleans]2-new orleans , but of course the prospects were vastly better . [He]78-victor wrote of [the City of Mexico]1102-the city of mexico , [the buildings]1104-the buildings , [the people]623-the people and [their]623-the people habits , the conditions of life which [he]78-victor found [there]204-there . [He]78-victor sent [his]78-victor love to [the family]1851-the family . [He]78-victor inclosed a check to [[his]78-victor mother]208-his mother , and hoped [she]208-his mother would affectionately remember [him]78-victor to all [[his]78-victor friends]1109-his friends . That was about the substance of the two letters . [Edna]115-edna felt that if there had been a message for [her]115-edna , [she]115-edna would have received it . The despondent frame of mind in which [she]115-edna had left [home]245-home began again to overtake [her]115-edna , and [she]115-edna remembered that [she]115-edna wished to find [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz .

[Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun knew where [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz lived . [She]50-madame lebrun gave [Edna]115-edna the address , regretting that [she]115-edna would not consent to stay and spend the remainder of the afternoon , and pay a visit to [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz some other day . The afternoon was already well advanced .

[Victor]78-victor escorted [her]84-mademoiselle reisz out upon the banquette , lifted [her]84-mademoiselle reisz parasol , and held it over [her]84-mademoiselle reisz while [he]78-victor walked to [the car]1111-the car with [her]84-mademoiselle reisz . [He]78-victor entreated [her]84-mademoiselle reisz to bear in mind that the disclosures of the afternoon were strictly confidential . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz laughed and bantered [him]78-victor a little , remembering too late that [she]84-mademoiselle reisz should have been dignified and reserved .

" How handsome [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier looked ! "[50-madame lebrun] said [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun to [[her]50-madame lebrun son]748-her son .

" Ravishing ! "[78-victor] [he]78-victor admitted . " [The city]261-the city atmosphere has improved [her]84-mademoiselle reisz . Some way [she]84-mademoiselle reisz does n't seem like [the same woman]1908-the same woman . "[78-victor]

XXI

[Some people]1113-some people contended that the reason [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz always chose [apartments]1114-apartments up under the roof was to discourage the approach of [beggars]1115-beggars , [peddlars]1116-peddlars and [callers]1117-callers . There were plenty of windows in [[her]84-mademoiselle reisz little front room]1118-her little front room . They were for the most part dingy , but as they were nearly always open it did not make so much difference . [They]1119-they often admitted into [the room]522-the room a good deal of smoke and soot ; but at the same time all the light and air that there was came through [them]1119-they . From [her]84-mademoiselle reisz windows could be seen the crescent of [the river]1121-the river , the masts of [ships]1122-ships and the big chimneys of [the [Mississippi]9-mississippi steamers]1123-the mississippi steamers . A magnificent piano crowded [the apartment]1124-the apartment . In [the next room]237-the next room [she]84-mademoiselle reisz slept , and in the third and last [she]84-mademoiselle reisz harbored a gasoline stove on which [she]84-mademoiselle reisz cooked [her]84-mademoiselle reisz meals when disinclined to descend to [the neighboring restaurant]1126-the neighboring restaurant . It was there also that [she]84-mademoiselle reisz ate , keeping [her]84-mademoiselle reisz belongings in [a rare old buffet]1127-a rare old buffet , dingy and battered from a hundred years of use .

When [Edna]115-edna knocked at [[Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's front room]1128-mademoiselle reisz 's front room door and entered , [she]115-edna discovered [that person standing beside the window]1129-that person standing beside the window , engaged in mending or patching [an old prunella gaiter]1130-an old prunella gaiter . [The little musician]1131-the little musician laughed all over when [she]1131-the little musician saw [Edna]115-edna . [Her]115-edna laugh consisted of a contortion of the face and all the muscles of the body . [She]115-edna seemed strikingly homely , standing there in the afternoon light . [She]115-edna still wore the shabby lace and the artificial bunch of violets on the side of [her]115-edna head .

" So [you]115-edna remembered [me]84-mademoiselle reisz at last , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] said [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz . " [I]84-mademoiselle reisz had said to [myself]84-mademoiselle reisz , Ah , bah ! [she]115-edna will never come . ' "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Did [you]115-edna want [me]115-edna to come ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna with a smile .

" [I]84-mademoiselle reisz had not thought much about it , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] answered [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz . [The two]181-the two had seated [themselves]181-the two on a little bumpy sofa which stood against the wall . " [I]181-the two am glad , however , that [you]115-edna came . [I]181-the two have the water boiling back there , and was just about to make some coffee . [You]115-edna will drink a cup with [me]181-the two . And how is _ la belle dame ? _ Always handsome ! always healthy ! always contented ! "[181-the two] [She]84-mademoiselle reisz took [Edna]115-edna 's hand between [her]84-mademoiselle reisz strong wiry fingers , holding it loosely without warmth , and executing a sort of double theme upon the back and palm .

" Yes , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] [she]84-mademoiselle reisz went on ; " [I]84-mademoiselle reisz sometimes thought : [She]115-edna will never come . [She]115-edna promised as [those women in society]1909-those women in society always do , without meaning it . [She]115-edna will not come . ' For [I]84-mademoiselle reisz really do n't believe [you]115-edna like [me]84-mademoiselle reisz , [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" [I]115-edna do n't know whether [I]115-edna like [you]115-edna or not , "[115-edna] replied [Edna]115-edna , gazing down at [the little woman]1133-the little woman with a quizzical look .

The candor of [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier 's admission greatly pleased [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz expressed [her]84-mademoiselle reisz gratification by repairing forthwith to the region of the gasoline stove and rewarding [[her]84-mademoiselle reisz guest]1134-her guest with the promised cup of coffee . The coffee and the biscuit accompanying it proved very acceptable to [Edna]115-edna , who had declined refreshment at [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun 's and was now beginning to feel hungry . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz set the tray which [she]84-mademoiselle reisz brought in upon a small table near at hand , and seated [herself]84-mademoiselle reisz once again on the lumpy sofa .

" [I]84-mademoiselle reisz have had a letter from [[your]115-edna friend]1842-your friend , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] [she]84-mademoiselle reisz remarked , as [she]84-mademoiselle reisz poured a little cream into [Edna]115-edna 's cup and handed it to [her]115-edna .

" [[My]84-mademoiselle reisz friend]1911-my friend ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Yes , [[your]115-edna friend]1842-your friend [Robert]53-robert . [He]1842-your friend wrote to [me]84-mademoiselle reisz from [the City of [Mexico]4-mexico]1102-the city of mexico . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Wrote to _ [you]115-edna _ ? "[115-edna] repeated [Edna]115-edna in amazement , stirring [her]115-edna coffee absently .

" Yes , to [me]84-mademoiselle reisz . Why not ? Do n't stir all the warmth out of [your]115-edna coffee ; drink it . Though the letter might as well have been sent to [you]115-edna ; it was nothing but [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier from beginning to end . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Let [me]614-the young woman see it , "[614-the young woman] requested [the young woman]614-the young woman , entreatingly .

" No ; a letter concerns [no one]312-no one but [the person who writes it]1915-the person who writes it and [the one to whom it is written]1916-the one to whom it is written . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Have n't [you]115-edna just said it concerned [me]84-mademoiselle reisz from beginning to end ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" It was written about [you]115-edna , not to [you]115-edna . Have [you]115-edna seen [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier ? How is [she]52-mrs. pontellier looking ? ' [he]614-the young woman asks . As [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier says , ' or as [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier once said . ' If [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier should call upon [you]115-edna , play for [her]52-mrs. pontellier that Impromptu of Chopin 's , [my]84-mademoiselle reisz favorite . [I]84-mademoiselle reisz heard it here a day or two ago , but not as [you]115-edna play it . [I]84-mademoiselle reisz should like to know how it affects [her]52-mrs. pontellier , ' and so on , as if [he]614-the young woman supposed [we]1917-we were constantly in each other 's society . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Let [me]84-mademoiselle reisz see the letter . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Oh , no . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Have [you]115-edna answered it ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" No . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Let [me]84-mademoiselle reisz see the letter . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" No , and again , no . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Then play the Impromptu for [me]84-mademoiselle reisz . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" It is growing late ; what time do [you]115-edna have to be [home]245-home ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" But [you]115-edna have told [me]84-mademoiselle reisz nothing of [yourself]115-edna . What are [you]115-edna doing ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Painting ! "[115-edna] laughed [Edna]115-edna . " [I]115-edna am becoming [an artist]1765-an artist . Think of it ! "[115-edna]

" Ah ! [an artist]1765-an artist ! [You]115-edna have pretensions , [Madame]50-madame lebrun . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Why pretensions ? Do [you]115-edna think [I]115-edna could not become [an artist]1765-an artist ? "[115-edna]

" [I]84-mademoiselle reisz do not know [you]115-edna well enough to say . [I]84-mademoiselle reisz do not know [your]115-edna talent or [your]115-edna temperament . To be [an artist]1765-an artist includes much ; [one]303-one must possess many gifts absolute gifts which have not been acquired by [one]303-one 's own effort . And , moreover , to succeed , [the artist]1925-the artist must possess the courageous soul . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" What do [you]115-edna mean by the courageous soul ? "[115-edna]

" Courageous , _ ma foi ! _ [The brave soul]1926-the brave soul . The soul that dares and defies . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Show [me]115-edna the letter and play for [me]115-edna the Impromptu . [You]115-edna see that [I]115-edna have persistence . Does that quality count for anything in art ? "[115-edna]

" It counts with [a foolish old woman whom [you]115-edna have captivated]1927-a foolish old woman whom you have captivated , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] replied [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz , with [her]84-mademoiselle reisz wriggling laugh .

The letter was right there at hand in the drawer of the little table upon which [Edna]115-edna had just placed [her]115-edna coffee cup . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz opened the drawer and drew forth the letter , the topmost one . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz placed it in [Edna]115-edna 's hands , and without further comment arose and went to the piano .

[Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz played a soft interlude . It was an improvisation . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz sat low at the instrument , and the lines of [her]84-mademoiselle reisz body settled into ungraceful curves and angles that gave it an appearance of deformity . Gradually and imperceptibly the interlude melted into the soft opening minor chords of the Chopin Impromptu .

[Edna]115-edna did not know when the Impromptu began or ended . [She]115-edna sat in the sofa corner reading [Robert]53-robert 's letter by the fading light . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz had glided from the Chopin into the quivering love notes of [Isolde]119-isolde 's song , and back again to the Impromptu with its soulful and poignant longing .

The shadows deepened in [the little room]1136-the little room . The music grew strange and fantastic turbulent , insistent , plaintive and soft with entreaty . The shadows grew deeper . The music filled [the room]522-the room . It floated out upon the night , over [the housetops]1138-the housetops , [the crescent of the river]1139-the crescent of the river , losing itself in the silence of the upper air .

[Edna]115-edna was sobbing , just as [she]115-edna had wept one midnight at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle when strange , new voices awoke in [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna arose in some agitation to take [her]115-edna departure . " May [I]115-edna come again , [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked at the threshold .

" Come whenever [you]84-mademoiselle reisz feel like it . Be careful ; the stairs and landings are dark ; do n't stumble . "[115-edna]

[Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz reentered and lit a candle . [Robert]53-robert 's letter was on the floor . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz stooped and picked it up . It was crumpled and damp with tears . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz smoothed the letter out , restored it to the envelope , and replaced it in the table drawer .

XXII

One morning on [his]53-robert way into [town]1873-town [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier stopped at [the house of [[his]53-robert old friend]1142-his old friend and [family physician]1143-family physician]1141-the house of his old friend and family physician , [Doctor Mandelet]120-doctor mandelet . [The Doctor]352-the doctor was [a semi - retired physician]1145-a semi - retired physician , resting , as the saying is , upon [his]352-the doctor laurels . [He]352-the doctor bore a reputation for wisdom rather than skill leaving the active practice of medicine to [[his]352-the doctor assistants]1146-his assistants and [younger contemporaries]1147-younger contemporaries and was much sought for in matters of consultation . [A few families]1148-a few families , united to [him]352-the doctor by bonds of friendship , [he]352-the doctor still attended when [they]1148-a few families required the services of [a physician]1149-a physician . [The Pontelliers]75-the pontelliers were among these .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier found [the Doctor]352-the doctor reading at the open window of [[his]53-robert study]1151-his study . [[His]53-robert house]915-his house stood rather far back from [the street]244-the street , in the center of [a delightful garden]1154-a delightful garden , so that [it]1155-it was quiet and peaceful at [the old gentleman]817-the old gentleman 's study window . [He]53-robert was [a great reader]1157-a great reader . [He]53-robert stared up disapprovingly over [his]53-robert eye - glasses as [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier entered , wondering who had the temerity to disturb [him]53-robert at that hour of the morning .

" Ah , [Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier ! Not sick , [I]53-robert hope . Come and have a seat . What news do [you]53-robert bring this morning ? "[53-robert] [He]53-robert was quite portly , with a profusion of gray hair , and small blue eyes which age had robbed of much of their brightness but none of [their]1158-their penetration .

" Oh ! [I]53-robert 'm never sick , [Doctor]1928-doctor . [You]1928-doctor know that [I]53-robert come of tough fiber of [that old Creole race of Pontelliers that dry up and finally blow away]1929-that old creole race of pontelliers that dry up and finally blow away . [I]53-robert came to consult no , not precisely to consult to talk to [you]1928-doctor about [Edna]115-edna . [I]53-robert do n't know what ails [her]115-edna . "[53-robert]

" [Madame Pontellier]121-madame pontellier not well , "[352-the doctor] marveled [the Doctor]352-the doctor . " Why , [I]352-the doctor saw [her]115-edna [I]352-the doctor think it was a week ago walking along [Canal Street]31-canal street , the picture of health , it seemed to [me]352-the doctor . "[352-the doctor]

" Yes , yes ; [she]115-edna seems quite well , "[49-mr. pontellier] said [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , leaning forward and whirling [his]49-mr. pontellier stick between [his]49-mr. pontellier two hands ; " but [she]115-edna does n't act well . [She]115-edna 's odd , [she]115-edna 's not like [herself]115-edna . [I]49-mr. pontellier ca n't make [her]115-edna out , and [I]49-mr. pontellier thought perhaps [you]352-the doctor 'd help [me]49-mr. pontellier . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" How does [she]115-edna act ? "[352-the doctor] inquired [the Doctor]352-the doctor .

" Well , it is n't easy to explain , "[49-mr. pontellier] said [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , throwing [himself]49-mr. pontellier back in [his]49-mr. pontellier chair . " [She]115-edna lets [the housekeeping]1930-the housekeeping go to the dickens . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Well , well ; [women]635-women are not all alike , [[my]49-mr. pontellier dear]1730-my dear [Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier . [We]1933-we 've got to consider "[49-mr. pontellier]

" [I]1161-i know that ; [I]1161-i told [you]352-the doctor [I]1161-i could n't explain . [Her]115-edna whole attitude toward [me]1161-i and [everybody]351-everybody and everything has changed . [You]352-the doctor know [I]1161-i have a quick temper , but [I]1161-i do n't want to quarrel or be rude to [a woman]1753-a woman , especially [[my]1161-i wife]1936-my wife ; yet [I]1161-i 'm driven to it , and feel like ten thousand devils after [I]1161-i 've made a fool of [myself]1161-i . [She]115-edna 's making it devilishly uncomfortable for [me]1161-i , "[1161-i] [he]1161-i went on nervously . " [She]115-edna 's got some sort of notion in [her]115-edna head concerning the eternal rights of [women]635-women ; and [you]352-the doctor understand [we]1938-we meet in the morning at the breakfast table . "[1161-i]

[The old gentleman]817-the old gentleman lifted [his]817-the old gentleman shaggy eyebrows , protruded [his]817-the old gentleman thick nether lip , and tapped the arms of [his]817-the old gentleman chair with [his]817-the old gentleman cushioned fingertips .

" What have [you]1161-i been doing to [her]115-edna , [Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier ? "[817-the old gentleman]

" Doing ! _ Parbleu ! _ "[817-the old gentleman]

" Has [she]115-edna , "[352-the doctor] asked [the Doctor]352-the doctor , with a smile , " has [she]115-edna been associating of late with [a circle of [pseudo - intellectual women super - spiritual superior beings]1940-pseudo - intellectual women super - spiritual superior beings]1939-a circle of pseudo - intellectual women super - spiritual superior beings ? [[My]352-the doctor wife]1936-my wife has been telling [me]352-the doctor about [them]1939-a circle of pseudo - intellectual women super - spiritual superior beings . "[352-the doctor]

" That 's the trouble , "[49-mr. pontellier] broke in [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , " [she]115-edna has n't been associating with [any one]1731-any one .
