[She]115-edna has abandoned [her]115-edna Tuesdays at [home]245-home , has thrown over all [[her]115-edna acquaintances]1944-her acquaintances , and goes tramping about by [herself]115-edna , moping in [the street - cars]1945-the street - cars , getting in after dark . [I]49-mr. pontellier tell [you]1946-you [she]115-edna 's peculiar . [I]49-mr. pontellier do n't like it ; [I]49-mr. pontellier feel a little worried over it . "[49-mr. pontellier]

This was a new aspect for [the Doctor]352-the doctor . " Nothing hereditary ? "[352-the doctor] [he]352-the doctor asked , seriously . " Nothing peculiar about [her]115-edna family antecedents , is there ? "[352-the doctor]

" Oh , no , indeed ! [She]115-edna comes of sound old Presbyterian Kentucky stock . [The old gentleman]817-the old gentleman , [[her]115-edna father]211-her father , [I]49-mr. pontellier have heard , used to atone for [his]817-the old gentleman weekday sins with [his]817-the old gentleman Sunday devotions . [I]49-mr. pontellier know for a fact , that [his]817-the old gentleman race horses literally ran away with [the prettiest bit of [Kentucky]8-kentucky farming land [I]49-mr. pontellier ever laid eyes upon]1949-the prettiest bit of kentucky farming land i ever laid eyes upon . [Margaret]71-margaret [you]71-margaret know [Margaret]71-margaret [she]71-margaret has all the Presbyterianism undiluted . And [the youngest]1950-the youngest is something of [a vixen]1951-a vixen . By the way , [she]71-margaret gets married in a couple of weeks from now . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Send [[your]352-the doctor wife]1952-your wife up to the wedding , "[352-the doctor] exclaimed [the Doctor]352-the doctor , foreseeing a happy solution . " Let [her]1952-your wife stay among [[her]1952-your wife own people]1953-her own people for a while ; it will do [her]1952-your wife good . "[352-the doctor]

" That 's what [I]49-mr. pontellier want [her]1952-your wife to do . [She]1952-your wife wo n't go to the marriage . [She]1952-your wife says a wedding is one of the most lamentable spectacles on earth . Nice thing for [a woman]1753-a woman to say to [[her]1753-a woman husband]186-her husband ! "[49-mr. pontellier] exclaimed [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , fuming anew at the recollection .

" [Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , "[352-the doctor] said [the Doctor]352-the doctor , after a moment 's reflection , " let [[your]49-mr. pontellier wife]1952-your wife alone for a while . Do n't bother [her]1952-your wife , and do n't let [her]1952-your wife bother [you]49-mr. pontellier . [Woman]1871-woman , [[my]352-the doctor dear friend]1958-my dear friend , is a very peculiar and delicate organism [a sensitive and highly organized woman]1959-a sensitive and highly organized woman , such as [I]352-the doctor know [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier to be , is especially peculiar . It would require [an inspired psychologist]1960-an inspired psychologist to deal successfully with [them]1959-a sensitive and highly organized woman . And when [ordinary fellows like [you]49-mr. pontellier and [me]352-the doctor]1961-ordinary fellows like you and me attempt to cope with [their]1961-ordinary fellows like you and me idiosyncrasies the result is bungling . [Most women]266-most women are moody and whimsical . This is some passing whim of [[your]49-mr. pontellier wife]1952-your wife , due to some cause or causes which [you]49-mr. pontellier and [I]352-the doctor need n't try to fathom . But it will pass happily over , especially if [you]49-mr. pontellier let [her]1952-your wife alone . Send [her]1952-your wife around to see [me]352-the doctor . "[352-the doctor]

" Oh ! [I]49-mr. pontellier could n't do that ; there 'd be no reason for it , "[49-mr. pontellier] objected [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier .

" Then [I]352-the doctor 'll go around and see [her]1952-your wife , "[352-the doctor] said [the Doctor]352-the doctor . " [I]352-the doctor 'll drop in to dinner some evening _ en bon ami _ . "[352-the doctor]

" Do ! by all means , "[49-mr. pontellier] urged [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier . " What evening will [you]49-mr. pontellier come ? Say Thursday . Will [you]49-mr. pontellier come Thursday ? "[49-mr. pontellier] [he]49-mr. pontellier asked , rising to take [his]49-mr. pontellier leave .

" Very well ; Thursday . [[My]352-the doctor wife]1936-my wife may possibly have some engagement for [me]352-the doctor Thursday . In case [she]1952-your wife has , [I]352-the doctor shall let [you]49-mr. pontellier know . Otherwise , [you]49-mr. pontellier may expect [me]352-the doctor . "[352-the doctor]

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier turned before leaving to say :

" [I]49-mr. pontellier am going to [New York]32-new york on business very soon . [I]49-mr. pontellier have a big scheme on hand , and want to be on [the field]1965-the field proper to pull the ropes and handle the ribbons . [We]1966-we 'll let [you]49-mr. pontellier in on the inside if [you]49-mr. pontellier say so , [Doctor]120-doctor mandelet , "[49-mr. pontellier] [he]49-mr. pontellier laughed .

" No , [I]352-the doctor thank [you]49-mr. pontellier , [[my]352-the doctor dear sir]1967-my dear sir , "[352-the doctor] returned [the Doctor]352-the doctor . " [I]352-the doctor leave such ventures to [[you]49-mr. pontellier younger men with the fever of life still in [your]49-mr. pontellier blood]1968-you younger men with the fever of life still in your blood . "[352-the doctor]

" What [I]49-mr. pontellier wanted to say , "[49-mr. pontellier] continued [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , with [his]49-mr. pontellier hand on the knob ; " [I]49-mr. pontellier may have to be absent a good while . Would [you]352-the doctor advise [me]49-mr. pontellier to take [Edna]115-edna along ? "[49-mr. pontellier]

" By all means , if [she]115-edna wishes to go . If not , leave [her]115-edna here . Do n't contradict [her]115-edna . The mood will pass , [I]352-the doctor assure [you]352-the doctor . It may take a month , two , three months possibly longer , but it will pass ; have patience . "[352-the doctor]

" Well , good - by , _ jeudi _ , "[49-mr. pontellier] said [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier , as [he]49-mr. pontellier let [himself]49-mr. pontellier out .

[The Doctor]352-the doctor would have liked during the course of conversation to ask , " Is there [any man in the case]1969-any man in the case ? "[352-the doctor] but [he]352-the doctor knew [his]352-the doctor Creole too well to make such a blunder as that .

[He]352-the doctor did not resume [his]352-the doctor book immediately , but sat for a while meditatively looking out into [the garden]1062-the garden .

XXIII

[[Edna]115-edna 's father]1171-edna 's father was in [the city]261-the city , and had been with [them]1173-they several days . [She]115-edna was not very warmly or deeply attached to [him]1171-edna 's father , but [they]1173-they had certain tastes in common , and when together [they]1173-they were companionable . [His]1171-edna 's father coming was in the nature of a welcome disturbance ; it seemed to furnish a new direction for [her]115-edna emotions .

[He]1171-edna 's father had come to purchase a wedding gift for [[his]1171-edna 's father daughter]1174-his daughter , [Janet]59-janet , and an outfit for [himself]1171-edna 's father in which [he]1171-edna 's father might make a creditable appearance at [her]115-edna marriage . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had selected the bridal gift , as [every one immediately connected with [him]1171-edna 's father]1175-every one immediately connected with him always deferred to [his]1171-edna 's father taste in such matters . And [his]1171-edna 's father suggestions on the question of dress which too often assumes the nature of a problem were of inestimable value to [[his]1171-edna 's father father - in - law]1176-his father - in - law . But for the past few days [the old gentleman]817-the old gentleman had been upon [Edna]115-edna 's hands , and in [his]1171-edna 's father society [she]115-edna was becoming acquainted with a new set of sensations . [He]1171-edna 's father had been [a colonel in [the Confederate army]1179-the confederate army]1178-a colonel in the confederate army , and still maintained , with the title , the military bearing which had always accompanied it . [His]1171-edna 's father hair and mustache were white and silky , emphasizing the rugged bronze of [his]1171-edna 's father face . [He]1171-edna 's father was tall and thin , and wore [his]1171-edna 's father coats padded , which gave a fictitious breadth and depth to [his]1171-edna 's father shoulders and chest . [Edna]115-edna and [[her]115-edna father]211-her father looked very distinguished together , and excited a good deal of notice during [their]1181-their perambulations . Upon [his]1171-edna 's father arrival [she]115-edna began by introducing [him]1171-edna 's father to [[her]115-edna atelier]1025-her atelier and making a sketch of [him]1171-edna 's father . [He]1171-edna 's father took the whole matter very seriously . If [her]115-edna talent had been ten - fold greater than it was , it would not have surprised [him]1171-edna 's father , convinced as [he]1171-edna 's father was that [he]1171-edna 's father had bequeathed to [all of [[his]1171-edna 's father daughters]1184-his daughters]1183-all of his daughters the germs of a masterful capability , which only depended upon [their]1183-all of his daughters own efforts to be directed toward successful achievement .

Before [her]115-edna pencil [he]1171-edna 's father sat rigid and unflinching , as [he]1171-edna 's father had faced [the cannon]1185-the cannon 's mouth in days gone by . [He]1171-edna 's father resented the intrusion of [the children]239-the children , who gaped with wondering eyes at [him]1171-edna 's father , sitting so stiff up there in [[[their]239-the children mother]436-their mother 's bright atelier]1188-their mother 's bright atelier . When [they]239-the children drew near [he]1171-edna 's father motioned [them]239-the children away with an expressive action of the foot , loath to disturb the fixed lines of [his]1171-edna 's father countenance , [his]1171-edna 's father arms , or [his]1171-edna 's father rigid shoulders .

[Edna]115-edna , anxious to entertain [him]1171-edna 's father , invited [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz to meet [him]1171-edna 's father , having promised [him]1171-edna 's father a treat in [her]84-mademoiselle reisz piano playing ; but [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz declined the invitation . So together [they]1189-they attended a _ soir e musicale _ at [the Ratignolles ']1190-the ratignolles ' . [Monsieur]1191-monsieur and [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle made much of [the Colonel]1192-the colonel , installing [him]1192-the colonel as [the guest of honor]1193-the guest of honor and engaging [him]1192-the colonel at once to dine with [them]1189-they the following Sunday , or any day which [he]1192-the colonel might select . [Madame]62-madame ratignolle coquetted with [him]1192-the colonel in the most captivating and naive manner , with eyes , gestures , and a profusion of compliments , till [the Colonel]1192-the colonel 's old head felt thirty years younger on [his]1192-the colonel padded shoulders . [Edna]115-edna marveled , not comprehending . [She]115-edna [herself]115-edna was almost devoid of coquetry .

There were [one or two men whom [she]115-edna observed at [the _ soir e musicale]1196-the _ soir e musicale]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale ; _ but [she]115-edna would never have felt moved to any kittenish display to attract [their]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale notice to any feline or feminine wiles to express [herself]115-edna toward [them]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale . [Their]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale personality attracted [her]115-edna in an agreeable way . [Her]115-edna fancy selected [them]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale , and [she]115-edna was glad when a lull in the music gave [them]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale an opportunity to meet [her]115-edna and talk with [her]115-edna . Often on [the street]244-the street the glance of strange eyes had lingered in [her]115-edna memory , and sometimes had disturbed [her]115-edna .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier did not attend these _ soir es musicales _ . [He]49-mr. pontellier considered [them]1195-one or two men whom she observed at the _ soir e musicale _ bourgeois _ , and found more diversion at [the club]1888-the club . To [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle [he]49-mr. pontellier said the music dispensed at [her]62-madame ratignolle _ soir es _ was too " heavy , "[49-mr. pontellier] too far beyond [his]49-mr. pontellier untrained comprehension . [His]49-mr. pontellier excuse flattered [her]115-edna . But [she]115-edna disapproved of [[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's club]1199-mr. pontellier 's club , and [she]115-edna was frank enough to tell [Edna]115-edna so .

" It 's a pity [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier does n't stay [home]245-home more in the evenings . [I]49-mr. pontellier think [you]115-edna would be more well , if [you]115-edna do n't mind [my]49-mr. pontellier saying it more united , if [he]211-her father did . "[49-mr. pontellier]

" Oh ! dear no ! "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , with a blank look in [her]115-edna eyes . " What should [I]115-edna do if [he]211-her father stayed [home]245-home ? [We]1972-we would n't have anything to say to [each other]183-each other . "[115-edna]

[She]115-edna had not much of anything to say to [[her]115-edna father]211-her father , for that matter ; but [he]211-her father did not antagonize [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna discovered that [he]211-her father interested [her]115-edna , though [she]115-edna realized that [he]211-her father might not interest [her]115-edna long ; and for the first time in [her]115-edna life [she]115-edna felt as if [she]115-edna were thoroughly acquainted with [him]211-her father . [He]211-her father kept [her]115-edna busy serving [him]211-her father and ministering to [his]211-her father wants . It amused [her]115-edna to do so . [She]115-edna would not permit [a servant]1201-a servant or one of [the children]239-the children to do anything for [him]211-her father which [she]115-edna might do [herself]115-edna . [[Her]115-edna husband]186-her husband noticed , and thought it was the expression of a deep filial attachment which [he]186-her husband had never suspected .

[The Colonel]1192-the colonel drank numerous " toddies "[1192-the colonel] during the course of the day , which left [him]1192-the colonel , however , imperturbed . [He]1192-the colonel was [an expert at concocting strong drinks]1205-an expert at concocting strong drinks . [He]1192-the colonel had even invented some , to which [he]1192-the colonel had given fantastic names , and for whose manufacture [he]1192-the colonel required diverse ingredients that it devolved upon [Edna]115-edna to procure for [him]1192-the colonel .

When [Doctor Mandelet]120-doctor mandelet dined with [the Pontelliers]75-the pontelliers on Thursday [he]120-doctor mandelet could discern in [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier no trace of that morbid condition which [[her]52-mrs. pontellier husband]186-her husband had reported to [him]120-doctor mandelet . [She]52-mrs. pontellier was excited and in a manner radiant . [She]52-mrs. pontellier and [[her]52-mrs. pontellier father]211-her father had been to [the race course]1208-the race course , and [their]1209-their thoughts when [they]1209-their seated [themselves]1209-their at table were still occupied with the events of the afternoon , and [their]1209-their talk was still of [the track]1210-the track . [The Doctor]352-the doctor had not kept pace with turf affairs . [He]352-the doctor had certain recollections of racing in what [he]352-the doctor called " the good old times "[352-the doctor] when [the Lecompte stables]1212-the lecompte stables flourished , and [he]352-the doctor drew upon this fund of memories so that [he]352-the doctor might not be left out and seem wholly devoid of the modern spirit . But [he]352-the doctor failed to impose upon [the Colonel]1192-the colonel , and was even far from impressing [him]1192-the colonel with this trumped - up knowledge of bygone days . [Edna]115-edna had staked [[her]115-edna father]211-her father on [his]211-her father last venture , with the most gratifying results to [both of [them]1215-both of them]1215-both of them . Besides , [they]1215-both of them had met [some very charming people]1216-some very charming people , according to [the Colonel]1192-the colonel 's impressions . [Mrs. Mortimer Merriman]122-mrs. merriman and [Mrs. James Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp , who were there with [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin , had joined [them]1215-both of them and had enlivened the hours in a fashion that warmed [him]352-the doctor to think of .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier [himself]49-mr. pontellier had no particular leaning toward horseracing , and was even rather inclined to discourage it as a pastime , especially when [he]49-mr. pontellier considered the fate of [that blue - grass farm in [Kentucky]8-kentucky]1218-that blue - grass farm in kentucky . [He]49-mr. pontellier endeavored , in a general way , to express a particular disapproval , and only succeeded in arousing the ire and opposition of [[his]49-mr. pontellier father - in - law]1176-his father - in - law . A pretty dispute followed , in which [Edna]115-edna warmly espoused [[her]115-edna father]211-her father 's cause and [the Doctor]352-the doctor remained neutral .

[He]49-mr. pontellier observed [[his]49-mr. pontellier hostess]1222-his hostess attentively from under [his]49-mr. pontellier shaggy brows , and noted a subtle change which had transformed [her]1222-his hostess from [the listless woman [he]49-mr. pontellier had known]1223-the listless woman he had known into a being who , for the moment , seemed palpitant with the forces of life . [Her]1222-his hostess speech was warm and energetic . There was no repression in [her]1222-his hostess glance or gesture . [She]1222-his hostess reminded [him]49-mr. pontellier of some beautiful , sleek animal waking up in the sun .

The dinner was excellent . The claret was warm and the champagne was cold , and under [their]1224-their beneficent influence the threatened unpleasantness melted and vanished with the fumes of the wine .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier warmed up and grew reminiscent . [He]49-mr. pontellier told some amusing plantation experiences , recollections of [old Iberville]10-iberville and [his]49-mr. pontellier youth , when [he]49-mr. pontellier hunted ' possum in company with [some friendly darky]1225-some friendly darky ; thrashed the pecan trees , shot the grosbec , and roamed [the woods and fields]1226-the woods and fields in mischievous idleness .

[The Colonel]124-the colonel , with little sense of humor and of the fitness of things , related a somber episode of those dark and bitter days , in which [he]49-mr. pontellier had acted a conspicuous part and always formed a central figure . Nor was [the Doctor]352-the doctor happier in [his]352-the doctor selection , when [he]352-the doctor told the old , ever new and curious story of the waning of [a woman]1753-a woman 's love , seeking strange , new channels , only to return to its legitimate source after days of fierce unrest . It was one of the many little human documents which had been unfolded to [him]352-the doctor during [his]352-the doctor long career as [a physician]1149-a physician . The story did not seem especially to impress [Edna]115-edna . [She]115-edna had one of [her]115-edna own to tell , of [a woman who paddled away with [[her]1230-a woman who paddled away with her lover one night in a pirogue and never came back lover]1231-her lover one night in a pirogue and never came back]1230-a woman who paddled away with her lover one night in a pirogue and never came back . [They]1232-them were lost amid [the Baratarian Islands]33-the baratarian islands , and [no one]312-no one ever heard of [them]1232-them or found trace of [them]1232-them from that day to this . It was a pure invention . [She]115-edna said that [Madame Antoine]95-madame antoine had related it to [her]115-edna . That , also , was an invention . Perhaps it was a dream [she]115-edna had had . But every glowing word seemed real to [those who listened]1234-those who listened . [They]1234-those who listened could feel the hot breath of the Southern night ; [they]1234-those who listened could hear the long sweep of the pirogue through the glistening moonlit water , the beating of birds ' wings , rising startled from among the reeds in [the salt - water pools]729-the salt - water pools ; [they]1234-those who listened could see the faces of [the lovers , pale , close together , rapt in oblivious forgetfulness]1236-the lovers , pale , close together , rapt in oblivious forgetfulness , drifting into the unknown .

The champagne was cold , and its subtle fumes played fantastic tricks with [Edna]115-edna 's memory that night .

Outside , away from the glow of the fire and the soft lamplight , the night was chill and murky . [The Doctor]352-the doctor doubled [his]352-the doctor old - fashioned cloak across [his]352-the doctor breast as [he]352-the doctor strode [home]245-home through the darkness . [He]352-the doctor knew [[his]352-the doctor fellow - creatures]1239-his fellow - creatures better than [most men]1240-most men ; knew that inner life which so seldom unfolds itself to unanointed eyes . [He]352-the doctor was sorry [he]352-the doctor had accepted [Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's invitation . [He]352-the doctor was growing old , and beginning to need rest and an imperturbed spirit . [He]352-the doctor did not want the secrets of other lives thrust upon [him]352-the doctor .

" [I]352-the doctor hope it is n't [Arobin]77-arobin , "[352-the doctor] [he]352-the doctor muttered to [himself]352-the doctor as [he]352-the doctor walked . " [I]352-the doctor hope to heaven it is n't Alc e [Arobin]77-arobin . "[352-the doctor]

XXIV

[Edna]115-edna and [[her]115-edna father]211-her father had a warm , and almost violent dispute upon the subject of [her]115-edna refusal to attend [[her]115-edna sister]463-her sister 's wedding . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier declined to interfere , to interpose either [his]49-mr. pontellier influence or [his]49-mr. pontellier authority . [He]49-mr. pontellier was following [Doctor Mandelet]120-doctor mandelet 's advice , and letting [her]115-edna do as [she]115-edna liked . [The Colonel]124-the colonel reproached [[his]124-the colonel daughter]1174-his daughter for [her]115-edna lack of filial kindness and respect , [her]115-edna want of sisterly affection and womanly consideration . [His]124-the colonel arguments were labored and unconvincing . [He]124-the colonel doubted if [Janet]59-janet would accept any excuse forgetting that [Edna]115-edna had offered none . [He]124-the colonel doubted if [Janet]59-janet would ever speak to [her]59-janet again , and [he]124-the colonel was sure [Margaret]71-margaret would not .

[Edna]115-edna was glad to be rid of [[her]115-edna father]211-her father when [he]211-her father finally took [himself]211-her father off with [his]211-her father wedding garments and [his]211-her father bridal gifts , with [his]211-her father padded shoulders , [his]211-her father Bible reading , [his]211-her father " toddies "[211-her father] and ponderous oaths .

[Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier followed [him]211-her father closely . [He]49-mr. pontellier meant to stop at the wedding on [his]49-mr. pontellier way to [New York]32-new york and endeavor by every means which money and love could devise to atone somewhat for [Edna]115-edna 's incomprehensible action .

" [You]115-edna are too lenient , too lenient by far , [L]57-l once , "[1192-the colonel] asserted [the Colonel]1192-the colonel . " Authority , coercion are what is needed . Put [your]115-edna foot down good and hard ; the only way to manage [a wife]1019-a wife . Take [my]1192-the colonel word for it . "[1192-the colonel]

[The Colonel]1192-the colonel was perhaps unaware that [he]1192-the colonel had coerced [[his]1192-the colonel own wife]1247-his own wife into [her]1247-his own wife grave . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had a vague suspicion of it which [he]49-mr. pontellier thought it needless to mention at that late day .

[Edna]115-edna was not so consciously gratified at [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband 's leaving [home]245-home as [she]115-edna had been over the departure of [[her]115-edna father]211-her father . As the day approached when [he]186-her husband was to leave [her]115-edna for a comparatively long stay , [she]115-edna grew melting and affectionate , remembering [his]186-her husband many acts of consideration and [his]186-her husband repeated expressions of an ardent attachment . [She]115-edna was solicitous about [his]186-her husband health and [his]186-her husband welfare . [She]115-edna bustled around , looking after [his]186-her husband clothing , thinking about heavy underwear , quite as [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle would have done under similar circumstances . [She]115-edna cried when [he]186-her husband went away , calling [him]186-her husband [[her]115-edna dear , [good friend]1252-good friend]1251-her dear , good friend , and [she]115-edna was quite certain [she]115-edna would grow lonely before very long and go to join [him]186-her husband in [New York]32-new york .

But after all , a radiant peace settled upon [her]115-edna when [she]115-edna at last found [herself]115-edna alone . Even [the children]239-the children were gone . [Old Madame Pontellier]121-madame pontellier had come [herself]121-madame pontellier and carried [them]239-the children off to [Iberville]10-iberville with [their]239-the children quadroon . [The old madame]1254-the old madame did not venture to say [she]1254-the old madame was afraid [they]239-the children would be neglected during [L]57-l once 's absence ; [she]1254-the old madame hardly ventured to think so . [She]1254-the old madame was hungry for them even a little fierce in [her]1254-the old madame attachment . [She]1254-the old madame did not want [them]239-the children to be wholly " [children of the pavement]1975-children of the pavement , "[1254-the old madame] [she]1254-the old madame always said when begging to have [them]239-the children for a space . [She]1254-the old madame wished [them]239-the children to know [the country]1255-the country , with [its]1255-the country [streams]1256-streams , [its]1255-the country fields , [its]1255-the country [woods]1257-woods , [its]1255-the country freedom , so delicious to [the young]1258-the young . [She]1254-the old madame wished [them]239-the children to taste something of the life [[their]239-the children father]194-their father had lived and known and loved when [he]194-their father , too , was [a little child]1260-a little child .

When [Edna]115-edna was at last alone , [she]115-edna breathed a big , genuine sigh of relief . A feeling that was unfamiliar but very delicious came over [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna walked all through [the house]157-the house , from [one room]1262-one room to another , as if inspecting [it]157-the house for the first time . [She]115-edna tried the various chairs and lounges , as if [she]115-edna had never sat and reclined upon them before . And [she]115-edna perambulated around the outside of [the house]157-the house , investigating , looking to see if windows and shutters were secure and in order . The flowers were like [new acquaintances]1264-new acquaintances ; [she]115-edna approached [them]239-the children in a familiar spirit , and made [herself]115-edna at [home]245-home among them . [The garden walks]1266-the garden walks were damp , and [Edna]115-edna called to [the maid]951-the maid to bring out [her]115-edna rubber sandals . And there [she]115-edna stayed , and stooped , digging around the plants , trimming , picking dead , dry leaves . [The children]239-the children 's little dog came out , interfering , getting in [her]115-edna way . [She]115-edna scolded [him]1269-him , laughed at [him]1269-him , played with [him]1269-him . [The garden]1062-the garden smelled so good and looked so pretty in the afternoon sunlight . [Edna]115-edna plucked all the bright flowers [she]115-edna could find , and went into [the house]157-the house with [them]239-the children , [she]115-edna and the little dog .

Even [the kitchen]504-the kitchen assumed a sudden interesting character which [she]115-edna had never before perceived . [She]115-edna went in to give directions to [the cook]691-the cook , to say that [the butcher]1274-the butcher would have to bring much less meat , that [they]1274-the butcher would require only half [their]1274-the butcher usual quantity of bread , of milk and groceries . [She]115-edna told [the cook]691-the cook that [she]115-edna [herself]115-edna would be greatly occupied during [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's absence , and [she]115-edna begged [her]691-the cook to take all thought and responsibility of the larder upon [her]115-edna own shoulders .

That night [Edna]115-edna dined alone . The candelabra , with a few candles in the center of the table , gave all the light [she]115-edna needed . Outside the circle of light in which [she]115-edna sat , [the large dining - room]1276-the large dining - room looked solemn and shadowy . [The cook]691-the cook , placed upon [her]691-the cook mettle , served a delicious repast a luscious tenderloin broiled _ point _ . The wine tasted good ; the _ marron glac _ seemed to be just what [she]115-edna wanted . It was so pleasant , too , to dine in a comfortable _ peignoir _ .

[She]115-edna thought a little sentimentally about [L]57-l once and [the children]239-the children , and wondered what [they]1279-they were doing . As [she]115-edna gave a dainty scrap or two to [the doggie]1280-the doggie , [she]115-edna talked intimately to [him]1280-the doggie about [Etienne]99-etienne and [Raoul]58-raoul . [He]1280-the doggie was beside [himself]1280-the doggie with astonishment and delight over these companionable advances , and showed [his]1280-the doggie appreciation by [his]1280-the doggie little quick , snappy barks and a lively agitation .

Then [Edna]115-edna sat in [the library]959-the library after dinner and read [Emerson]125-emerson until [she]115-edna grew sleepy . [She]115-edna realized that [she]115-edna had neglected [her]115-edna reading , and determined to start anew upon a course of improving studies , now that [her]115-edna time was completely [her]115-edna own to do with as [she]115-edna liked .

After a refreshing bath , [Edna]115-edna went to bed . And as [she]115-edna snuggled comfortably beneath the eiderdown a sense of restfulness invaded [her]115-edna , such as [she]115-edna had not known before .

XXV

When the weather was dark and cloudy [Edna]115-edna could not work . [She]115-edna needed the sun to mellow and temper [her]115-edna mood to the sticking point . [She]115-edna had reached a stage when [she]115-edna seemed to be no longer feeling [her]115-edna way , working , when in the humor , with sureness and ease . And being devoid of ambition , and striving not toward accomplishment , [she]115-edna drew satisfaction from the work in itself .

On rainy or melancholy days [Edna]115-edna went out and sought [the society of [the friends [she]115-edna had made at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle]1283-the friends she had made at grand isle]1282-the society of the friends she had made at grand isle . Or else [she]115-edna stayed [indoors]1284-indoors and nursed a mood with which [she]115-edna was becoming too familiar for [her]115-edna own comfort and peace of mind . It was not despair ; but it seemed to [her]115-edna as if life were passing by , leaving its promise broken and unfulfilled . Yet there were other days when [she]115-edna listened , was led on and deceived by fresh promises which [her]115-edna youth held out to [her]115-edna .

[She]115-edna went again to the races , and again . [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin and [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp called for [her]115-edna one bright afternoon in [[Arobin]77-arobin 's drag]1285-arobin 's drag . [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp was [a worldly but unaffected , intelligent , slim , tall blonde woman in the forties , with an indifferent manner and blue eyes that stared]1286-a worldly but unaffected , intelligent , slim , tall blonde woman in the forties , with an indifferent manner and blue eyes that stared . [She]107-mrs. highcamp had [a daughter]1287-a daughter who served [her]107-mrs. highcamp as a pretext for cultivating the society of [young men of fashion]1288-young men of fashion . [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin was one of [them]1288-young men of fashion . [He]77-arobin was a familiar figure at the race course , the opera , [the fashionable clubs]1289-the fashionable clubs . There was a perpetual smile in [his]77-arobin eyes , which seldom failed to awaken a corresponding cheerfulness in [any one who looked into them]1290-any one who looked into them and listened to [his]77-arobin good - humored voice . [His]77-arobin manner was quiet , and at times a little insolent . [He]77-arobin possessed a good figure , a pleasing face , not overburdened with depth of thought or feeling ; and [his]77-arobin dress was that of [the conventional man of fashion]1291-the conventional man of fashion .

[He]77-arobin admired [Edna]115-edna extravagantly , after meeting [her]115-edna at the races with [[her]115-edna father]211-her father . [He]77-arobin had met [her]115-edna before on other occasions , but [she]115-edna had seemed to [him]77-arobin unapproachable until that day . It was at [his]77-arobin instigation that [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp called to ask [her]115-edna to go with [them]1293-them to [the Jockey Club]1294-the jockey club to witness the turf event of the season .

There were possibly [a few track men out there who knew [the race horse]1296-the race horse as well as [Edna]115-edna]1295-a few track men out there who knew the race horse as well as edna , but there was certainly [none who knew it better]1297-none who knew it better . [She]115-edna sat between [[her]115-edna two companions]1298-her two companions as one having authority to speak . [She]115-edna laughed at [Arobin]77-arobin 's pretensions , and deplored [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp 's ignorance . [The race horse]1296-the race horse was [a friend and intimate associate of [her]115-edna childhood]1300-a friend and intimate associate of her childhood . The atmosphere of [the stables]1301-the stables and the breath of the blue grass paddock revived in [her]115-edna memory and lingered in [her]115-edna nostrils . [She]115-edna did not perceive that [she]115-edna was talking like [[her]115-edna father]211-her father as the sleek geldings ambled in review before [them]1298-her two companions . [She]115-edna played for very high stakes , and fortune favored [her]115-edna . The fever of the game flamed in [her]115-edna cheeks and eyes , and it got into [her]115-edna blood and into [her]115-edna brain like an intoxicant . [People]904-people turned [their]904-people heads to look at [her]115-edna , and more than one lent an attentive ear to [her]115-edna utterances , hoping thereby to secure the elusive but ever - desired " tip . "[107-mrs. highcamp] [Arobin]77-arobin caught the contagion of excitement which drew [him]77-arobin to [Edna]115-edna like a magnet . [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp remained , as usual , unmoved , with [her]107-mrs. highcamp indifferent stare and uplifted eyebrows .

[Edna]115-edna stayed and dined with [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp upon being urged to do so . [Arobin]77-arobin also remained and sent away [his]77-arobin drag .

The dinner was quiet and uninteresting , save for the cheerful efforts of [Arobin]77-arobin to enliven things . [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp deplored the absence of [[her]107-mrs. highcamp daughter]567-her daughter from the races , and tried to convey to [her]567-her daughter what [she]567-her daughter had missed by going to the " Dante reading "[1307-a plain , bald - headed man] instead of joining [them]1305-they . [The girl]698-the girl held a geranium leaf up to [her]698-the girl nose and said nothing , but looked knowing and noncommittal . [Mr. Highcamp]126-mr. highcamp was [a plain , bald - headed man]1307-a plain , bald - headed man , who only talked under compulsion . [He]126-mr. highcamp was unresponsive . [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp was full of delicate courtesy and consideration toward [[her]107-mrs. highcamp husband]186-her husband . [She]107-mrs. highcamp addressed most of [her]107-mrs. highcamp conversation to [him]126-mr. highcamp at table . [They]1305-they sat in [the library]959-the library after dinner and read the evening papers together under the droplight ; while [the younger people]1310-the younger people went into [the drawing - room near by]1311-the drawing - room near by and talked . [Miss Highcamp]127-miss highcamp played some selections from Grieg upon the piano . [She]107-mrs. highcamp seemed to have apprehended all of [the composer]1312-the composer 's coldness and none of [his]1312-the composer poetry . While [Edna]115-edna listened [she]115-edna could not help wondering if [she]115-edna had lost [her]115-edna taste for music .

When the time came for [her]115-edna to go [home]245-home , [Mr. Highcamp]126-mr. highcamp grunted a lame offer to escort [her]115-edna , looking down at [his]126-mr. highcamp slippered feet with tactless concern . It was [Arobin]77-arobin who took [her]115-edna [home]245-home . The car ride was long , and it was late when [they]1305-they reached [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street . [Arobin]77-arobin asked permission to enter for a second to light [his]77-arobin cigarette [his]77-arobin match safe was empty . [He]77-arobin filled [his]77-arobin match safe , but did not light [his]77-arobin cigarette until [he]77-arobin left [her]115-edna , after [she]115-edna had expressed [her]115-edna willingness to go to the races with [him]77-arobin again .

[Edna]115-edna was neither tired nor sleepy . [She]115-edna was hungry again , for the Highcamp dinner , though of excellent quality , had lacked abundance . [She]115-edna rummaged in the larder and brought forth a slice of Gruyere and some crackers . [She]115-edna opened a bottle of beer which [she]115-edna found in the icebox . [Edna]115-edna felt extremely restless and excited . [She]115-edna vacantly hummed a fantastic tune as [she]115-edna poked at the wood embers on the hearth and munched a cracker .

[She]115-edna wanted something to happen something , anything ; [she]115-edna did not know what . [She]115-edna regretted that [she]115-edna had not made [Arobin]77-arobin stay a half hour to talk over the horses with [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna counted the money [she]115-edna had won . But there was nothing else to do , so [she]115-edna went to bed , and tossed there for hours in a sort of monotonous agitation .

In the middle of the night [she]115-edna remembered that [she]115-edna had forgotten to write [her]115-edna regular letter to [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband ; and [she]115-edna decided to do so next day and tell [him]186-her husband about [her]115-edna afternoon at [the Jockey Club]1294-the jockey club . [She]115-edna lay wide awake composing a letter which was nothing like the one which [she]115-edna wrote next day . When [the maid]951-the maid awoke [her]115-edna in the morning [Edna]115-edna was dreaming of [Mr. Highcamp]126-mr. highcamp playing the piano at the entrance of [a music store on [Canal Street]31-canal street]1318-a music store on canal street , while [[his]126-mr. highcamp wife]179-his wife was saying to [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin , as [they]1320-they boarded [an Esplanade Street car]1321-an esplanade street car :

" What a pity that so much talent has been neglected ! but [I]179-his wife must go . "[179-his wife]

When , a few days later , [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin again called for [Edna]115-edna in [[his]77-arobin drag]1322-his drag , [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp was not with [him]77-arobin . [He]77-arobin said [they]1320-they would pick [her]115-edna up . But as [that lady]309-that lady had not been apprised of [his]77-arobin intention of picking [her]115-edna up , [she]115-edna was not at [home]245-home . [The daughter]1325-the daughter was just leaving [the house]157-the house to attend the meeting of [a branch Folk Lore Society]1327-a branch folk lore society , and regretted that [she]1325-the daughter could not accompany [them]1320-they . [Arobin]77-arobin appeared nonplused , and asked [Edna]115-edna if there were any one else [she]115-edna cared to ask .

[She]115-edna did not deem it worth while to go in search of [any of [the fashionable acquaintances from whom [she]115-edna had withdrawn [herself]115-edna]1329-the fashionable acquaintances from whom she had withdrawn herself]1328-any of the fashionable acquaintances from whom she had withdrawn herself . [She]115-edna thought of [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle , but knew that [[her]115-edna fair friend]1330-her fair friend did not leave [the house]157-the house , except to take a languid walk around [the block]1332-the block with [[her]62-madame ratignolle husband]186-her husband after nightfall . [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz would have laughed at such a request from [Edna]115-edna . [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun might have enjoyed the outing , but for some reason [Edna]115-edna did not want [her]50-madame lebrun . So [they]1334-they went alone , [she]115-edna and [Arobin]77-arobin .

The afternoon was intensely interesting to [her]115-edna . The excitement came back upon [her]115-edna like a remittent fever . [Her]115-edna talk grew familiar and confidential . It was no labor to become intimate with [Arobin]77-arobin . [His]77-arobin manner invited easy confidence . The preliminary stage of becoming acquainted was one which [he]77-arobin always endeavored to ignore when [a pretty and engaging woman]1335-a pretty and engaging woman was concerned .

[He]77-arobin stayed and dined with [Edna]115-edna . [He]77-arobin stayed and sat beside the wood fire . [They]1334-they laughed and talked ; and before it was time to go [he]77-arobin was telling [her]115-edna how different life might have been if [he]77-arobin had known [her]115-edna years before . With ingenuous frankness [he]77-arobin spoke of what [a wicked , ill - disciplined boy]1336-a wicked , ill - disciplined boy [he]77-arobin had been , and impulsively drew up [his]77-arobin cuff to exhibit upon [his]77-arobin wrist the scar from a saber cut which [he]77-arobin had received in a duel outside of [Paris]34-paris when [he]77-arobin was nineteen . [She]115-edna touched [his]77-arobin hand as [she]115-edna scanned the red cicatrice on the inside of [his]77-arobin white wrist . A quick impulse that was somewhat spasmodic impelled [her]115-edna fingers to close in a sort of clutch upon [his]77-arobin hand . [He]77-arobin felt the pressure of [her]115-edna pointed nails in the flesh of [his]77-arobin palm .

[She]115-edna arose hastily and walked toward [the mantel]1337-the mantel .

" The sight of a wound or scar always agitates and sickens [me]115-edna , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said . " [I]115-edna should n't have looked at it . "[115-edna]

" [I]77-arobin beg [your]115-edna pardon , "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin entreated , following [her]115-edna ; " it never occurred to [me]77-arobin that it might be repulsive . "[77-arobin]

[He]77-arobin stood close to [her]115-edna , and the effrontery in [his]77-arobin eyes repelled the old , vanishing self in [her]115-edna , yet drew all [her]115-edna awakening sensuousness . [He]77-arobin saw enough in [her]115-edna face to impel [him]77-arobin to take [her]115-edna hand and hold it while [he]77-arobin said [his]77-arobin lingering good night .

" Will [you]115-edna go to the races again ? "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin asked .

" No , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said . " [I]115-edna 've had enough of the races . [I]115-edna do n't want to lose all the money [I]115-edna 've won , and [I]115-edna 've got to work when the weather is bright , instead of "[115-edna]

" Yes ; work ; to be sure . [You]77-arobin promised to show [me]77-arobin [your]77-arobin work . What morning may [I]77-arobin come up to [[your]77-arobin atelier]1976-your atelier ? To - morrow ? "[77-arobin]

" No ! "[115-edna]

" Day after ? "[77-arobin]

" No , no . "[115-edna]

" Oh , please do n't refuse [me]77-arobin ! [I]77-arobin know something of such things . [I]77-arobin might help [you]77-arobin with a stray suggestion or two . "[77-arobin]

" No . Good night . Why do n't [you]1338-i go after [you]1338-i have said good night ? [I]115-edna do n't like [you]1338-i , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna went on in a high , excited pitch , attempting to draw away [her]115-edna hand . [She]115-edna felt that [her]115-edna words lacked dignity and sincerity , and [she]115-edna knew that [he]1338-i felt it .

" [I]1338-i 'm sorry [you]77-arobin do n't like [me]1338-i . [I]1338-i 'm sorry [I]1338-i offended [you]77-arobin . How have [I]1338-i offended [you]77-arobin ? What have [I]1338-i done ? Ca n't [you]77-arobin forgive [me]1338-i ? "[1338-i] And [he]1338-i bent and pressed [his]1338-i lips upon [her]115-edna hand as if [he]1338-i wished never more to withdraw them .

" [Mr. Arobin]128-arobin , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna complained , " [I]115-edna 'm greatly upset by the excitement of the afternoon ; [I]115-edna 'm not [myself]115-edna . [My]115-edna manner must have misled [you]1338-i in some way . [I]115-edna wish [you]1338-i to go , please . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna spoke in a monotonous , dull tone . [He]1338-i took [his]1338-i hat from the table , and stood with eyes turned from [her]115-edna , looking into the dying fire . For a moment or two [he]1338-i kept an impressive silence .

" [Your]115-edna manner has not misled [me]1338-i , [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier , "[1338-i] [he]1338-i said finally . " [My]1338-i own emotions have done that . [I]1338-i could n't help it . When [I]1338-i 'm near [you]115-edna , how could [I]1338-i help it ? Do n't think anything of it , do n't bother , please . [You]115-edna see , [I]1338-i go when [you]115-edna command [me]1338-i . If [you]115-edna wish [me]1338-i to stay away , [I]1338-i shall do so . If [you]115-edna let [me]1338-i come back , [I]1338-i oh ! [you]115-edna will let [me]1338-i come back ? "[1338-i]

[He]1338-i cast one appealing glance at [her]1339-her , to which [she]1339-her made no response . [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin 's manner was so genuine that it often deceived even [himself]1338-i .

[Edna]115-edna did not care or think whether it were genuine or not . When [she]115-edna was alone [she]115-edna looked mechanically at the back of [her]115-edna hand which [he]1338-i had kissed so warmly . Then [she]115-edna leaned [her]115-edna head down on the mantelpiece . [She]115-edna felt somewhat like [a woman who in a moment of passion]1340-a woman who in a moment of passion is betrayed into an act of infidelity , and realizes the significance of the act without being wholly awakened from its glamour . The thought was passing vaguely through [her]115-edna mind , " What would [he]1338-i think ? "[115-edna]

[She]115-edna did not mean [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband ; [she]115-edna was thinking of [Robert Lebrun]53-robert . [[Her]115-edna husband]186-her husband seemed to [her]115-edna now like [a person whom [she]115-edna had married without love as an excuse .

[She]115-edna lit a candle and went up to [[her]115-edna room]224-her room]1343-a person whom she had married without love as an excuse . she lit a candle and went up to her room . [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin was absolutely nothing to [her]115-edna . Yet [his]77-arobin presence , [his]77-arobin manners , the warmth of [his]77-arobin glances , and above all the touch of [his]77-arobin lips upon [her]115-edna hand had acted like a narcotic upon [her]115-edna .

[She]115-edna slept a languorous sleep , interwoven with vanishing dreams .

XXVI

[Alc e Arobin]77-arobin wrote [Edna]115-edna an elaborate note of apology , palpitant with sincerity . It embarrassed [her]115-edna ; for in a cooler , quieter moment it appeared to [her]115-edna absurd that [she]115-edna should have taken [his]77-arobin action so seriously , so dramatically . [She]115-edna felt sure that the significance of the whole occurrence had lain in [her]115-edna own self - consciousness . If [she]115-edna ignored [his]77-arobin note it would give undue importance to a trivial affair . If [she]115-edna replied to it in a serious spirit it would still leave in [his]77-arobin mind the impression that [she]115-edna had in a susceptible moment yielded to [his]77-arobin influence . After all , it was no great matter to have [one]303-one 's hand kissed . [She]115-edna was provoked at [his]77-arobin having written the apology . [She]115-edna answered in as light and bantering a spirit as [she]115-edna fancied it deserved , and said [she]115-edna would be glad to have [him]77-arobin look in upon [her]115-edna at work whenever [he]77-arobin felt the inclination and [his]77-arobin business gave [him]77-arobin the opportunity .

[He]77-arobin responded at once by presenting [himself]77-arobin at [[her]115-edna home]1346-her home with all [his]77-arobin disarming na vet . And then there was scarcely a day which followed that [she]115-edna did not see [him]77-arobin or was not reminded of [him]77-arobin . [He]77-arobin was prolific in pretexts . [His]77-arobin attitude became one of good - humored subservience and tacit adoration . [He]77-arobin was ready at all times to submit to [her]115-edna moods , which were as often kind as they were cold . [She]115-edna grew accustomed to [him]77-arobin . [They]1347-they became intimate and friendly by imperceptible degrees , and then by leaps . [He]77-arobin sometimes talked in a way that astonished [her]115-edna at first and brought the crimson into [her]115-edna face ; in a way that pleased [her]115-edna at last , appealing to the animalism that stirred impatiently within [her]115-edna .

There was nothing which so quieted the turmoil of [Edna]115-edna 's senses as a visit to [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz . It was then , in the presence of that personality which was offensive to [her]115-edna , that [the woman]373-the woman , by [her]373-the woman divine art , seemed to reach [Edna]115-edna 's spirit and set it free .

It was misty , with heavy , lowering atmosphere , one afternoon , when [Edna]115-edna climbed the stairs to [[the pianist]600-the pianist 's apartments]1350-the pianist 's apartments under the roof . [Her]115-edna clothes were dripping with moisture . [She]115-edna felt chilled and pinched as [she]115-edna entered [the room]522-the room . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz was poking at a rusty stove that smoked a little and warmed [the room]522-the room indifferently . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz was endeavoring to heat a pot of chocolate on the stove . [The room]522-the room looked cheerless and dingy to [Edna]115-edna as [she]115-edna entered . [A bust of Beethoven , covered with a hood of dust]1354-a bust of beethoven , covered with a hood of dust , scowled at [her]115-edna from the mantelpiece .

" Ah ! here comes the sunlight ! "[84-mademoiselle reisz] exclaimed [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz , rising from [her]84-mademoiselle reisz knees before the stove . " Now it will be warm and bright enough ; [I]84-mademoiselle reisz can let the fire alone . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

[She]115-edna closed the stove door with a bang , and approaching , assisted in removing [Edna]115-edna 's dripping mackintosh .

" [You]115-edna are cold ; [you]115-edna look miserable . The chocolate will soon be hot . But would [you]115-edna rather have a taste of brandy ? [I]115-edna have scarcely touched the bottle which [you]115-edna brought [me]115-edna for [my]115-edna cold . "[115-edna] A piece of red flannel was wrapped around [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz 's throat ; a stiff neck compelled [her]84-mademoiselle reisz to hold [her]84-mademoiselle reisz head on one side .

" [I]115-edna will take some brandy , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , shivering as [she]115-edna removed [her]115-edna gloves and overshoes . [She]115-edna drank the liquor from the glass as [a man]521-a man would have done . Then flinging [herself]115-edna upon the uncomfortable sofa [she]115-edna said , " [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz , [I]115-edna am going to move away from [[my]115-edna house on [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street]1977-my house on esplanade street . "[115-edna]

" Ah ! "[1056-the musician] ejaculated [the musician]1056-the musician , neither surprised nor especially interested . Nothing ever seemed to astonish [her]115-edna very much . [She]115-edna was endeavoring to adjust the bunch of violets which had become loose from its fastening in [her]115-edna hair . [Edna]115-edna drew [her]115-edna down upon the sofa , and taking a pin from [her]115-edna own hair , secured the shabby artificial flowers in [their]1357-their accustomed place .

" Are n't [you]1056-the musician astonished ? "[115-edna]

" Passably . Where are [you]1056-the musician going ? to [New York]32-new york ? to [Iberville]10-iberville ? to [[your]1056-the musician father]1760-your father in [Mississippi]9-mississippi ? where ? "[115-edna]

" Just two steps away , "[115-edna] laughed [Edna]115-edna , " in [a little four - room house around the corner]1979-a little four - room house around the corner . [It]1979-a little four - room house around the corner looks so cozy , so inviting and restful , whenever [I]115-edna pass by ; and [it]1979-a little four - room house around the corner 's for rent . [I]115-edna 'm tired looking after [that big house]1980-that big house . [It]1979-a little four - room house around the corner never seemed like [mine]115-edna , anyway like [home]245-home . It 's too much trouble . [I]115-edna have to keep [too many servants]1982-too many servants . [I]115-edna am tired bothering with [them]1982-too many servants . "[115-edna]

" That is not [your]1056-the musician true reason , _ [ma belle]1983-ma belle _ . There is no use in telling [me]115-edna lies . [I]115-edna do n't know [your]1056-the musician reason , but [you]1056-the musician have not told [me]115-edna the truth . "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna did not protest or endeavor to justify [herself]115-edna .

" [The house]157-the house , the money that provides for [it]157-the house , are not [mine]115-edna . Is n't that enough reason ? "[115-edna]

" [They]1982-too many servants are [[your]84-mademoiselle reisz husband]1985-your husband 's , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] returned [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz , with a shrug and a malicious elevation of the eyebrows .

" Oh ! [I]115-edna see there is no deceiving [you]1056-the musician . Then let [me]115-edna tell [you]1056-the musician : It is a caprice . [I]115-edna have a little money of [my]115-edna own from [[[my]115-edna mother]1986-my mother 's estate]1987-my mother 's estate , which [[my]115-edna father]1738-my father sends [me]115-edna by [driblets]1989-driblets . [I]115-edna won a large sum this winter on [the races]1990-the races , and [I]115-edna am beginning to sell [my]115-edna sketches . [Laidpore]113-laidpore is more and more pleased with [my]115-edna work ; [he]1738-my father says it grows in force and individuality . [I]115-edna can not judge of that [myself]115-edna , but [I]115-edna feel that [I]115-edna have gained in ease and confidence . However , as [I]115-edna said , [I]115-edna have sold a good many through [Laidpore]113-laidpore . [I]115-edna can live in [the tiny house]1991-the tiny house for little or nothing , with [one servant]1992-one servant . [Old Celestine]129-celestine , who works occasionally for [me]115-edna , says [she]129-celestine will come stay with [me]115-edna and do [my]115-edna work . [I]115-edna know [I]115-edna shall like it , like the feeling of freedom and independence . "[115-edna]

" What does [[your]84-mademoiselle reisz husband]1985-your husband say ? "[186-her husband]

" [I]115-edna have not told [him]1985-your husband yet . [I]115-edna only thought of it this morning . [He]1985-your husband will think [I]115-edna am demented , no doubt . Perhaps [you]84-mademoiselle reisz think so . "[115-edna]

[Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz shook [her]84-mademoiselle reisz head slowly . " [Your]115-edna reason is not yet clear to [me]84-mademoiselle reisz , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] [she]84-mademoiselle reisz said .

Neither was it quite clear to [Edna]115-edna [herself]115-edna ; but it unfolded itself as [she]115-edna sat for a while in silence . Instinct had prompted [her]115-edna to put away [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband 's bounty in casting off [her]115-edna allegiance . [She]115-edna did not know how it would be when [he]186-her husband returned . There would have to be an understanding , an explanation . Conditions would some way adjust themselves , [she]115-edna felt ; but whatever came , [she]115-edna had resolved never again to belong to another than [herself]115-edna .

" [I]115-edna shall give a grand dinner before [I]115-edna leave [the old house]1994-the old house ! "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna exclaimed . " [You]84-mademoiselle reisz will have to come to it , [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz . [I]115-edna will give [you]84-mademoiselle reisz everything that [you]84-mademoiselle reisz like to eat and to drink . [We]1995-we shall sing and laugh and be merry for once . "[115-edna] And [she]115-edna uttered a sigh that came from the very depths of [her]115-edna being .

If [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz happened to have received a letter from [Robert]53-robert during the interval of [Edna]115-edna 's visits , [she]115-edna would give [her]115-edna the letter unsolicited . And [she]115-edna would seat [herself]115-edna at the piano and play as [her]115-edna humor prompted [her]115-edna while [the young woman]614-the young woman read the letter .

The little stove was roaring ; it was red - hot , and the chocolate in the tin sizzled and sputtered . [Edna]115-edna went forward and opened the stove door , and [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz rising , took a letter from under the bust of [Beethoven]130-beethoven and handed it to [Edna]115-edna .

" Another ! so soon ! "[115-edna] [she]115-edna exclaimed , [her]115-edna eyes filled with delight . " Tell [me]115-edna , [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz , does [he]53-robert know that [I]115-edna see [his]53-robert letters ? "[115-edna]

" Never in [the world]281-the world ! [He]53-robert would be angry and would never write to [me]115-edna again if [he]53-robert thought so . Does [he]53-robert write to [you]84-mademoiselle reisz ? Never a line . Does [he]53-robert send [you]84-mademoiselle reisz a message ? Never a word . It is because [he]53-robert loves [you]84-mademoiselle reisz , [poor fool]1997-poor fool , and is trying to forget [you]84-mademoiselle reisz , since [you]84-mademoiselle reisz are not free to listen to [him]53-robert or to belong to [him]53-robert . "[115-edna]

" Why do [you]115-edna show [me]115-edna [his]53-robert letters , then ? "[115-edna]

" Have n't [you]115-edna begged for them ? Can [I]115-edna refuse [you]115-edna anything ? Oh ! [you]115-edna can not deceive [me]115-edna , "[115-edna] and [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz approached [her]84-mademoiselle reisz beloved instrument and began to play . [Edna]115-edna did not at once read the letter . [She]115-edna sat holding it in [her]115-edna hand , while the music penetrated [her]115-edna whole being like an effulgence , warming and brightening the dark places of [her]115-edna soul . It prepared [her]115-edna for joy and exultation .

" Oh ! "[115-edna] [she]115-edna exclaimed , letting the letter fall to the floor . " Why did [you]115-edna not tell [me]115-edna ? "[115-edna] [She]115-edna went and grasped [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz 's hands up from the keys . " Oh ! unkind ! malicious ! Why did [you]115-edna not tell [me]115-edna ? "[115-edna]

" That [he]1998-he was coming back ? No great news , _ ma foi _ . [I]115-edna wonder [he]1998-he did not come long ago . "[115-edna]

" But when , when ? "[115-edna] cried [Edna]115-edna , impatiently . " [He]1998-he does not say when . "[115-edna]

" [He]1998-he says very soon . ' [You]115-edna know as much about it as [I]115-edna do ; it is all in the letter . "[115-edna]

" But why ? Why is [he]1998-he coming ? Oh , if [I]115-edna thought "[115-edna] and [she]115-edna snatched the letter from the floor and turned the pages this way and that way , looking for the reason , which was left untold .

" If [I]84-mademoiselle reisz were young and in love with [a man]521-a man , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] said [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz , turning on the stool and pressing [her]84-mademoiselle reisz wiry hands between [her]84-mademoiselle reisz knees as [she]84-mademoiselle reisz looked down at [Edna]115-edna , who sat on the floor holding the letter , " it seems to [me]84-mademoiselle reisz [he]1998-he would have to be [some _ grand esprit]2000-some _ grand esprit ; _ [a man with lofty aims and ability to reach them]2001-a man with lofty aims and ability to reach them ; [one who stood high enough to attract the notice of [[his]1998-he fellow - men]2003-his fellow - men]2002-one who stood high enough to attract the notice of his fellow - men . It seems to [me]84-mademoiselle reisz if [I]84-mademoiselle reisz were young and in love [I]84-mademoiselle reisz should never deem [a man of ordinary caliber]2004-a man of ordinary caliber worthy of [my]84-mademoiselle reisz devotion . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Now it is [you]84-mademoiselle reisz who are telling lies and seeking to deceive [me]115-edna , [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz ; or else [you]84-mademoiselle reisz have never been in love , and know nothing about it . Why , "[115-edna] went on [Edna]115-edna , clasping [her]115-edna knees and looking up into [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz 's twisted face , " do [you]84-mademoiselle reisz suppose [a woman]1753-a woman knows why [she]1753-a woman loves ? Does [she]1753-a woman select ? Does [she]1753-a woman say to [herself]1753-a woman : Go to ! Here is [a distinguished statesman with presidential possibilities]2006-a distinguished statesman with presidential possibilities ; [I]115-edna shall proceed to fall in love with [him]2006-a distinguished statesman with presidential possibilities . ' Or , [I]115-edna shall set [my]115-edna heart upon [this musician , whose fame is on every tongue]2007-this musician , whose fame is on every tongue ? ' Or , [This financier]2008-this financier , who controls [the world]281-the world 's money markets ? ' "[115-edna]

" [You]115-edna are purposely misunderstanding [me]115-edna , _ ma reine _ . Are [you]115-edna in love with [Robert]53-robert ? "[115-edna]

" Yes , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna . It was the first time [she]115-edna had admitted it , and a glow overspread [her]115-edna face , blotching it with red spots .

" Why ? "[412-her companion] asked [[her]115-edna companion]412-her companion . " Why do [you]115-edna love [him]53-robert when [you]115-edna ought not to ? "[412-her companion]

[Edna]115-edna , with a motion or two , dragged [herself]115-edna on [her]115-edna knees before [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz , who took the glowing face between [her]115-edna two hands .

" Why ? Because [his]53-robert hair is brown and grows away from [his]53-robert temples ; because [he]53-robert opens and shuts [his]53-robert eyes , and [his]53-robert nose is a little out of drawing ; because [he]53-robert has two lips and a square chin , and a little finger which [he]53-robert ca n't straighten from having played baseball too energetically in [his]53-robert youth . Because "[412-her companion]

" Because [you]84-mademoiselle reisz do , in short , "[84-mademoiselle reisz] laughed [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz . " What will [you]84-mademoiselle reisz do when [he]53-robert comes back ? "[84-mademoiselle reisz] [she]84-mademoiselle reisz asked .

" Do ? Nothing , except feel glad and happy to be alive . "[412-her companion]

[She]84-mademoiselle reisz was already glad and happy to be alive at the mere thought of [his]1361-his return . The murky , lowering sky , which had depressed [her]84-mademoiselle reisz a few hours before , seemed bracing and invigorating as [she]84-mademoiselle reisz splashed through [the streets]1362-the streets on [her]84-mademoiselle reisz way [home]245-home .

[She]84-mademoiselle reisz stopped at [a confectioner 's]1364-a confectioner 's and ordered a huge box of bonbons for [the children in [Iberville]10-iberville]1365-the children in iberville . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz slipped a card in the box , on which [she]84-mademoiselle reisz scribbled a tender message and sent an abundance of kisses .

Before dinner in the evening [Edna]115-edna wrote a charming letter to [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , telling [him]186-her husband of [her]115-edna intention to move for a while into [the little house around [the block]1332-the block]1367-the little house around the block , and to give a farewell dinner before leaving , regretting that [he]186-her husband was not there to share it , to help out with the menu and assist [her]115-edna in entertaining [the guests]1369-the guests . [Her]115-edna letter was brilliant and brimming with cheerfulness .

XXVII

" What is the matter with [you]77-arobin ? "[77-arobin] asked [Arobin]77-arobin that evening . " [I]115-edna never found [you]77-arobin in such a happy mood . "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna was tired by that time , and was reclining on [the lounge before the fire]1370-the lounge before the fire .

" Do n't [you]77-arobin know [the weather prophet]2010-the weather prophet has told [us]2011-us [we]2011-us shall see the sun pretty soon ? "[77-arobin]

" Well , that ought to be reason enough , "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin acquiesced . " [You]115-edna would n't give [me]77-arobin another if [I]77-arobin sat [here]1819-here all night imploring [you]115-edna . "[77-arobin] [He]77-arobin sat close to [her]115-edna on a low tabouret , and as [he]77-arobin spoke [his]77-arobin fingers lightly touched the hair that fell a little over [her]115-edna forehead . [She]115-edna liked the touch of [his]77-arobin fingers through [her]115-edna hair , and closed [her]115-edna eyes sensitively .

" One of these days , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said , " [I]115-edna 'm going to pull [myself]115-edna together for a while and think try to determine what character of a woman [I]115-edna am ; for , candidly , [I]115-edna do n't know . By all the codes which [I]115-edna am acquainted with , [I]115-edna am [a devilishly wicked specimen of the sex]2013-a devilishly wicked specimen of the sex . But some way [I]115-edna ca n't convince [myself]115-edna that [I]115-edna am . [I]115-edna must think about it . "[115-edna]

" Do n't . What 's the use ? Why should [you]115-edna bother thinking about it when [I]77-arobin can tell [you]115-edna what manner of woman [you]115-edna are . "[77-arobin] [His]77-arobin fingers strayed occasionally down to [her]115-edna warm , smooth cheeks and firm chin , which was growing a little full and double .

" Oh , yes ! [You]115-edna will tell [me]77-arobin that [I]77-arobin am adorable ; everything that is captivating . Spare [yourself]115-edna the effort . "[77-arobin]

" No ; [I]115-edna sha n't tell [you]115-edna anything of the sort , though [I]115-edna should n't be lying if [I]115-edna did . "[115-edna]

" Do [you]115-edna know [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked irrelevantly .

" [The pianist]600-the pianist ? [I]115-edna know [her]600-the pianist by sight . [I]115-edna 've heard [her]600-the pianist play . "[115-edna]

" [She]600-the pianist says queer things sometimes in a bantering way that [you]115-edna do n't notice at the time and [you]115-edna find [yourself]115-edna thinking about afterward . "[115-edna]

" For instance ? "[115-edna]

" Well , for instance , when [I]115-edna left [her]600-the pianist to - day , [she]600-the pianist put [her]600-the pianist arms around [me]115-edna and felt [my]115-edna shoulder blades , to see if [my]115-edna wings were strong , [she]600-the pianist said . The bird that would soar above the level plain of tradition and prejudice must have strong wings . It is a sad spectacle to see [the weaklings bruised , exhausted , fluttering back to earth]2015-the weaklings bruised , exhausted , fluttering back to earth . ' "[115-edna]

" Whither would [you]115-edna soar ? "[115-edna]

" [I]115-edna 'm not thinking of any extraordinary flights . [I]115-edna only half comprehend [her]600-the pianist . "[115-edna]

" [I]77-arobin 've heard [she]600-the pianist 's partially demented , "[77-arobin] said [Arobin]77-arobin .

" [She]600-the pianist seems to [me]115-edna wonderfully sane , "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna replied .

" [I]115-edna 'm told [she]600-the pianist 's extremely disagreeable and unpleasant . Why have [you]77-arobin introduced [her]600-the pianist at a moment when [I]115-edna desired to talk of [you]77-arobin ? "[115-edna]

" Oh ! talk of [me]115-edna if [you]77-arobin like , "[115-edna] cried [Edna]115-edna , clasping [her]115-edna hands beneath [her]115-edna head ; " but let [me]115-edna think of something else while [you]77-arobin do . "[115-edna]

" [I]115-edna 'm jealous of [your]77-arobin thoughts to - night . They 're making [you]77-arobin a little kinder than usual ; but some way [I]115-edna feel as if [they]2016-they were wandering , as if [they]2016-they were not here with [me]115-edna . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna only looked at [him]1371-his and smiled . [His]1371-his eyes were very near . [He]1371-his leaned upon [the lounge]1098-the lounge with an arm extended across [her]115-edna , while the other hand still rested upon [her]115-edna hair . [They]1373-they continued silently to look into [each other]183-each other 's eyes . When [he]1371-his leaned forward and kissed [her]115-edna , [she]115-edna clasped [his]1371-his head , holding [his]1371-his lips to [hers]115-edna .

It was the first kiss of [her]115-edna life to which [her]115-edna nature had really responded . It was a flaming torch that kindled desire .

XXVIII

[Edna]115-edna cried a little that night after [Arobin]77-arobin left [her]115-edna . It was only one phase of the multitudinous emotions which had assailed [her]115-edna . There was with [her]115-edna an overwhelming feeling of irresponsibility . There was the shock of the unexpected and the unaccustomed . There was [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband 's reproach looking at [her]115-edna from the external things around [her]115-edna which [he]1371-his had provided for [her]115-edna external existence . There was [Robert]53-robert 's reproach making itself felt by a quicker , fiercer , more overpowering love , which had awakened within [her]115-edna toward [him]53-robert . Above all , there was understanding . [She]115-edna felt as if a mist had been lifted from [her]115-edna eyes , enabling [her]115-edna to look upon and comprehend the significance of life , that monster made up of beauty and brutality . But among the conflicting sensations which assailed [her]115-edna , there was neither shame nor remorse . There was a dull pang of regret because it was not the kiss of love which had inflamed [her]115-edna , because it was not love which had held this cup of life to [her]115-edna lips .

XXIX

Without even waiting for an answer from [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband regarding [his]186-her husband opinion or wishes in the matter , [Edna]115-edna hastened [her]115-edna preparations for quitting [[her]115-edna home on [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street]1377-her home on esplanade street and moving into [the little house]1378-the little house around [the block]1332-the block . A feverish anxiety attended [her]115-edna every action in that direction . There was no moment of deliberation , no interval of repose between the thought and its fulfillment . Early upon the morning following those hours passed in [[Arobin]77-arobin 's society]1380-arobin 's society , [Edna]115-edna set about securing [[her]115-edna new abode]1381-her new abode and hurrying [her]115-edna arrangements for occupying [it]1381-her new abode . Within the precincts of [[her]115-edna home]1346-her home [she]115-edna felt like one who has entered and lingered within the portals of [some forbidden temple in which a thousand muffled voices bade [her]115-edna begone]1383-some forbidden temple in which a thousand muffled voices bade her begone .

Whatever was [her]115-edna own in [the house]157-the house , everything which [she]115-edna had acquired aside from [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband 's bounty , [she]115-edna caused to be transported to [the other house]1386-the other house , supplying simple and meager deficiencies from [her]115-edna own resources .

[Arobin]77-arobin found [her]115-edna with rolled sleeves , working in company with [the house - maid]1032-the house - maid when [he]77-arobin looked in during the afternoon . [She]115-edna was splendid and robust , and had never appeared handsomer than in the old blue gown , with a red silk handkerchief knotted at random around [her]115-edna head to protect [her]115-edna hair from the dust . [She]115-edna was mounted upon a high stepladder , unhooking a picture from the wall when [he]77-arobin entered . [He]77-arobin had found the front door open , and had followed [his]77-arobin ring by walking in unceremoniously .

" Come down ! "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin said . " Do [you]115-edna want to kill [yourself]115-edna ? "[115-edna] [She]115-edna greeted [him]77-arobin with affected carelessness , and appeared absorbed in [her]115-edna occupation .

If [he]77-arobin had expected to find [her]115-edna languishing , reproachful , or indulging in sentimental tears , [he]77-arobin must have been greatly surprised .

[He]77-arobin was no doubt prepared for any emergency , ready for any one of the foregoing attitudes , just as [he]77-arobin bent [himself]77-arobin easily and naturally to the situation which confronted [him]77-arobin .

" Please come down , "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin insisted , holding the ladder and looking up at [her]115-edna .

" No , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna answered ; " [Ellen]131-ellen is afraid to mount the ladder . [Joe]104-joe is working over at [the pigeon house]2017-the pigeon house ' that 's the name [Ellen]131-ellen gives [it]2017-the pigeon house , because it 's so small and looks like [a pigeon house]2018-a pigeon house and [some one]538-some one has to do this . "[115-edna]

[Arobin]77-arobin pulled off [his]77-arobin coat , and expressed [himself]77-arobin ready and willing to tempt fate in [her]115-edna place . [Ellen]131-ellen brought [him]77-arobin one of [her]131-ellen dust - caps , and went into contortions of mirth , which [she]115-edna found it impossible to control , when [she]115-edna saw [him]77-arobin put it on before the mirror as grotesquely as [he]77-arobin could . [Edna]115-edna [herself]115-edna could not refrain from smiling when [she]115-edna fastened it at [his]77-arobin request . So it was [he]77-arobin who in turn mounted the ladder , unhooking pictures and curtains , and dislodging ornaments as [Edna]115-edna directed . When [he]77-arobin had finished [he]77-arobin took off [his]77-arobin dust - cap and went out to wash [his]77-arobin hands .

[Edna]115-edna was sitting on the tabouret , idly brushing the tips of a feather duster along the carpet when [he]77-arobin came in again .

" Is there anything more [you]115-edna will let [me]77-arobin do ? "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin asked .

" That is all , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna answered . " [Ellen]131-ellen can manage the rest . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna kept [the young woman]614-the young woman occupied in [the drawing - room]923-the drawing - room , unwilling to be left alone with [Arobin]77-arobin .

" What about the dinner ? "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin asked ; " the grand event , the _ coup d ' tat ? _ "[77-arobin]

" It will be day after to - morrow . Why do [you]77-arobin call it the _ coup d ' tat ? _ ' Oh ! it will be very fine ; all [my]115-edna best of everything crystal , silver and gold , S vres , flowers , music , and champagne to swim in . [I]115-edna 'll let [L]57-l once pay the bills . [I]115-edna wonder what [he]77-arobin 'll say when [he]77-arobin sees the bills . "[115-edna]

" And [you]77-arobin ask [me]77-arobin why [I]77-arobin call it a _ coup d ' tat ? _ "[77-arobin] [Arobin]77-arobin had put on [his]77-arobin coat , and [he]77-arobin stood before [her]115-edna and asked if [his]77-arobin cravat was plumb . [She]115-edna told [him]77-arobin it was , looking no higher than the tip of [his]77-arobin collar .

" When do [you]77-arobin go to [the pigeon house]2017-the pigeon house ? ' with all due acknowledgment to [Ellen]131-ellen . "[77-arobin]

" Day after to - morrow , after the dinner . [I]77-arobin shall sleep [there]204-there . "[77-arobin]

" [Ellen]131-ellen , will [you]131-ellen very kindly get [me]77-arobin a glass of water ? "[77-arobin] asked [Arobin]77-arobin . " The dust in the curtains , if [you]131-ellen will pardon [me]77-arobin for hinting such a thing , has parched [my]77-arobin throat to a crisp . "[77-arobin]

" While [Ellen]131-ellen gets the water , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , rising , " [I]115-edna will say good - by and let [you]77-arobin go . [I]115-edna must get rid of this grime , and [I]115-edna have a million things to do and think of . "[115-edna]

" When shall [I]77-arobin see [you]115-edna ? "[77-arobin] asked [Arobin]77-arobin , seeking to detain [her]115-edna , [the maid]951-the maid having left [the room]522-the room .

" At the dinner , of course . [You]115-edna are invited . "[115-edna]

" Not before ? not to - night or to - morrow morning or to - morrow noon or night ? or the day after morning or noon ? Ca n't [you]115-edna see [yourself]115-edna , without [my]115-edna telling [you]115-edna , what an eternity it is ? "[115-edna]

[He]77-arobin had followed [her]115-edna into [the hall]536-the hall and to the foot of [the stairway]1393-the stairway , looking up at [her]115-edna as [she]115-edna mounted with [her]115-edna face half turned to [him]77-arobin .

" Not an instant sooner , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said . But [she]115-edna laughed and looked at [him]77-arobin with eyes that at once gave [him]77-arobin courage to wait and made it torture to wait .

XXX

Though [Edna]115-edna had spoken of the dinner as a very grand affair , it was in truth a very small affair and very select , in so much as [the guests invited]1394-the guests invited were few and were selected with discrimination .
