[She]115-edna had counted upon an even dozen seating [themselves]1395-themselves at [her]115-edna round mahogany board , forgetting for the moment that [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle was to the last degree _ souffrante _ and unpresentable , and not foreseeing that [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun would send a thousand regrets at the last moment . So there were only ten , after all , which made a cozy , comfortable number .

There were [Mr.]1396-mr. and [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman , [a pretty , vivacious little woman in the thirties]1397-a pretty , vivacious little woman in the thirties ; [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , [a jovial fellow]1399-a jovial fellow , something of a shallow - pate , who laughed a good deal at [other people]1400-other people 's witticisms , and had thereby made [himself]186-her husband extremely popular . [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp had accompanied [them]1401-them . Of course , there was [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin ; and [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz had consented to come . [Edna]115-edna had sent [her]115-edna a fresh bunch of violets with black lace trimmings for [her]115-edna hair . [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle brought [himself]83-monsieur ratignolle and [[his]83-monsieur ratignolle wife]179-his wife 's excuses . [Victor Lebrun]78-victor , who happened to be in [the city]261-the city , bent upon relaxation , had accepted with alacrity . There was [a Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt , no longer in [her]132-miss mayblunt teens , who looked at [the world]281-the world through lorgnettes and with the keenest interest . It was thought and said that [she]115-edna was intellectual ; it was suspected of [her]115-edna that [she]115-edna wrote under a _ nom de guerre _ . [She]115-edna had come with [a gentleman by the name of [Gouvernail]133-mr. gouvernail , connected with one of the daily papers]1405-a gentleman by the name of gouvernail , connected with one of the daily papers , of whom nothing special could be said , except that [he]1405-a gentleman by the name of gouvernail , connected with one of the daily papers was observant and seemed quiet and inoffensive . [Edna]115-edna [herself]115-edna made the tenth , and at half - past eight [they]1406-they seated [themselves]1406-they at table , [Arobin]77-arobin and [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle on either side of [[their]1406-they hostess]1407-their hostess .

[Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp sat between [Arobin]77-arobin and [Victor Lebrun]78-victor . Then came [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman , [Mr. Gouvernail]133-mr. gouvernail , [Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt , [Mr. Merriman]134-mr. merriman , and [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz next to [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle .

There was something extremely gorgeous about the appearance of the table , an effect of splendor conveyed by a cover of pale yellow satin under strips of lace - work . There were wax candles , in massive brass candelabra , burning softly under yellow silk shades ; full , fragrant roses , yellow and red , abounded . There were silver and gold , as [she]107-mrs. highcamp had said there would be , and crystal which glittered like the gems which [the women]386-the women wore .

The ordinary stiff dining chairs had been discarded for the occasion and replaced by the most commodious and luxurious which could be collected throughout [the house]157-the house . [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz , being exceedingly diminutive , was elevated upon cushions , as [small children]1410-small children are sometimes hoisted at table upon bulky volumes .

" Something new , [Edna]115-edna ? "[132-miss mayblunt] exclaimed [Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt , with [lorgnette]1411-lorgnette directed toward a magnificent cluster of diamonds that sparkled , that almost sputtered , in [Edna]115-edna 's hair , just over the center of [her]115-edna forehead .

" Quite new ; brand ' new , in fact ; a present from [[my]132-miss mayblunt husband]2022-my husband . It arrived this morning from [New York]32-new york . [I]132-miss mayblunt may as well admit that this is [my]132-miss mayblunt birthday , and that [I]132-miss mayblunt am twenty - nine . In good time [I]132-miss mayblunt expect [you]2023-you to drink [my]132-miss mayblunt health . Meanwhile , [I]132-miss mayblunt shall ask [you]2023-you to begin with this cocktail , composed would [you]2023-you say composed ? ' "[132-miss mayblunt] with an appeal to [Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt " composed by [[my]132-miss mayblunt father]1738-my father in honor of [Sister Janet]59-janet 's wedding . "[132-miss mayblunt]

Before [each guest]1412-each guest stood a tiny glass that looked and sparkled like a garnet gem .

" Then , all things considered , "[77-arobin] spoke [Arobin]77-arobin , " it might not be amiss to start out by drinking [the Colonel]1192-the colonel 's health in the cocktail which [he]1192-the colonel composed , on the birthday of [the most charming of women [the daughter whom [he]1192-the colonel invented]2027-the daughter whom he invented]2026-the most charming of women the daughter whom he invented . "[77-arobin]

[Mr. Merriman]134-mr. merriman 's laugh at this sally was such a genuine outburst and so contagious that it started the dinner with an agreeable swing that never slackened .

[Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt begged to be allowed to keep [her]132-miss mayblunt cocktail untouched before [her]132-miss mayblunt , just to look at . The color was marvelous ! [She]132-miss mayblunt could compare it to nothing [she]132-miss mayblunt had ever seen , and the garnet lights which it emitted were unspeakably rare . [She]132-miss mayblunt pronounced [the Colonel]1192-the colonel [an artist]1765-an artist , and stuck to it .

[Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle was prepared to take things seriously ; the _ mets _ , [the _ entre - mets]1415-the _ entre - mets _ , the service , the decorations , even [the people]623-the people . [He]83-monsieur ratignolle looked up from [his]83-monsieur ratignolle pompano and inquired of [Arobin]77-arobin if [he]77-arobin were related to [the gentleman of that name who formed one of [the firm of [Laitner]135-laitner and [Arobin]77-arobin , [lawyers]1419-lawyers]1418-the firm of laitner and arobin , lawyers]1417-the gentleman of that name who formed one of the firm of laitner and arobin , lawyers . [The young man]225-the young man admitted that [Laitner]135-laitner was [a warm personal friend , who permitted [Arobin]77-arobin 's name to decorate [the firm]1422-the firm 's letterheads and to appear upon a shingle that graced [Perdido Street]36-perdido street]1421-a warm personal friend , who permitted arobin 's name to decorate the firm 's letterheads and to appear upon a shingle that graced perdido street .

" There are so many [inquisitive people]2028-inquisitive people and institutions abounding , "[77-arobin] said [Arobin]77-arobin , " that [one]303-one is really forced as a matter of convenience these days to assume the virtue of an occupation if [he]303-one has it not . "[77-arobin] [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle stared a little , and turned to ask [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz if [she]84-mademoiselle reisz considered the symphony concerts up to the standard which had been set the previous winter . [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz answered [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle in French , which [Edna]115-edna thought a little rude , under the circumstances , but characteristic . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz had only disagreeable things to say of the symphony concerts , and insulting remarks to make of [all the musicians of [New Orleans]2-new orleans]1423-all the musicians of new orleans , singly and collectively . All [her]84-mademoiselle reisz interest seemed to be centered upon the delicacies placed before [her]84-mademoiselle reisz .

[Mr. Merriman]134-mr. merriman said that [Mr. Arobin]128-arobin 's remark about [inquisitive people]2028-inquisitive people reminded [him]134-mr. merriman of [a man from [Waco]37-waco]1425-a man from waco the other day at [the St. Charles Hotel]1426-the st. charles hotel but as [Mr. Merriman]134-mr. merriman 's stories were always lame and lacking point , [[his]134-mr. merriman wife]179-his wife seldom permitted [him]134-mr. merriman to complete them . [She]179-his wife interrupted [him]134-mr. merriman to ask if [he]134-mr. merriman remembered the name of [the author whose book [she]179-his wife had bought the week before to send to [a friend in [Geneva]38-geneva]1429-a friend in geneva]1428-the author whose book she had bought the week before to send to a friend in geneva . [She]179-his wife was talking " books "[179-his wife] with [Mr. Gouvernail]133-mr. gouvernail and trying to draw from [him]133-mr. gouvernail [his]133-mr. gouvernail opinion upon current literary topics . [[Her]179-his wife husband]186-her husband told the story of [the Waco man]1431-the waco man privately to [Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt , who pretended to be greatly amused and to think it extremely clever .

[Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp hung with languid but unaffected interest upon the warm and impetuous volubility of [[her]107-mrs. highcamp left - hand neighbor]1432-her left - hand neighbor , [Victor Lebrun]78-victor . [Her]107-mrs. highcamp attention was never for a moment withdrawn from [him]134-mr. merriman after seating [herself]107-mrs. highcamp at table ; and when [he]134-mr. merriman turned to [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman , who was prettier and more vivacious than [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp , [she]107-mrs. highcamp waited with easy indifference for an opportunity to reclaim [his]134-mr. merriman attention . There was the occasional sound of music , of mandolins , sufficiently removed to be an agreeable accompaniment rather than an interruption to the conversation . Outside the soft , monotonous splash of a fountain could be heard ; the sound penetrated into [the room]522-the room with the heavy odor of jessamine that came through the open windows .

The golden shimmer of [Edna]115-edna 's satin gown spread in rich folds on either side of [her]115-edna . There was a soft fall of lace encircling [her]115-edna shoulders . It was the color of [her]115-edna skin , without the glow , the myriad living tints that one may sometimes discover in vibrant flesh . There was something in [her]115-edna attitude , in [her]115-edna whole appearance when [she]115-edna leaned [her]115-edna head against the high - backed chair and spread [her]115-edna arms , which suggested [the regal woman]1434-the regal woman , [the one who rules , who looks on , who stands alone]1435-the one who rules , who looks on , who stands alone .

But as [she]115-edna sat there amid [[her]115-edna guests]1436-her guests , [she]115-edna felt the old ennui overtaking [her]115-edna ; the hopelessness which so often assailed [her]115-edna , which came upon [her]115-edna like an obsession , like something extraneous , independent of volition . It was something which announced itself ; a chill breath that seemed to issue from some vast cavern wherein discords waited . There came over [her]115-edna the acute longing which always summoned into [her]115-edna spiritual vision the presence of [the beloved one]1437-the beloved one , overpowering [her]115-edna at once with a sense of the unattainable .

The moments glided on , while a feeling of good fellowship passed around the circle like a mystic cord , holding and binding [these people]1438-these people together with jest and laughter . [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle was the first to break the pleasant charm . At ten o'clock [he]83-monsieur ratignolle excused [himself]83-monsieur ratignolle . [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle was waiting for [him]83-monsieur ratignolle at [home]245-home . [She]62-madame ratignolle was _ bien souffrante _ , and [she]62-madame ratignolle was filled with vague dread , which only [[her]62-madame ratignolle husband]186-her husband 's presence could allay .

[Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz arose with [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle , who offered to escort [her]84-mademoiselle reisz to [the car]1111-the car . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz had eaten well ; [she]84-mademoiselle reisz had tasted the good , rich wines , and [they]1442-they must have turned [her]84-mademoiselle reisz head , for [she]84-mademoiselle reisz bowed pleasantly to [all]875-all as [she]84-mademoiselle reisz withdrew from table . [She]84-mademoiselle reisz kissed [Edna]115-edna upon the shoulder , and whispered : " _ Bonne nuit , [ma reine]2030-ma reine ; soyez sage _ . "[84-mademoiselle reisz] [She]84-mademoiselle reisz had been a little bewildered upon rising , or rather , descending from [her]84-mademoiselle reisz cushions , and [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle gallantly took [her]84-mademoiselle reisz arm and led [her]84-mademoiselle reisz away .

[Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp was weaving a garland of roses , yellow and red . When [she]107-mrs. highcamp had finished the garland , [she]107-mrs. highcamp laid it lightly upon [Victor]78-victor 's black curls . [He]78-victor was reclining far back in the luxurious chair , holding a glass of champagne to the light .

As if [a magician]1444-a magician 's wand had touched [him]78-victor , the garland of roses transformed [him]78-victor into a vision of Oriental beauty . [His]78-victor cheeks were the color of crushed grapes , and [his]78-victor dusky eyes glowed with a languishing fire .

" _ [Sapristi]48-sapristi ! _ "[128-arobin] exclaimed [Arobin]128-arobin .

But [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp had one more touch to add to the picture . [She]107-mrs. highcamp took from the back of [her]107-mrs. highcamp chair a white silken scarf , with which [she]107-mrs. highcamp had covered [her]107-mrs. highcamp shoulders in the early part of the evening . [She]107-mrs. highcamp draped it across [the boy]936-the boy in graceful folds , and in a way to conceal [his]78-victor black , conventional evening dress . [He]78-victor did not seem to mind what [she]107-mrs. highcamp did to [him]78-victor , only smiled , showing a faint gleam of white teeth , while [he]78-victor continued to gaze with narrowing eyes at the light through [his]78-victor glass of champagne .

" Oh ! to be able to paint in color rather than in words ! "[132-miss mayblunt] exclaimed [Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt , losing [herself]132-miss mayblunt in a rhapsodic dream as [she]132-miss mayblunt looked at [him]78-victor .

" There was a graven image of Desire Painted with red blood on a ground of gold . ' "[133-mr. gouvernail]

murmured [Gouvernail]133-mr. gouvernail , under [his]133-mr. gouvernail breath .

The effect of the wine upon [Victor]78-victor was to change [his]78-victor accustomed volubility into silence . [He]78-victor seemed to have abandoned [himself]78-victor to a reverie , and to be seeing pleasing visions in the amber bead .

" Sing , "[107-mrs. highcamp] entreated [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp . " Wo n't [you]78-victor sing to [us]2031-us ? "[107-mrs. highcamp]

" Let [him]78-victor alone , "[128-arobin] said [Arobin]128-arobin .

" [He]78-victor 's posing , "[134-mr. merriman] offered [Mr. Merriman]134-mr. merriman ; " let [him]78-victor have it out . "[134-mr. merriman]

" [I]122-mrs. merriman believe [he]78-victor 's paralyzed , "[122-mrs. merriman] laughed [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman . And leaning over [the youth]736-the youth 's chair , [she]122-mrs. merriman took the glass from [his]78-victor hand and held it to [his]78-victor lips . [He]78-victor sipped the wine slowly , and when [he]78-victor had drained the glass [she]122-mrs. merriman laid it upon the table and wiped [his]78-victor lips with [her]122-mrs. merriman little filmy handkerchief .

" Yes , [I]78-victor 'll sing for [you]115-edna , "[78-victor] [he]78-victor said , turning in [his]78-victor chair toward [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp . [He]78-victor clasped [his]78-victor hands behind [his]78-victor head , and looking up at the ceiling began to hum a little , trying [his]78-victor voice like [a musician tuning an instrument]1447-a musician tuning an instrument . Then , looking at [Edna]115-edna , [he]78-victor began to sing :

" Ah ! si tu savais ! "[78-victor]

" Stop ! "[122-mrs. merriman] [she]122-mrs. merriman cried , " do n't sing that . The wine spilled over [Arobin]128-arobin 's legs and some of it trickled down upon [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp 's black gauze gown . [Victor]78-victor had lost all idea of courtesy , or else [he]78-victor thought [[his]78-victor hostess]1222-his hostess was not in earnest , for [he]78-victor laughed and went on :

" Ah ! si tu savais Ce que tes yeux [me]78-victor disent "[78-victor]

" Oh ! [you]78-victor must n't ! " No , no , [I]115-edna wo n't , [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier . [I]115-edna did n't know [you]115-edna meant it , "[115-edna] looking up at [her]115-edna with caressing eyes . " Come , [Victor]78-victor ; [you]78-victor 've posed long enough . Give [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp [her]107-mrs. highcamp scarf . "[115-edna]

[Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp undraped the scarf from about [him]78-victor with [her]107-mrs. highcamp own hands . [Miss Mayblunt]132-miss mayblunt and [Mr. Gouvernail]133-mr. gouvernail suddenly conceived the notion that it was time to say good night . And [Mr.]1450-mr. and [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman wondered how it could be so late .

Before parting from [Victor]78-victor , [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp invited [him]78-victor to call upon [[her]107-mrs. highcamp daughter]567-her daughter , who [she]107-mrs. highcamp knew would be charmed to meet [him]78-victor and talk French and sing French songs with [him]78-victor . [Victor]78-victor expressed [his]78-victor desire and intention to call upon [Miss Highcamp]127-miss highcamp at the first opportunity which presented itself . [He]78-victor asked if [Arobin]128-arobin were going [his]78-victor way . [Arobin]128-arobin was not .

[The mandolin players]1452-the mandolin players had long since stolen away . A profound stillness had fallen upon [the broad , beautiful street]1453-the broad , beautiful street . The voices of [[Edna]115-edna 's disbanding [guests]1455-guests]1454-edna 's disbanding guests jarred like a discordant note upon the quiet harmony of the night .

XXXI

" Well ? "[128-arobin] questioned [Arobin]128-arobin , who had remained with [Edna]115-edna after [the others]324-the others had departed .

" Well , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna reiterated , and stood up , stretching [her]115-edna arms , and feeling the need to relax [her]115-edna muscles after having been so long seated .

" What next ? "[128-arobin] [he]128-arobin asked .

" [The servants]2032-the servants are all gone . [They]2032-the servants left when [the musicians]2033-the musicians did . [I]115-edna have dismissed [them]2032-the servants . [The house]157-the house has to be closed and locked , and [I]115-edna shall trot around to [the pigeon house]2017-the pigeon house , and shall send [Celestine]129-celestine over in the morning to straighten things up . "[115-edna]

[He]128-arobin looked around , and began to turn out some of the lights .

" What about [upstairs]805-upstairs ? "[128-arobin] [he]128-arobin inquired .

" [I]115-edna think it is all right ; but there may be a window or two unlatched . [We]2037-we had better look ; [you]115-edna might take a candle and see . And bring [me]115-edna [my]115-edna wrap and hat on the foot of the bed in [the middle room]2038-the middle room . "[115-edna]

[He]128-arobin went up with the light , and [Edna]115-edna began closing doors and windows . [She]115-edna hated to shut in the smoke and the fumes of the wine . [Arobin]128-arobin found [her]115-edna cape and hat , which [he]128-arobin brought down and helped [her]115-edna to put on .

When everything was secured and the lights put out , [they]1457-they left through the front door , [Arobin]128-arobin locking it and taking the key , which [he]128-arobin carried for [Edna]115-edna . [He]128-arobin helped [her]115-edna down the steps .

" Will [you]115-edna have a spray of jessamine ? "[128-arobin] [he]128-arobin asked , breaking off a few blossoms as [he]128-arobin passed .

" No ; [I]128-arobin do n't want anything . "[128-arobin]

[She]115-edna seemed disheartened , and had nothing to say . [She]115-edna took [his]128-arobin arm , which [he]128-arobin offered [her]115-edna , holding up the weight of [her]115-edna satin train with the other hand . [She]115-edna looked down , noticing the black line of [his]128-arobin leg moving in and out so close to [her]115-edna against the yellow shimmer of [her]115-edna gown . There was the whistle of [a railway train]1458-a railway train somewhere in the distance , and the midnight bells were ringing . [They]1459-they met [no one]312-no one in [their]1459-they short walk .

[The " pigeon house]2039-the " pigeon house "[128-arobin] stood behind a locked gate , and [a shallow _ parterre _ that had been somewhat neglected]1461-a shallow _ parterre _ that had been somewhat neglected . There was [a small front porch]1462-a small front porch , upon which a long window and the front door opened . The door opened directly into [the parlor]1463-the parlor ; there was no side entry . Back in [the yard]913-the yard was [a room for [servants]1466-servants , in which [old Celestine]129-celestine had been ensconced]1465-a room for servants , in which old celestine had been ensconced .

[Edna]115-edna had left a lamp burning low upon the table . [She]115-edna had succeeded in making [the room]522-the room look habitable and homelike . There were some books on the table and a lounge near at hand . On the floor was a fresh matting , covered with a rug or two ; and on the walls hung a few tasteful pictures . But [the room]522-the room was filled with flowers . These were a surprise to [her]115-edna . [Arobin]128-arobin had sent them , and had had [Celestine]129-celestine distribute them during [Edna]115-edna 's absence . [[Her]115-edna bedroom]1469-her bedroom was adjoining , and across [a small passage]1470-a small passage were [the dining - room]278-the dining - room and [kitchen]1472-kitchen .

[Edna]115-edna seated [herself]115-edna with every appearance of discomfort .

" Are [you]115-edna tired ? "[128-arobin] [he]128-arobin asked .

" Yes , and chilled , and miserable . [I]115-edna feel as if [I]115-edna had been wound up to a certain pitch too tight and something inside of [me]115-edna had snapped . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna rested [her]115-edna head against the table upon [her]115-edna bare arm .

" [You]115-edna want to rest , "[128-arobin] [he]128-arobin said , " and to be quiet . [I]128-arobin 'll go ; [I]128-arobin 'll leave [you]115-edna and let [you]115-edna rest . "[128-arobin]

" Yes , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna replied .

[He]128-arobin stood up beside [her]115-edna and smoothed [her]115-edna hair with [his]128-arobin soft , magnetic hand . [His]128-arobin touch conveyed to [her]115-edna a certain physical comfort . [She]115-edna could have fallen quietly asleep there if [he]128-arobin had continued to pass [his]128-arobin hand over [her]115-edna hair . [He]128-arobin brushed the hair upward from the nape of [her]115-edna neck .

" [I]128-arobin hope [you]115-edna will feel better and happier in the morning , "[128-arobin] [he]128-arobin said . " [You]115-edna have tried to do too much in the past few days . The dinner was the last straw ; [you]115-edna might have dispensed with it . "[128-arobin]

" Yes , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna admitted ; " it was stupid . "[115-edna]

" No , it was delightful ; but it has worn [you]115-edna out . "[128-arobin] [His]128-arobin hand had strayed to [her]115-edna beautiful shoulders , and [he]128-arobin could feel the response of [her]115-edna flesh to [his]128-arobin touch . [He]128-arobin seated [himself]128-arobin beside [her]115-edna and kissed [her]115-edna lightly upon the shoulder .

" [I]115-edna thought [you]128-arobin were going away , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said , in an uneven voice .

" [I]115-edna am , after [I]115-edna have said good night . "[115-edna]

" Good night , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna murmured .

[He]128-arobin did not answer , except to continue to caress [her]115-edna . [He]128-arobin did not say good night until [she]115-edna had become supple to [his]128-arobin gentle , seductive entreaties .

XXXII

When [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier learned of [[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife 's intention to abandon [[her]179-his wife home]1346-her home and take up [[her]179-his wife residence]1475-her residence elsewhere , [he]49-mr. pontellier immediately wrote [her]115-edna a letter of unqualified disapproval and remonstrance . [She]115-edna had given reasons which [he]49-mr. pontellier was unwilling to acknowledge as adequate . [He]49-mr. pontellier hoped [she]115-edna had not acted upon [her]115-edna rash impulse ; and [he]49-mr. pontellier begged [her]115-edna to consider first , foremost , and above all else , what [people]904-people would say . [He]49-mr. pontellier was not dreaming of scandal when [he]49-mr. pontellier uttered this warning ; that was a thing which would never have entered into [his]49-mr. pontellier mind to consider in connection with [[his]49-mr. pontellier wife]179-his wife 's name or [his]49-mr. pontellier own . [He]49-mr. pontellier was simply thinking of [his]49-mr. pontellier financial integrity . It might get noised about that [the Pontelliers]75-the pontelliers had met with reverses , and were forced to conduct [their]75-the pontelliers _ m nage _ on a humbler scale than heretofore . It might do incalculable mischief to [his]49-mr. pontellier business prospects .

But remembering [Edna]115-edna 's whimsical turn of mind of late , and foreseeing that [she]115-edna had immediately acted upon [her]115-edna impetuous determination , [he]49-mr. pontellier grasped the situation with [his]49-mr. pontellier usual promptness and handled it with [his]49-mr. pontellier well - known business tact and cleverness .

The same mail which brought to [Edna]115-edna [his]49-mr. pontellier letter of disapproval carried instructions the most minute instructions to [a well - known architect]1478-a well - known architect concerning the remodeling of [[his]49-mr. pontellier home]928-his home , changes which [he]49-mr. pontellier had long contemplated , and which [he]49-mr. pontellier desired carried forward during [his]49-mr. pontellier temporary absence .

[Expert and reliable packers and movers]1480-expert and reliable packers and movers were engaged to convey the furniture , carpets , pictures everything movable , in short to [places of security]1481-places of security . And in an incredibly short time [the Pontellier house]1482-the pontellier house was turned over to [the artisans]1483-the artisans . There was to be an addition a small snuggery ; there was to be frescoing , and hardwood flooring was to be put into [such rooms]1484-such rooms as had not yet been subjected to this improvement .

Furthermore , in one of the daily papers appeared a brief notice to the effect that [Mr.]1485-mr. and [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier were contemplating a summer sojourn abroad , and that [[their]1486-their handsome residence on [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street]1487-their handsome residence on esplanade street was undergoing sumptuous alterations , and would not be ready for occupancy until [their]1486-their return . [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier had saved appearances !

[Edna]115-edna admired the skill of [his]49-mr. pontellier maneuver , and avoided any occasion to balk [his]49-mr. pontellier intentions . When the situation as set forth by [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier was accepted and taken for granted , [she]115-edna was apparently satisfied that it should be so .

[The pigeon house]2017-the pigeon house pleased [her]115-edna . [It]2017-the pigeon house at once assumed the intimate character of [a home]1489-a home , while [she]115-edna [herself]115-edna invested [it]2017-the pigeon house with a charm which it reflected like a warm glow . There was with [her]115-edna a feeling of having descended in the social scale , with a corresponding sense of having risen in the spiritual . Every step which [she]115-edna took toward relieving [herself]115-edna from obligations added to [her]115-edna strength and expansion as [an individual]1490-an individual . [She]115-edna began to look with [her]115-edna own eyes ; to see and to apprehend the deeper undercurrents of life . No longer was [she]115-edna content to " feed upon opinion "[115-edna] when [her]115-edna own soul had invited [her]115-edna .

After a little while , a few days , in fact , [Edna]115-edna went up and spent a week with [[her]115-edna children]306-her children in [Iberville]10-iberville . [They]306-her children were delicious February days , with all the summer 's promise hovering in the air .

How glad [she]115-edna was to see [the children]239-the children ! [She]115-edna wept for very pleasure when [she]115-edna felt [their]239-the children little arms clasping [her]115-edna ; [their]239-the children hard , ruddy cheeks pressed against [her]115-edna own glowing cheeks . [She]115-edna looked into [their]239-the children faces with hungry eyes that could not be satisfied with looking . And what stories [they]239-the children had to tell [[their]239-the children mother]436-their mother ! About the pigs , the cows , [the mules]1494-the mules ! About riding to [the mill behind Gluglu]1495-the mill behind gluglu ; fishing back in [the lake]1496-the lake with [[their]239-the children Uncle]1497-their uncle [Jasper]136-jasper ; picking pecans with [Lidie]137-lidie 's little black brood , and hauling chips in [[their]239-the children express wagon]1498-their express wagon . It was a thousand times more fun to haul real chips for [old lame [Susie]138-susie 's real fire]1499-old lame susie 's real fire than to drag painted blocks along the banquette on [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street !

[She]115-edna went with [them]239-the children [herself]115-edna to see the pigs and the cows , to look at the darkies laying the cane , to thrash the pecan trees , and catch fish in [the back lake]1500-the back lake . [She]115-edna lived with [them]239-the children a whole week long , giving [them]239-the children all of [herself]115-edna , and gathering and filling [herself]115-edna with [their]239-the children young existence . [They]239-the children listened , breathless , when [she]115-edna told [them]239-the children [the house in [Esplanade Street]25-esplanade street]1501-the house in esplanade street was crowded with [workmen]1502-workmen , hammering , nailing , sawing , and filling [the place]1080-the place with clatter . [They]239-the children wanted to know where [their]239-the children bed was ; what had been done with [their]239-the children rocking - horse ; and where did [Joe]104-joe sleep , and where had [Ellen]131-ellen gone , and [the cook]691-the cook ? But , above all , [they]239-the children were fired with a desire to see [the little house]1378-the little house around [the block]1332-the block . Was there any place to play ? Were there any [boys next door]1507-boys next door ? [Raoul]58-raoul , with pessimistic foreboding , was convinced that there were only [girls next door]1508-girls next door . Where would [they]239-the children sleep , and where would [papa]1509-papa sleep ? [She]115-edna told [them]239-the children [the fairies]1510-the fairies would fix it all right .

[The old Madame]62-madame ratignolle was charmed with [Edna]115-edna 's visit , and showered all manner of delicate attentions upon [her]62-madame ratignolle . [She]62-madame ratignolle was delighted to know that [the Esplanade Street house]1511-the esplanade street house was in a dismantled condition . It gave [her]62-madame ratignolle the promise and pretext to keep [the children]239-the children indefinitely .

It was with a wrench and a pang that [Edna]115-edna left [[her]115-edna children]306-her children . [She]115-edna carried away with [her]115-edna the sound of [their]306-her children voices and the touch of [their]306-her children cheeks . All along the journey [homeward]1514-homeward [their]306-her children presence lingered with [her]115-edna like the memory of a delicious song . But by the time [she]115-edna had regained [the city]261-the city the song no longer echoed in [her]115-edna soul . [She]115-edna was again alone .

XXXIII

It happened sometimes when [Edna]115-edna went to see [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz that [the little musician]1131-the little musician was absent , giving a lesson or making some small necessary household purchase . The key was always left in a secret hiding - place in the entry , which [Edna]115-edna knew . If [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz happened to be away , [Edna]115-edna would usually enter and wait for [her]84-mademoiselle reisz return .

When [she]115-edna knocked at [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's door one afternoon there was no response ; so unlocking the door , as usual , [she]115-edna entered and found [the apartment]1124-the apartment deserted , as [she]115-edna had expected . [Her]115-edna day had been quite filled up , and it was for a rest , for a refuge , and to talk about [Robert]53-robert , that [she]115-edna sought out [[her]115-edna friend]346-her friend .

[She]115-edna had worked at [her]115-edna canvas [a young Italian character study]1519-a young italian character study all the morning , completing the work without [the model]1520-the model ; but there had been many interruptions , some incident to [[her]115-edna modest housekeeping]1521-her modest housekeeping , and others of a social nature .

[Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle had dragged [herself]115-edna over , avoiding the too public thoroughfares , [she]62-madame ratignolle said . [She]115-edna complained that [Edna]115-edna had neglected [her]115-edna much of late . Besides , [she]115-edna was consumed with curiosity to see [the little house]1378-the little house and the manner in which it was conducted . [She]115-edna wanted to hear all about the dinner party ; [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle had left _ so _ early . What had happened after [he]83-monsieur ratignolle left ? The champagne and grapes which [Edna]115-edna sent over were _ too _ delicious . [She]115-edna had so little appetite ; they had refreshed and toned [her]115-edna stomach . Where on earth was [she]115-edna going to put [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier in [that little house]1523-that little house , and [the boys]231-the boys ? And then [she]115-edna made [Edna]115-edna promise to go to [her]115-edna when [her]115-edna hour of trial overtook [her]115-edna .

" At any time any time of the day or night , [dear]1784-dear , "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna assured [her]115-edna .

Before leaving [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle said :

" In some way [you]1784-dear seem to [me]62-madame ratignolle like [a child]370-a child , [Edna]115-edna . [You]1784-dear seem to act without a certain amount of reflection which is necessary in this life . That is the reason [I]62-madame ratignolle want to say [you]1784-dear must n't mind if [I]62-madame ratignolle advise [you]1784-dear to be a little careful while [you]1784-dear are living [here]1819-here alone . Why do n't [you]1784-dear have [some one]538-some one come and stay with [you]1784-dear ? Would n't [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz come ? "[62-madame ratignolle]

" No ; [she]84-mademoiselle reisz would n't wish to come , and [I]115-edna should n't want [her]84-mademoiselle reisz always with [me]115-edna . "[115-edna]

" Well , the reason [you]1784-dear know how evil - minded [the world]281-the world is [some one]538-some one was talking of [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin visiting [you]1784-dear . Of course , it would n't matter if [Mr. Arobin]128-arobin had not such a dreadful reputation . [Monsieur Ratignolle]83-monsieur ratignolle was telling [me]62-madame ratignolle that [his]83-monsieur ratignolle attentions alone are considered enough to ruin [a woman]1753-a woman 's name . "[62-madame ratignolle]

" Does [he]83-monsieur ratignolle boast of [his]83-monsieur ratignolle successes ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna , indifferently , squinting at [her]115-edna picture .

" No , [I]62-madame ratignolle think not . [I]62-madame ratignolle believe [he]83-monsieur ratignolle is [a decent fellow]2047-a decent fellow as far as that goes . But [his]83-monsieur ratignolle character is so well known among [the men]634-the men . [I]62-madame ratignolle sha n't be able to come back and see [you]115-edna ; it was very , very imprudent to - day . "[62-madame ratignolle]

" Mind the step ! "[115-edna] cried [Edna]115-edna .

" Do n't neglect [me]62-madame ratignolle , "[62-madame ratignolle] entreated [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle ; " and do n't mind what [I]62-madame ratignolle said about [Arobin]77-arobin , or having [some one]538-some one to stay with [you]115-edna . "[62-madame ratignolle]

" Of course not , "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna laughed . " [You]115-edna may say anything [you]115-edna like to [me]115-edna . "[115-edna] [They]1525-they kissed [each other]183-each other good - by . [Madame Ratignolle]62-madame ratignolle had not far to go , and [Edna]115-edna stood on [the porch]182-the porch a while watching [her]62-madame ratignolle walk down [the street]244-the street .

Then in the afternoon [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman and [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp had made [their]1525-they " party call . "[122-mrs. merriman] [Edna]115-edna felt that [they]1525-they might have dispensed with the formality . [They]1525-they had also come to invite [her]115-edna to play _ vingt - et - un _ one evening at [[Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman 's]1529-mrs. merriman 's . [She]115-edna was asked to go early , to dinner , and [Mr. Merriman]134-mr. merriman or [Mr. Arobin]128-arobin would take [her]115-edna [home]245-home . [Edna]115-edna accepted in a half - hearted way . [She]115-edna sometimes felt very tired of [Mrs. Highcamp]107-mrs. highcamp and [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman .

Late in the afternoon [she]115-edna sought refuge with [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz , and stayed there alone , waiting for [her]84-mademoiselle reisz , feeling a kind of repose invade [her]115-edna with the very atmosphere of [the shabby , unpretentious little room]1531-the shabby , unpretentious little room .

[Edna]115-edna sat at the window , which looked out over [the house]157-the house - tops and across [the river]1121-the river . The window frame was filled with pots of flowers , and [she]115-edna sat and picked the dry leaves from a rose geranium . The day was warm , and the breeze which blew from [the river]1121-the river was very pleasant . [She]115-edna removed [her]115-edna hat and laid it on the piano . [She]115-edna went on picking the leaves and digging around the plants with [her]115-edna hat pin . Once [she]115-edna thought [she]115-edna heard [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz approaching . But it was [a young black girl]1535-a young black girl , who came in , bringing a small bundle of laundry , which [she]1535-a young black girl deposited in [the adjoining room]232-the adjoining room , and went away .

[Edna]115-edna seated [herself]115-edna at the piano , and softly picked out with one hand the bars of a piece of music which lay open before [her]115-edna . A half - hour went by . There was the occasional sound of [people]904-people going and coming in [the lower hall]1538-the lower hall . [She]115-edna was growing interested in [her]115-edna occupation of picking out the aria , when there was a second rap at the door . [She]115-edna vaguely wondered what [these people]1438-these people did when [they]1438-these people found [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz 's door locked .

" Come in , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna called , turning [her]115-edna face toward the door . And this time it was [Robert Lebrun]53-robert who presented [himself]53-robert . [She]115-edna attempted to rise ; [she]115-edna could not have done so without betraying the agitation which mastered [her]115-edna at sight of [him]53-robert , so [she]115-edna fell back upon the stool , only exclaiming , " Why , [Robert]53-robert ! "[115-edna]

[He]53-robert came and clasped [her]115-edna hand , seemingly without knowing what [he]53-robert was saying or doing .

" [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier ! How do [you]52-mrs. pontellier happen oh ! how well [you]52-mrs. pontellier look ! Is [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz not [here]1819-here ? [I]53-robert never expected to see [you]52-mrs. pontellier . "[53-robert]

" When did [you]53-robert come back ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna in an unsteady voice , wiping [her]115-edna face with [her]115-edna handkerchief . [She]115-edna seemed ill at ease on the piano stool , and [he]53-robert begged [her]115-edna to take the chair by the window .

[She]115-edna did so , mechanically , while [he]53-robert seated [himself]53-robert on the stool .

" [I]53-robert returned day before yesterday , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert answered , while [he]53-robert leaned [his]53-robert arm on the keys , bringing forth a crash of discordant sound .

" Day before yesterday ! "[115-edna] [she]115-edna repeated , aloud ; and went on thinking to [herself]115-edna , " day before yesterday , "[115-edna] in a sort of an uncomprehending way . [She]115-edna had pictured [him]53-robert seeking [her]115-edna at the very first hour , and [he]53-robert had lived under the same sky since day before yesterday ; while only by accident had [he]53-robert stumbled upon [her]115-edna . [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz must have lied when [she]115-edna said , " [Poor fool]1997-poor fool , [he]53-robert loves [you]1997-poor fool . "[84-mademoiselle reisz]

" Day before yesterday , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna repeated , breaking off a spray of [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz 's geranium ; " then if [you]53-robert had not met [me]115-edna here to - day [you]53-robert would n't when that is , did n't [you]53-robert mean to come and see [me]115-edna ? "[115-edna]

" Of course , [I]53-robert should have gone to see [you]53-robert . There have been so many things "[53-robert] [he]53-robert turned the leaves of [Mademoiselle]84-mademoiselle reisz 's music nervously . " [I]53-robert started in at once yesterday with [the old firm]2052-the old firm . After all there is as much chance for [me]53-robert here as there was [there]204-there that is , [I]53-robert might find it profitable some day . [The Mexicans]2054-the mexicans were not very congenial . "[53-robert]

So [he]53-robert had come back because [the Mexicans]2054-the mexicans were not congenial ; because business was as profitable here as there ; because of any reason , and not because [he]53-robert cared to be near [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna remembered the day [she]115-edna sat on the floor , turning the pages of [his]53-robert letter , seeking the reason which was left untold .

[She]115-edna had not noticed how [he]53-robert looked only feeling [his]53-robert presence ; but [she]115-edna turned deliberately and observed [him]53-robert . After all , [he]53-robert had been absent but a few months , and was not changed . [His]53-robert hair the color of [hers]115-edna waved back from [his]53-robert temples in the same way as before . [His]53-robert skin was not more burned than it had been at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle . [She]115-edna found in [his]53-robert eyes , when [he]53-robert looked at [her]115-edna for one silent moment , the same tender caress , with an added warmth and entreaty which had not been there before the same glance which had penetrated to the sleeping places of [her]115-edna soul and awakened [them]1541-them .

A hundred times [Edna]115-edna had pictured [Robert]53-robert 's return , and imagined [their]1542-their first meeting . It was usually at [[her]115-edna home]1346-her home , whither [he]53-robert had sought [her]115-edna out at once . [She]115-edna always fancied [him]53-robert expressing or betraying in some way [his]53-robert love for [her]115-edna . And here , the reality was that [they]1542-their sat ten feet apart , [she]115-edna at the window , crushing geranium leaves in [her]115-edna hand and smelling them , [he]53-robert twirling around on the piano stool , saying :

" [I]53-robert was very much surprised to hear of [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's absence ; it 's a wonder [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz did not tell [me]53-robert ; and [[your]2055-you moving mother]2056-your moving mother told [me]53-robert yesterday . [I]53-robert should think [you]2055-you would have gone to [New York]32-new york with [him]53-robert , or to [Iberville]10-iberville with [the children]239-the children , rather than be bothered [here]1819-here with housekeeping . And [you]2055-you are going abroad , too , [I]53-robert hear . [We]1542-their sha n't have [you]2055-you at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle next summer ; it wo n't seem do [you]2055-you see much of [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz ? [She]84-mademoiselle reisz often spoke of [you]2055-you in the few letters [she]84-mademoiselle reisz wrote . "[53-robert]

" Do [you]2055-you remember that [you]2055-you promised to write to [me]1544-me when [you]2055-you went away ? "[1544-me] A flush overspread [his]1544-me whole face .

" [I]53-robert could n't believe that [my]53-robert letters would be of any interest to [you]2055-you . "[53-robert]

" That is an excuse ; it is n't the truth . "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna reached for [her]115-edna hat on the piano . [She]115-edna adjusted it , sticking the hat pin through the heavy coil of hair with some deliberation .

" Are [you]2055-you not going to wait for [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz ? "[53-robert] asked [Robert]53-robert .

" No ; [I]115-edna have found when [she]84-mademoiselle reisz is absent this long , [she]84-mademoiselle reisz is liable not to come back till late . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna drew on [her]115-edna gloves , and [Robert]53-robert picked up [his]53-robert hat .

" Wo n't [you]53-robert wait for [her]84-mademoiselle reisz ? "[115-edna] asked [Edna]115-edna .

" Not if [you]53-robert think [she]84-mademoiselle reisz will not be back till late , "[115-edna] adding , as if suddenly aware of some discourtesy in [his]53-robert speech , " and [I]115-edna should miss the pleasure of walking [home]245-home with [you]53-robert . "[115-edna] [Edna]115-edna locked the door and put the key back in its hiding - place .

[They]1545-they went together , picking [their]1545-they way across [muddy streets]1546-muddy streets and sidewalks encumbered with the cheap display of [small tradesmen]1547-small tradesmen . Part of the distance [they]1545-they rode in [the car]1111-the car , and after disembarking , passed [the Pontellier mansion]1549-the pontellier mansion , which looked broken and half torn asunder . [Robert]53-robert had never known [the house]157-the house , and looked at [it]157-the house with interest .

" [I]53-robert never knew [you]115-edna in [[your]115-edna home]2060-your home , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert remarked .

" [I]1547-small tradesmen am glad [you]115-edna did not . "[1547-small tradesmen]

" Why ? "[115-edna] [She]115-edna did not answer . [They]1545-they went on around the corner , and it seemed as if [her]115-edna dreams were coming true after all , when [he]53-robert followed [her]115-edna into [the little house]1378-the little house .

" [You]115-edna must stay and dine with [me]115-edna , [Robert]53-robert . [You]115-edna see [I]115-edna am all alone , and it is so long since [I]115-edna have seen [you]115-edna . There is so much [I]115-edna want to ask [you]115-edna . "[115-edna]

[She]115-edna took off [her]115-edna hat and gloves . [He]53-robert stood irresolute , making some excuse about [[his]53-robert mother]208-his mother who expected [him]53-robert ; [he]53-robert even muttered something about an engagement . [She]115-edna struck a match and lit the lamp on the table ; it was growing dusk . When [he]53-robert saw [her]115-edna face in the lamp - light , looking pained , with all the soft lines gone out of it , [he]53-robert threw [his]53-robert hat aside and seated [himself]53-robert .

" Oh ! [you]115-edna know [I]53-robert want to stay if [you]115-edna will let [me]53-robert ! "[53-robert] [he]53-robert exclaimed . All the softness came back . [She]115-edna laughed , and went and put [her]115-edna hand on [his]53-robert shoulder .

" This is the first moment [you]53-robert have seemed like the old [Robert]53-robert . [I]115-edna 'll go tell [Celestine]129-celestine . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna hurried away to tell [Celestine]129-celestine to set an extra place . [She]115-edna even sent [her]115-edna off in search of some added delicacy which [she]115-edna had not thought of for [herself]115-edna . And [she]115-edna recommended great care in dripping the coffee and having the omelet done to a proper turn .

When [she]115-edna reentered , [Robert]53-robert was turning over magazines , sketches , and things that lay upon the table in great disorder . [He]53-robert picked up a photograph , and exclaimed :

" [Alc e Arobin]77-arobin ! What on earth is [his]53-robert picture doing [here]1819-here ? "[53-robert]

" [I]115-edna tried to make a sketch of [his]53-robert head one day , "[115-edna] answered [Edna]115-edna , " and [he]53-robert thought the photograph might help [me]115-edna . It was at [the other house]1386-the other house . [I]115-edna thought it had been left [there]204-there . [I]115-edna must have packed it up with [my]115-edna drawing materials . "[115-edna]

" [I]53-robert should think [you]115-edna would give it back to [him]53-robert if [you]115-edna have finished with it . "[53-robert]

" Oh ! [I]53-robert have a great many such photographs . [I]53-robert never think of returning them . They do n't amount to anything . "[53-robert] [Robert]53-robert kept on looking at the picture .

" It seems to [me]53-robert do [you]115-edna think [his]53-robert head worth drawing ? Is [he]53-robert a friend of [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's ? [You]115-edna never said [you]115-edna knew [him]53-robert . "[53-robert]

" [He]53-robert is n't [a friend of [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier 's]2064-a friend of mr. pontellier 's ; [he]53-robert 's [a friend of mine]2065-a friend of mine . [I]53-robert always knew [him]53-robert that is , it is only of late that [I]53-robert know [him]53-robert pretty well . But [I]53-robert 'd rather talk about [you]115-edna , and know what [you]115-edna have been seeing and doing and feeling out there in [Mexico]4-mexico . "[53-robert] [Robert]53-robert threw aside the picture .

" [I]53-robert 've been seeing the waves and [the white beach of [Grand Isle]1-grand isle]2066-the white beach of grand isle ; [the quiet , grassy street of the _ Ch ni re]2067-the quiet , grassy street of the _ ch ni re ; _ [the old fort at [Grande Terre]17-grande terre]2068-the old fort at grande terre . [I]53-robert 've been working like a machine , and feeling like [a lost soul]2069-a lost soul . There was nothing interesting . "[53-robert]

[She]1553-her leaned [her]1553-her head upon [her]1553-her hand to shade [her]1553-her eyes from the light .

" And what have [you]1553-her been seeing and doing and feeling all these days ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert asked .

" [I]1553-her 've been seeing the waves and [the white beach of [Grand Isle]1-grand isle]2066-the white beach of grand isle ; [the quiet , grassy street of the _ Ch ni re Caminada]2071-the quiet , grassy street of the _ ch ni re caminada ; _ [the old sunny fort at [Grande Terre]17-grande terre]2072-the old sunny fort at grande terre . [I]1553-her 've been working with a little more comprehension than a machine , and still feeling like [a lost soul]2069-a lost soul . There was nothing interesting . "[1553-her]

" [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier , [you]52-mrs. pontellier are cruel , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said , with feeling , closing [his]53-robert eyes and resting [his]53-robert head back in [his]53-robert chair . [They]1554-they remained in silence till [old Celestine]129-celestine announced dinner .

XXXIV

[The dining - room]278-the dining - room was very small . [Edna]115-edna 's round mahogany would have almost filled [it]278-the dining - room . As it was there was but a step or two from the little table to [the kitchen]504-the kitchen , to the mantel , the small buffet , and the side door that opened out on the narrow brick - paved yard .

A certain degree of ceremony settled upon [them]1554-they with the announcement of dinner . There was no return to [personalities]1557-personalities . [Robert]53-robert related incidents of [his]53-robert sojourn in [Mexico]4-mexico , and [Edna]115-edna talked of events likely to interest [him]53-robert , which had occurred during [his]53-robert absence . The dinner was of ordinary quality , except for the few delicacies which [she]115-edna had sent out to purchase . [Old Celestine]129-celestine , with a bandana _ tignon _ twisted about [her]129-celestine head , hobbled in and out , taking a personal interest in everything ; and [she]129-celestine lingered occasionally to talk patois with [Robert]53-robert , whom [she]129-celestine had known as [a boy]1558-a boy .

[He]53-robert went out to [a neighboring cigar stand]1559-a neighboring cigar stand to purchase cigarette papers , and when [he]53-robert came back [he]53-robert found that [Celestine]129-celestine had served the black coffee in [the parlor]1463-the parlor .

" Perhaps [I]53-robert should n't have come back , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said . " When [you]129-celestine are tired of [me]53-robert , tell [me]53-robert to go . "[53-robert]

" [You]129-celestine never tire [me]53-robert . [You]129-celestine must have forgotten the hours and hours at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle in which [we]2074-we grew accustomed to [each other]183-each other and used to being together . "[53-robert]

" [I]53-robert have forgotten nothing at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert said , not looking at [her]1561-her , but rolling a cigarette . [His]53-robert tobacco pouch , which [he]53-robert laid upon the table , was a fantastic embroidered silk affair , evidently the handiwork of [a woman]1753-a woman .

" [You]53-robert used to carry [your]53-robert tobacco in a rubber pouch , "[115-edna] said [Edna]115-edna , picking up the pouch and examining the needlework .

" Yes ; it was lost . "[53-robert]

" Where did [you]53-robert buy this one ? In [Mexico]4-mexico ? "[1753-a woman]

" It was given to [me]53-robert by [a Vera Cruz girl]2076-a vera cruz girl ; [they]2076-a vera cruz girl are very generous , "[53-robert] [he]53-robert replied , striking a match and lighting [his]53-robert cigarette .

" [They]2076-a vera cruz girl are very handsome , [I]1753-a woman suppose , [those Mexican women]2077-those mexican women ; very picturesque , with [their]2076-a vera cruz girl black eyes and [their]2076-a vera cruz girl lace scarfs . "[1753-a woman]

" Some are ; others are hideous , just as [you]53-robert find [women]635-women everywhere . "[1753-a woman]

" What was [she]2076-a vera cruz girl like the one who gave [you]53-robert the pouch ? [You]53-robert must have known [her]2076-a vera cruz girl very well . "[1753-a woman]

" [She]2076-a vera cruz girl was very ordinary . [She]2076-a vera cruz girl was n't of the slightest importance . [I]1753-a woman knew [her]2076-a vera cruz girl well enough . "[1753-a woman]

" Did [you]53-robert visit at [[her]2076-a vera cruz girl house]2079-her house ? Was it interesting ? [I]1753-a woman should like to know and hear about [the people [you]53-robert met]2080-the people you met , and the impressions [they]2080-the people you met made on [you]53-robert . "[1753-a woman]

" There are [some people who leave impressions not so lasting as the imprint of an oar upon the water]2081-some people who leave impressions not so lasting as the imprint of an oar upon the water . "[1753-a woman]

" Was [she]2076-a vera cruz girl such [a one]2082-a one ? "[1753-a woman]

" It would be ungenerous for [me]1563-me to admit that [she]2076-a vera cruz girl was of that order and kind . "[1563-me] [He]1563-me thrust the pouch back in [his]1563-me pocket , as if to put away the subject with the trifle which had brought it up .

[Arobin]77-arobin dropped in with a message from [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman , to say that the card party was postponed on account of the illness of [one of [[her]122-mrs. merriman children]306-her children]1564-one of her children .

" How do [you]77-arobin do , [Arobin]77-arobin ? "[53-robert] said [Robert]53-robert , rising from the obscurity .

" Oh ! [Lebrun]2083-lebrun . To be sure ! [I]122-mrs. merriman heard yesterday [you]77-arobin were back . How did [they]2084-they treat [you]77-arobin down in [Mexique]41-mexique ? "[122-mrs. merriman]

" Fairly well . "[122-mrs. merriman]

" But not well enough to keep [you]77-arobin [there]204-there . [Stunning girls]2086-stunning girls , though , in [Mexico]4-mexico . [I]122-mrs. merriman thought [I]122-mrs. merriman should never get away from [Vera Cruz]23-vera cruz when [I]122-mrs. merriman was down there a couple of years ago . "[122-mrs. merriman]

" Did [they]2084-they embroider slippers and tobacco pouches and hat - bands and things for [you]77-arobin ? "[122-mrs. merriman] asked [Edna]115-edna .

" Oh ! [my]122-mrs. merriman ! no ! [I]122-mrs. merriman did n't get so deep in [their]2084-they regard . [I]122-mrs. merriman fear [they]2084-they made more impression on [me]122-mrs. merriman than [I]122-mrs. merriman made on [them]2084-they . "[122-mrs. merriman]

" [You]77-arobin were less fortunate than [Robert]53-robert , then . "[122-mrs. merriman]

" [I]122-mrs. merriman am always less fortunate than [Robert]53-robert . Has [he]53-robert been imparting tender confidences ? "[122-mrs. merriman]

" [I]53-robert 've been imposing [myself]53-robert long enough , "[53-robert] said [Robert]53-robert , rising , and shaking hands with [Edna]115-edna . " Please convey [my]53-robert regards to [Mr. Pontellier]49-mr. pontellier when [you]115-edna write . "[53-robert]

[He]53-robert shook hands with [Arobin]77-arobin and went away .

" [Fine fellow]2087-fine fellow , [that Lebrun]53-robert , "[77-arobin] said [Arobin]77-arobin when [Robert]53-robert had gone . " [I]53-robert never heard [you]115-edna speak of [him]2087-fine fellow . "[53-robert]

" [I]115-edna knew [him]2087-fine fellow last summer at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna replied . " Here is that photograph of [yours]115-edna . Do n't [you]115-edna want it ? "[115-edna]

" What do [I]115-edna want with it ? Throw it away . "[115-edna] [She]115-edna threw it back on the table .

" [I]115-edna 'm not going to [Mrs. Merriman]122-mrs. merriman 's , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said . " If [you]115-edna see [her]122-mrs. merriman , tell [her]122-mrs. merriman so . But perhaps [I]115-edna had better write . [I]115-edna think [I]115-edna shall write now , and say that [I]115-edna am sorry [[her]122-mrs. merriman child]2088-her child is sick , and tell [her]122-mrs. merriman not to count on [me]115-edna . "[115-edna]

" It would be a good scheme , "[77-arobin] acquiesced [Arobin]77-arobin . " [I]77-arobin do n't blame [you]115-edna ; [stupid lot]2089-stupid lot ! "[77-arobin]

[Edna]115-edna opened the blotter , and having procured paper and pen , began to write the note . [Arobin]77-arobin lit a cigar and read the evening paper , which [he]77-arobin had in [his]77-arobin pocket .

" What is the date ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked . [He]77-arobin told [her]115-edna .

" Will [you]115-edna mail this for [me]77-arobin when [you]115-edna go out ? "[77-arobin]

" Certainly . "[77-arobin] [He]77-arobin read to [her]115-edna little bits out of the newspaper , while [she]115-edna straightened things on the table .

" What do [you]115-edna want to do ? "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin asked , throwing aside the paper . " Do [you]115-edna want to go out for a walk or a drive or anything ? It would be a fine night to drive . "[77-arobin]

" No ; [I]77-arobin do n't want to do anything but just be quiet . [You]115-edna go away and amuse [yourself]115-edna . Do n't stay . "[77-arobin]

" [I]77-arobin 'll go away if [I]77-arobin must ; but [I]77-arobin sha n't amuse [myself]77-arobin . [You]115-edna know that [I]77-arobin only live when [I]77-arobin am near [you]115-edna . "[77-arobin]

[He]77-arobin stood up to bid [her]115-edna good night .

" Is that one of the things [you]77-arobin always say to [women]635-women ? "[77-arobin]

" [I]77-arobin have said it before , but [I]77-arobin do n't think [I]77-arobin ever came so near meaning it , "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin answered with a smile . There were no warm lights in [her]115-edna eyes ; only a dreamy , absent look .

" Good night . [I]77-arobin adore [you]115-edna . Sleep well , "[77-arobin] [he]77-arobin said , and [he]77-arobin kissed [her]115-edna hand and went away .

[She]115-edna stayed alone in a kind of reverie a sort of stupor . Step by step [she]115-edna lived over every instant of the time [she]115-edna had been with [Robert]53-robert after [he]53-robert had entered [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's door . [She]115-edna recalled [his]53-robert words , [his]53-robert looks . How few and meager they had been for [her]115-edna hungry heart ! A vision a transcendently seductive vision of [a Mexican girl]1566-a mexican girl arose before [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna writhed with a jealous pang . [She]115-edna wondered when [he]53-robert would come back . [He]53-robert had not said [he]53-robert would come back . [She]115-edna had been with [him]53-robert , had heard [his]53-robert voice and touched [his]53-robert hand . But some way [he]53-robert had seemed nearer to [her]115-edna off there in [Mexico]4-mexico .

XXXV

The morning was full of sunlight and hope . [Edna]115-edna could see before [her]115-edna no denial only the promise of excessive joy . [She]115-edna lay in bed awake , with bright eyes full of speculation . " [He]53-robert loves [you]115-edna , [poor fool]1997-poor fool . "[115-edna] If [she]115-edna could but get that conviction firmly fixed in [her]115-edna mind , what mattered about the rest ? [She]115-edna felt [she]115-edna had been childish and unwise the night before in giving [herself]115-edna over to despondency . [She]115-edna recapitulated the motives which no doubt explained [[Robert]53-robert 's reserve]1567-robert 's reserve . They were not insurmountable ; they would not hold if [he]53-robert really loved [her]115-edna ; [they]1568-they could not hold against [her]115-edna own passion , which [he]53-robert must come to realize in time . [She]115-edna pictured [him]53-robert going to [[his]53-robert business]262-his business that morning . [She]115-edna even saw how [he]53-robert was dressed ; how [he]53-robert walked down [one street]1570-one street , and turned the corner of another ; saw [him]53-robert bending over [his]53-robert desk , talking to [people who entered [the office]1572-the office , going to [his]53-robert lunch , and perhaps watching for [her]115-edna on [the street]244-the street]1571-people who entered the office , going to his lunch , and perhaps watching for her on the street . [He]53-robert would come to [her]115-edna in the afternoon or evening , sit and roll [his]53-robert cigarette , talk a little , and go away as [he]53-robert had done the night before . But how delicious it would be to have [him]53-robert there with [her]115-edna ! [She]115-edna would have no regrets , nor seek to penetrate [his]53-robert reserve if [he]53-robert still chose to wear it .

[Edna]115-edna ate [her]115-edna breakfast only half dressed . [The maid]951-the maid brought [her]115-edna a delicious printed scrawl from [Raoul]58-raoul , expressing [his]58-raoul love , asking [her]115-edna to send [him]58-raoul some bonbons , and telling [her]115-edna [they]1575-they had found that morning ten tiny white pigs all lying in a row beside [Lidie]137-lidie 's big white pig .

A letter also came from [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband , saying [he]186-her husband hoped to be back early in March , and then [they]1575-they would get ready for that journey abroad which [he]186-her husband had promised [her]115-edna so long , which [he]186-her husband felt now fully able to afford ; [he]186-her husband felt able to travel as [people]904-people should , without any thought of small economies thanks to [his]186-her husband recent speculations in [Wall Street]42-wall street .

Much to [her]115-edna surprise [she]115-edna received a note from [Arobin]77-arobin , written at midnight from [the club]1888-the club . It was to say good morning to [her]115-edna , to hope [she]115-edna had slept well , to assure [her]115-edna of [his]186-her husband devotion , which [he]186-her husband trusted [she]115-edna in some faintest manner returned .

All these letters were pleasing to [her]115-edna . [She]115-edna answered [the children]239-the children in a cheerful frame of mind , promising [them]239-the children bonbons , and congratulating [them]239-the children upon [their]239-the children happy find of the little pigs .

[She]115-edna answered [[her]115-edna husband]186-her husband with friendly evasiveness , not with any fixed design to mislead [him]186-her husband , only because all sense of reality had gone out of [her]115-edna life ; [she]115-edna had abandoned [herself]115-edna to Fate , and awaited the consequences with indifference .

To [Arobin]77-arobin 's note [she]115-edna made no reply . [She]115-edna put it under [Celestine]129-celestine 's stove - lid .

[Edna]115-edna worked several hours with much spirit . [She]115-edna saw [no one]312-no one but [a picture dealer , who asked [her]115-edna if it were true that [she]115-edna was going abroad to study in [Paris]34-paris]1582-a picture dealer , who asked her if it were true that she was going abroad to study in paris .

[She]115-edna said possibly [she]115-edna might , and [he]186-her husband negotiated with [her]115-edna for some Parisian studies to reach [him]186-her husband in time for the holiday trade in December .

[Robert]53-robert did not come that day . [She]115-edna was keenly disappointed . [He]53-robert did not come the following day , nor the next . Each morning [she]115-edna awoke with hope , and each night [she]115-edna was a prey to despondency . [She]115-edna was tempted to seek [him]53-robert out . But far from yielding to the impulse , [she]115-edna avoided any occasion which might throw [her]115-edna in [his]53-robert way . [She]115-edna did not go to [Mademoiselle Reisz]84-mademoiselle reisz 's nor pass by [Madame Lebrun]50-madame lebrun 's , as [she]115-edna might have done if [he]53-robert had still been in [Mexico]4-mexico .

When [Arobin]77-arobin , one night , urged [her]115-edna to drive with [him]77-arobin , [she]115-edna went out to [the lake]1496-the lake , on [the Shell Road]43-the shell road . [His]77-arobin horses were full of mettle , and even a little unmanageable . [She]115-edna liked the rapid gait at which [they]1584-they spun along , and the quick , sharp sound of the horses ' hoofs on [the hard road]1585-the hard road . [They]1584-they did not stop anywhere to eat or to drink . [Arobin]77-arobin was not needlessly imprudent . But [they]1584-they ate and [they]1584-they drank when [they]1584-they regained [[Edna]115-edna 's little dining - room]1586-edna 's little dining - room which was comparatively early in the evening .

It was late when [he]77-arobin left [her]115-edna . It was getting to be more than a passing whim with [Arobin]77-arobin to see [her]115-edna and be with [her]115-edna . [He]77-arobin had detected the latent sensuality , which unfolded under [his]77-arobin delicate sense of [her]115-edna nature 's requirements like a torpid , torrid , sensitive blossom .

There was no despondency when [she]115-edna fell asleep that night ; nor was there hope when [she]115-edna awoke in the morning .

XXXVI

There was [a garden]1587-a garden out in [the suburbs]1588-the suburbs ; [a small , leafy corner , with a few green tables under the orange trees]1589-a small , leafy corner , with a few green tables under the orange trees . [An old cat]1590-an old cat slept all day on the stone step in the sun , and [an old _ mulatresse _]1591-an old _ mulatresse _ slept [her]1591-an old _ mulatresse _ idle hours away in [her]1591-an old _ mulatresse _ chair at the open window , till [some one]538-some one happened to knock on one of the green tables . [She]115-edna had milk and cream cheese to sell , and bread and butter . There was [no one who could make such excellent coffee]1593-no one who could make such excellent coffee or fry a chicken so golden brown as [she]115-edna .

[The place]1080-the place was too modest to attract the attention of [people of fashion]1595-people of fashion , and so quiet as to have escaped the notice of [those in search of pleasure and dissipation]1596-those in search of pleasure and dissipation . [Edna]115-edna had discovered [it]1080-the place accidentally one day when the high - board gate stood ajar . [She]115-edna caught sight of a little green table , blotched with the checkered sunlight that filtered through the quivering leaves overhead . Within [she]115-edna had found [the slumbering _ mulatresse _]1597-the slumbering _ mulatresse _ , the drowsy cat , and a glass of milk which reminded [her]115-edna of the milk [she]115-edna had tasted in [Iberville]10-iberville .

[She]115-edna often stopped [there]204-there during [her]115-edna perambulations ; sometimes taking a book with [her]115-edna , and sitting an hour or two under the trees when [she]115-edna found [the place]1080-the place deserted . Once or twice [she]115-edna took a quiet dinner [there]204-there alone , having instructed [Celestine]129-celestine beforehand to prepare no dinner at [home]245-home . It was [the last place in [the city]261-the city where [she]115-edna would have expected to meet [any one [she]115-edna knew]1604-any one she knew]1602-the last place in the city where she would have expected to meet any one she knew .

Still [she]115-edna was not astonished when , as [she]115-edna was partaking of a modest dinner late in the afternoon , looking into an open book , stroking the cat , which had made friends with [her]115-edna [she]115-edna was not greatly astonished to see [Robert]53-robert come in at [the tall garden gate]1605-the tall garden gate .

" [I]115-edna am destined to see [you]53-robert only by accident , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said , shoving the cat off the chair beside [her]115-edna . [He]53-robert was surprised , ill at ease , almost embarrassed at meeting [her]115-edna thus so unexpectedly .

" Do [you]115-edna come [here]1819-here often ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert asked .

" [I]115-edna almost live [here]1819-here , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said .

" [I]53-robert used to drop in very often for a cup of [Catiche]139-catiche 's good coffee . This is the first time since [I]53-robert came back . "[53-robert]

" [She]139-catiche 'll bring [you]115-edna a plate , and [you]115-edna will share [my]53-robert dinner . There 's always enough for two even three . "[53-robert] [Edna]115-edna had intended to be indifferent and as reserved as [he]53-robert when [she]115-edna met [him]53-robert ; [she]115-edna had reached the determination by a laborious train of reasoning , incident to one of [her]115-edna despondent moods . But [her]115-edna resolve melted when [she]115-edna saw [him]53-robert before designing [Providence]140-providence had led [him]53-robert into [her]115-edna path .

" Why have [you]53-robert kept away from [me]115-edna , [Robert]53-robert ? "[115-edna] [she]115-edna asked , closing the book that lay open upon the table .

" Why are [you]53-robert so personal , [Mrs. Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier ? Why do [you]53-robert force [me]53-robert to idiotic subterfuges ? "[53-robert] [he]53-robert exclaimed with sudden warmth . " [I]53-robert suppose there 's no use telling [you]53-robert [I]53-robert 've been very busy , or that [I]53-robert 've been sick , or that [I]53-robert 've been to see [you]53-robert and not found [you]53-robert at [home]245-home . Please let [me]53-robert off with any one of these excuses . "[53-robert]

" [You]53-robert are the embodiment of selfishness , "[115-edna] [she]115-edna said . " [You]53-robert save [yourself]53-robert something [I]115-edna do n't know what but there is some selfish motive , and in sparing [yourself]53-robert [you]53-robert never consider for a moment what [I]115-edna think , or how [I]115-edna feel [your]53-robert neglect and indifference . [I]115-edna suppose this is what [you]53-robert would call unwomanly ; but [I]115-edna have got into a habit of expressing [myself]115-edna . It does n't matter to [me]115-edna , and [you]53-robert may think [me]115-edna unwomanly if [you]53-robert like . "[115-edna]

" No ; [I]53-robert only think [you]53-robert cruel , as [I]53-robert said the other day . Maybe not intentionally cruel ; but [you]53-robert seem to be forcing [me]53-robert into disclosures which can result in nothing ; as if [you]53-robert would have [me]53-robert bare a wound for the pleasure of looking at it , without the intention or power of healing it . "[53-robert]

" [I]115-edna 'm spoiling [your]1606-you dinner , [Robert]53-robert ; never mind what [I]115-edna say . [You]1606-you have n't eaten a morsel . "[115-edna]

" [I]1606-you only came in for a cup of coffee . "[1606-you] [His]1606-you sensitive face was all disfigured with excitement .

" Is n't this a delightful place ? "[1607-i] [she]1607-i remarked . " [I]1607-i am so glad it has never actually been discovered . It is so quiet , so sweet , here . Do [you]1606-you notice there is scarcely a sound to be heard ? It 's so out of the way ; and a good walk from [the car]1111-the car . However , [I]1607-i do n't mind walking . [I]1607-i always feel so sorry for [women who do n't like to walk]2096-women who do n't like to walk ; [they]2096-women who do n't like to walk miss so much so many rare little glimpses of life ; and [we]2097-we [women]635-women learn so little of life on the whole . "[1607-i]

" [Catiche]139-catiche 's coffee is always hot . [I]543-friends do n't know how [she]1607-i manages it , here in the open air . [Celestine]129-celestine 's coffee gets cold bringing it from [the kitchen]504-the kitchen to [the dining - room]278-the dining - room . Three lumps ! How can [you]1606-you drink it so sweet ? Take some of the cress with [your]1606-you chop ; it 's so biting and crisp . Then there 's the advantage of being able to smoke with [your]1606-you coffee out here . Now , in [the city]261-the city are n't [you]1606-you going to smoke ? "[543-friends]

" After a while , "[1608-he] [he]1608-he said , laying a cigar on the table .

" Who gave it to [you]1608-he ? "[1609-her] [she]1609-her laughed .

" [I]1609-her bought it . [I]1609-her suppose [I]1609-her 'm getting reckless ; [I]1609-her bought a whole box . "[1609-her] [She]1609-her was determined not to be personal again and make [him]1608-he uncomfortable .

The cat made [friends]543-friends with [him]1608-he , and climbed into [his]1608-he lap when [he]1608-he smoked [his]1608-he cigar . [He]1608-he stroked [her]1609-her silky fur , and talked a little about [her]1609-her . [He]1608-he looked at [Edna]115-edna 's book , which [he]1608-he had read ; and [he]1608-he told [her]1609-her the end , to save [her]1609-her the trouble of wading through it , [he]1608-he said .

Again [he]1608-he accompanied [her]1609-her back to [[her]1609-her home]1346-her home ; and it was after dusk when [they]1612-they reached [the little " pigeon - house]2102-the little " pigeon - house . "[1608-he] [She]1609-her did not ask [him]1608-he to remain , which [he]1608-he was grateful for , as it permitted [him]1608-he to stay without the discomfort of blundering through an excuse which [he]1608-he had no intention of considering . [He]1608-he helped [her]1609-her to light the lamp ; then [she]1609-her went into [[her]1609-her room]224-her room to take off [her]1609-her hat and to bathe [her]1609-her face and hands .

When [she]1609-her came back [Robert]53-robert was not examining the pictures and magazines as before ; [he]53-robert sat off in the shadow , leaning [his]53-robert head back on the chair as if in a reverie . [Edna]115-edna lingered a moment beside the table , arranging the books there . Then [she]1609-her went across [the room]522-the room to where [he]1608-he sat . [She]1609-her bent over the arm of [his]1608-he chair and called [his]1608-he name .

" [Robert]53-robert , "[1609-her] [she]1609-her said , " are [you]1608-he asleep ? "[1609-her]

" No , "[1608-he] [he]1608-he answered , looking up at [her]1609-her .

[She]1609-her leaned over and kissed [him]1608-he a soft , cool , delicate kiss , whose voluptuous sting penetrated [his]1608-he whole being then [she]1609-her moved away from [him]1608-he . [He]1608-he followed , and took [her]1609-her in [his]1608-he arms , just holding [her]1609-her close to [him]1608-he . [She]1609-her put [her]1609-her hand up to [his]1608-he face and pressed [his]1608-he cheek against [her]1609-her own . The action was full of love and tenderness . [He]1608-he sought [her]1609-her lips again . Then [he]1608-he drew [her]1609-her down upon the sofa beside [him]1608-he and held [her]1609-her hand in both of [his]1608-he .

" Now [you]1609-her know , "[1608-he] [he]1608-he said , " now [you]1609-her know what [I]1608-he have been fighting against since last summer at [Grand Isle]1-grand isle ; what drove [me]1608-he away and drove [me]1608-he back again . "[1608-he]

" Why have [you]1608-he been fighting against it ? "[1609-her] [she]1609-her asked . [Her]1609-her face glowed with soft lights .

" Why ? Because [you]1608-he were not free ; [you]1608-he were L once [[Pontellier]52-mrs. pontellier 's wife]2103-pontellier 's wife . [I]1609-her could n't help loving [you]1608-he if [you]1608-he were ten times [[his]1615-his wife]179-his wife ; but so long as [I]1609-her went away from [you]1608-he and kept away [I]1609-her could help telling [you]1608-he so . "[1609-her] [She]1609-her put [her]1609-her free hand up to [his]1615-his shoulder , and then against [his]1615-his cheek , rubbing it softly . [He]1615-his kissed [her]1609-her again . [His]1615-his face was warm and flushed .

" There in [Mexico]4-mexico [I]1609-her was thinking of [you]1608-he all the time , and longing for [you]1608-he . "[1609-her]

" But not writing to [me]1609-her , "[1609-her] [she]1609-her interrupted .

" Something put into [my]1609-her head that [you]1608-he cared for [me]1609-her ; and [I]1609-her lost [my]1609-her senses . [I]1609-her forgot everything but a wild dream of [your]1608-he some way becoming [[my]1609-her wife]1936-my wife . "[1609-her]

" [[Your]1615-his wife]1952-your wife ! "[1609-her]

" Religion , loyalty , everything would give way if only [you]1615-his cared . "[1609-her]

" Then [you]1615-his must have forgotten that [I]1609-her was [L]57-l once [[Pontellier]57-l 's wife]2103-pontellier 's wife . "[1609-her]
